When he’s not busy designing, he’s probably either at Crossfit or working to improve his culinary skills… or contemplating the conflicts that occasionally arise between the two.

Andrea has spent a lengthy career knee-deep in interactive design. Today she finds great satisfaction in her dream job at YNAB where design and helping others converge—the perfect environment for empathic-driven design. After work, this compulsive doodler cherishes her time with her husband and kids. Soaking up live music, art, and setting sail on the occasional cruise are among her favorite to-dos.

Cindy sweats the small details when it comes to crafting simple, intuitive experiences. She loves having conversations with our users, and digs deep to find the root of their needs before exploring a solution. On most weekends (and some weekdays, depending on the daylight saving time), you can probably find her outdoors chasing sunrise and sunset with a camera in hand. 

Dylan loves organizing design systems, obsessing over typographic details, and everything in between. Above his desk (ahem, kitchen table, it’s a small apartment after all) sits an inconspicuous letterpressed card with Dieter Rams’ 10 principles of good design on it. In his spare time he’s probably taking photos or running—sometimes at the same time. 

Emily is a design generalist, through and through. What she loves most about being a designer—besides the obvious draw of working with a team to build things people love—is how much there is to learn. Right now she’s focused on honing her coding skills enough to be able to put up the occasional pull request as well as practicing the art of writing great microcopy. She enjoys reading books, cooking, biking, lifting weights, and spending time outdoors. 

Kathryn loves to dig into problems and learn where things aren’t working, what people need, and how we can empower them to be even more amazing.  And once she truly understands a problem, figuring out how to solve it is pretty fun. When she’s not at work, she can usually be found reading, conquering escape rooms, or hanging out with her family.

How You’ll Work at YNAB

We work really hard to make working at YNAB an amazing experience. In fact, we were recently recognized as Fortune’s #2 best small company to work for in the United States! We have a team full of truly exceptional people—the kind you’ll be excited to work with. Here’s how we operate:

Live Where You Want

We’re a distributed team, so you can live and work wherever you want. Proximity doesn’t influence productivity. Taylor, our CTO, was traveling who-knows-where for a couple of years before he bought a farm. Up and move to France for a year? Sure, Todd did that. Don’t like France? How about London, where Janelle trotted off to. Tulsa Remote? Can do. Or if you just love LA or Baltimore or Buenos Aires, we’ve got people there, too.  Not all of us move around, but the fact that these folks have is totally okay because we’re all adults. Just make sure you have a reliable internet connection.

No Crazy Hours

We rarely work more than 40 hours per week. There have been a few occasions where things got a little crazy and people had to log some extra hours. But then they took some extra time off, so it all balances out. We work hard and smart but we’re in this for the long haul, no need to go crazy on the hours.

Take Vacation (Seriously)

We want you to take vacation. In fact, we have a minimum vacation policy of three weeks per year. Five weeks feels about right (plus two extra weeks for Christmas break). It’s important to get out and do something. We’ll look forward to seeing pictures of your vacation in our Slack channel, creatively named #office_wall.

The YNAB Meetup

We get the teams together once a year to catch up on spreadsheets and powerpoints in a Best Western conference room. Just kidding. So far, we’ve done Costa Rica, a gigantic cabin in the mountains, a beach house in the Outer Banks, a ranch in Montana, and we most recently took over an entire hotel in Laguna Beach. We do really fun things, but the highlight always seems to be just hanging out together and having a blast.

Up Your Game

We’re serious about helping you improve your craft. We budget for it (hey-o!). Think conferences, Lynda subscriptions, dedicated time away from work to learn something new… it’s really up to you and your manager. But we love to see our people growing.  

International is Absolutely Okay

If you are Stateside, we’ll set you up as a W2 employee. If you’re international, you’ll be set up as a contractor. Employee or contractor, it’s all the same to us. You’re part of the team. (We are spread all over the world: Switzerland, Scotland, Mexico, Brazil, Argentina, Germany, Canada, and all over the United States.)

If You’re Stateside…

YNAB offers fantastic health, dental, and vision insurance, where we cover 100% of the premium for you and your family. (No need to check your vision, you read that right, 100%. Although if you did need to check your vision, NBD, we’ve got you covered!)

We also have a Traditional and Roth 401k option. YNAB contributes three percent whether you choose to throw any money in there or not. It vests immediately. (Are you a personal finance junkie like our founder Jesse? He set up YNAB’s 401k to have the lowest fee structure possible, where all plan costs are paid by YNAB, not your retirement nest egg. The investment funds available are fantastic, passively-managed, ultra low-cost index funds. You’re not a PF junkie? Trust us, it’s awesome.)

Other Tidbits
  • Once you start, we DEMAND (in a friendly, ALL CAPS IS YELLING way) that you fill out your “Bucket List” spreadsheet with 50 items. (That’s harder than it sounds!) 
  • The bucket list really helps in deciding what we should give you for your birthday and Christmas.
  • We have a bonus plan based on profitability. You’ll be in on that from day one. YNAB wins, you win. That kind of thing.
  • We’re all adults. There’s no need to punch a clock, or ask for permission to take off early one afternoon to go see the doctor (health insurance premium 100% covered!). We look at what you accomplish, not how long you sit (have you tried standing?) in front of a computer.
  • We want you firing on all cylinders so we’ll set you up with a shiny new computer and replace it every three years.
  • Did I mention we make a huge, positive difference in people’s lives? You may not think that matters much, but then a few months down the road you’ll realize it’s made your job really, really enjoyable. Don’t underestimate this one!

If this sounds like your ideal environment, read on because now I want to talk about you. You will play a big, big part in helping YNAB customers achieve success. You will change lives. I’ll only say that six more times.

Now, back to you, our new Product Designer…

 

What Success Looks Like: 

At YNAB, our goal is for our users to achieve life changing financial control. No small thing, right? You’ll join our six product designers, working on both our web and mobile platforms. Throughout 2020, we’ll focus intensely on making YNAB effortless and helping new budgeters get started effectively, from their very first experience. You will also help us develop systems and processes to more efficiently deliver top-notch, dare we say life-changing, experiences to our users.

You’ll need to: 

  • Understand the journey our users take, not just as they use our apps, but in the real world as they seek to take control of their financial lives.
  • Learn the design system, UI patterns, and financial logic of our apps like the back of your hand. You have no problem designing a cross-platform feature for the web and mobile apps. You can clearly discern and navigate the relationship between the UI and the available data behind the scenes. 
  • Solve design problems in a user-centric feedback loop. Research plays a big part in our design process so you’ll need to break down analytics and user feedback to make informed design decisions. You’ll also follow up on the data gathered after the feature is released and continue to iterate and improve your designs until the data confirms success. 
  • Shepherd your work from ideation to release. You will document your work for review with fellow designers, developers, and stakeholders, make agreed-upon refinements, and will work with the developers on the upcoming feature. Design reviews during the development process examine form and function and you will see the feature through to the end. 
  • Be comfortable iterating with low-fidelity designs and prototypes while working in cross-functional teams made up of developers, marketers, and customer-facing team members (waterfalls are for rivers!), while continuing to pursue a meticulous and thorough design.
  • Communicate and document the styling, user flows, and the impact of your designs on other parts of the system. You’ll update this documentation as feedback comes in and the apps evolve. On the flip side, you’ll provide feedback in design reviews that is clear and helpful in moving our products forward.
  • Communicate, explain, persuade, explore and otherwise get all the things done in writing. Yes, we like talking to each other, but as a remote team, much of our collaboration is asynchronous and written.
  • Be comfortable writing a first pass at UI copy which is then refined with the help of your team in design reviews. There’s no lorem ipsum here. 
  • You are comfortable speaking the language of software development. If you’re also comfortable diving into HTML and CSS (or even one of the programming languages in our development stack!) to help implement your design work, that’s a plus, but it’s not a requirement.
  • We use Figma for the vast majority of design work and maintaining our design system. You will aid in the expansion and maintenance of the design system and feel comfortable contributing new UI for our applications and website. If you have experience developing and maintaining design systems and can help us strike a balance between fighting for consistency and pushing the design system forward, that’s another plus.
  • Be comfortable talking to customers in user interviews and usability testing. You have a knack for summarizing research in a concise way to share with teammates. 

Finally, the success of a designer at YNAB hinges upon the ability to approach design as holistic problem solving for both user and business goals. We work collaboratively here and you’ll listen to ideas, questions, and critiques from teammates with grace and patience. That said, you know your stuff and can eloquently and logically explain design decisions. You see this type of exchange as critical to the success of yourself and our product: it is through sharing ideas and being open to the brilliance of others that we arrive at the best solutions. 

And, since our job descriptions are already so long, what’s another sentence or two…

YNAB is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and experiences to be critical to our success and are passionate about creating a welcoming, supportive, and collaborative environment for all employees. All are encouraged to apply as we continue to grow a smart, hard-working, and diverse team who love working together to build something that matters.

How to Apply

  • Apply through the link below (or here: https://ynab.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk03p1u) by 11:59PM on Oct 3rd, 2019. Firm. It’s a real deadline. Like, after it is too late.
  • Attach a pdf of your cover letter. In your cover letter:
    • Introduce yourself and explain why this position is of interest to you, and why you would be a great fit. 
    • We love a designer with a perspective. What’s yours? Feel free to touch on your beliefs on how design should be done, what it’s used for, or why it’s important. 
  • Please include a portfolio that contains the following: 
    • Design work across web and mobile 
    • Your design process (wireframes, interviews, architecture documentation)
    • Links to any live work. 
    • Please state the role you played on each project.
  • If you have a prepared resume, attach it in PDF form. If you don’t have a resume because you aren’t even sure you’re looking to change jobs, that’s fine! An informal list of your work and education history are all we’re looking for.

 

P.S.  If you’re not interested in or available for this position, but know someone who might be, we would really appreciate it if you passed this along!

items.title: Growth Marketing Executive
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Ably is a tech company that provides developer tools and infrastructure for the realtime internet. Chatting on WhatsApp, hailing an Uber, asking Alexa what the weather will be like tomorrow - all of these things rely on complex software and infrastructure. This is what Ably provides.


Here’s just a few things our platform powers: HubSpot’s chat and collaboration products, live score updates for millions of Australian Open tennis fans, and live transit updates for three million Chicagoans.


In the near future, Autonomous Vehicles, IoT devices (e.g. connected fridges or environment sensors), and AI-powered experiences will be the norm. But new infrastructure is required to power it all.


Working at Ably means helping to build that infrastructure and shape the future.


To see what life’s like at Ably, check out our careers page at www.ably.io/careers.


In this role


We are looking for an experienced and creative Growth Marketing Executive to join our team. You will be responsible for developing and implementing our Social Media strategy in order to increase our online presence and improve our marketing and sales efforts, within our developer communities, as well as supporting other growth initiatives such as marketing campaigns and our content management execution.


Responsibilities include:




  • Develop, implement and manage our social media strategy




  • Define important social media KPIs - measure our success




  • Implement acquisition programs via paid and organic marketing channels




  • Be up to date with the latest social media best practices and technologies / tools




  • Monitor SEO and user engagement and suggest content optimization




  • Communicate with industry professionals and influencers via social media to create a strong network




  • Support / drive marketing campaigns taking a data-driven approach 




  • Collaborate across Marketing, Sales and Product teams






Skills & Experience:




  • 3+ years of experience in Performance/Growth Marketing roles ideally in tech.




  • Expertise in multiple social media platforms and best practices




  • In-depth knowledge of SEO, keyword research, Google Analytics, web traffic metrics / KPIs




  • Familiarity and experience engaging with developers and technical communities




  • Familiarity with web design and publishing




  • Bonus: 




    • You have an engineering background or working in an engineering business




    • You’ve worked at a marketing-led subscription business






What’s it like to work at Ably?


Ably is entering a new phase of growth led by an experienced senior team from the likes of E-consultancy and ThoughtWorks. You’ll be part of a successful, highly motivated, and extremely collaborative team.


To provide the infrastructure required for the next generation of the internet, to tell the world about it, and to support everyone inside Ably to do so we hire people who are ready and capable of taking on challenging problems in a high-growth environment.


We want to work in a company of inclusive people who treat each other well. We’re building a company with a diverse set of people who value:




  • Ownership and impact of work. You have real autonomy and ownership over your work with a visible impact inside Ably, and externally on products powered by Ably that you use in your daily life.




  • An environment to thrive. Modern, comfy office in the heart of Camden. Excellent transport links, Camden Food Market with over 100 food stalls and restaurants, and multiple work spaces to match your working style.




  • Work from home when you need. We offer the option to work from home when you need to be home, but the role is office-based.




  • Work is varied and challenging as we’re solving hard, complex problems that push the limits of what’s possible with today’s software and infrastructure.




Perks:




  • Health insurance




  • Gym membership




  • Regular company away days and social events




  • Weekly team breakfast or lunch




  • Free drinks and snacks in the office




  • Ongoing professional development (training, events, conferences)




  • 25 days of paid annual leave (33 days including bank holidays)




  • Company contributions towards your pension




  • Your choice of high quality tech kit to work on




Ably has a culture that values employee freedom and responsibility. Apply to talk to us to see if this role on an impactful and collaborative team is right for you.

items.title: Social Media and Operations Placement
items.content:
The Company
Nomad Academy exists to bring together those few brave enough to pursue a meaningful life – despite the risks and hardships involved. Our programs combine slow travel with entrepreneurial learning and a select community – to get driven individuals on the path to entrepreneurial careers.

After running 5 programs, with over 120 alumni and 20,000 applications since launching 2 years ago, we’re now looking to grow fast.

 

What you'll be doing

 

Social Media - keep our mulitple social media accounts up to speed.

 

Operations - as you can imagine travelling around the world with groups of young people is a lot of work, we need your help to make these trip a succes. 

 

Design - we create a lot material, for workshops, social media and all other external communications.

 

This is a 6 Month Internship - ideally starting in October. 

 

During this internship there will be lots of opportunities to also grow in to other parts of the business or to specialise in any of the above.  There will potentially also be the option to stay with us after the initial 6 months.

 

Ideally you will


Be a superfan of personal growth...ranging from EQ to growth mindsets and the habits that underpin

remarkable lives ... and so much more

 

Be a very fast learner and adaptable...as any start ups we get a lot of curve balls so there is never a dull moment.

 

Useful but not compulsory...

 

Have experience in either Social Media, Operations or Design, however, we do have a history of hiring anomalies so if you are the type of person who is simply good at a lot of things we definitely want to hear from you.

 

Speak a second European language.

 

About You

You have Charisma - You’re brave, willing to take risks, and challenge people. You can inspire people by infusing your work with excitement, meaning and personality.


 

You're Curious – Constantly bettering yourself and open to new teachings. You can work Autonomously

– You’re a self starter, get shit done and take on responsibility with relish.

 

You have a High EQ  and are ready to collaborate with the rest of the team



 

What we're offering


Active, accelerated personal growth. We guarantee that working with us will be fun, hard and intense... and you will be changed by it for the better. 

 

Company retreats that happen all around the world a few times a year.

 

Work whenever you want to in the day, however you like to.

 

Monthly training and professional learning budget.

 

Wackiness on tap. Be yourseful fully; we take our work seriously but don’t take ourselves too

seriously, and are friends as much as a team.


 

We are open to acting as a placement for people finishing their studies who require work experience.

items.content:
Digital Marketing Support Specialist at WhatConverts

Remote
  • Charlotte, NC – Remote OK
  • Full-Time

Are you someone who loves helping people? If you love interacting with people on a daily basis to help them learn how to optimize their work and their time then read on

About You

  • A problem solver with an acute attention to detail
  • Ablity to speak with clarity and authority
  • Ablity to write clearly and concisely
  • A go-getter who enjoys speaking with customers and overcoming objections
  • Experience with Google Ads, Google Analytics, Bing Ads and/or Facebook Ads
  • Empathetic to users and can easily put yourself in their shoes
  • Ability to make customers feel empowered after interacting with support and you don’t make them feel bad for asking silly questions
  • Obsessive over the details and love solving problems
  • Persistent as sales & support at WhatConverts is much different than at many software companies, real people answer the phone offering real people solutions. It may not be answering the same questions over and over again, but oftentimes it involves researching nuances of the websites we support and customer-specific scenarios.

Things You Might Do

WhatConverts is a dynamic software company, so you’ll likely get your hands dirty in a little bit of everything. That said, here are some things you’ll get to do:

  • Reach out to new customers via email, telephone & chat as they sign up for proactive customer service, support and sales.
  • Help customers via email, chat and the telephone to ensure they have the best experience possible setting up a new account, troubleshooting their problems and answering their questions.
  • Work with the product team to build tools and offer feedback that will speed up and increase the quality of support.
  • Experiment; this is a startup & your day to day tasks can change at any time.

About WhatConverts

WhatConverts has been helping people across the world track What Marketing Converts. A lead can be a phone call, web form submission, web chat or e-commerce transaction. Our software helps our customers track & optimize their marketing efforts to ensure it is giving them the best ROI.

We want to give advertisers and agencies the complete marketing picture by easily tracking their marketing dollars to actual leads, so they can best spend their budget.

We believe in small teams making a big impact. Small teams are fast and nimble; often leading to less bureaucracy and less management and more getting the important things done.

The Package

  • Location Anywhere you want. If you want to work remotely or near others that’s fine by us. The current team is based in Charlotte, NC and Birmingham, AL.
  • Hours 8AM to 5PM EST (-/+ 3 hours)
  • Position We will consider part-time or full-time positions.
  • Compensation Based on experience.
Apply for job

items.title: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


Hubble is one of the UK’s leading PropTech scaleups and we’re changing the face of commercial property. We’ve raised over £6m in venture funding from the most respected investors in technology and real estate. Our vision is to create a world where everyone has the right workplace to succeed. The beginning of this journey is our online platform to help businesses rent, manage and share office space in London.


As a product designer at Hubble, you will have the opportunity to add your magic to every stage of the design process. Working closely with product managers and tech leads, you will have the autonomy to conjure up functional yet delightful solutions to genuine user problems. All the while working towards business goals.


Your role will of course include wire-framing, prototyping and spinning up high fidelity designs and assets but this is only a small part. Through user testing and internal feedback sessions, you will be responsible for continually testing ideas and assumptions and mixing your findings back into the designs. You will be able to use these findings to explain and defend your design rationale with the wider team and stakeholders. Excellent communication skills, explaining complex solutions in simple terms and the ability to challenge people in the wider team at all levels, backed with evidence, are all crucial.


Strong visual UI design is a given, but beyond that you will be instrumental in following and helping to build out the Hubble design system. You will work closely with our engineers and regularly pair with them to help set the rules and ingredients for new design assets and components. A keen eye for detail is important but you should understand the trade-offs between striving for pixel-perfection against good enough to ship fast.


You will possess a functional but creative mind and a no-fear attitude to your work. With a scientific approach to product design, don't be afraid to fail-fast and learn. You will feel empowered to push the needle, and suggest wildcard ideas that may make some colleagues squirm, but always be grounded in the possible. We build our products in an iterative, continuous deployment style, but as a designer you should always be thinking of where we want to be rather than just what's next.


Our vision to create a world where everyone has the right workplace to succeed starts from within. We're a friendly and diverse team. We go out for team lunches, monthly book, climbing, gaming and DnD clubs (among others) and are always looking for more ways to knowledge share and have fun as a group :). We host quarterly away days (organised by different team members) which are a great opportunity to chat with people who you rarely cross paths with and ensure that our business vision is always clear and transparent to the whole company. Although we're still only small, our team has a mix of different backgrounds, races, and genders and we want to continue this as we grow.


 




REQUIREMENTS



  • Have 3+ years experience in designing digital products.

  • Fully proficient in designing for various screen sizes with a mobile first approach to responsive design.

  • Solid understanding of UX design principles.

  • Good understanding of atomic design and front end architecture.

  • Expertise in the tools of the trade, sketch, invision etc. UI animations desirable but not required.

  • Have the confidence to explain and defend design decisions to colleagues at all levels.

  • Experience in mapping out user journeys and flows.

  • Have experience conducting user research and synthesising customer feedback.

  • An understanding of engineering processes and how stuff gets built.

  • Experience of working in a marketplace or SaaS company is a plus (but not necessary).

  • A self-aware, motivated and empathetic person.




 


BENEFITS


We make sure everyone in the team is comfortable and has the best environment for them. We offer flexible hours, remote working and have a relaxed attitude to taking holiday - focusing only on whether work gets done. Benefits can be tweaked on an individual basis depending on what makes you most productive. Here are some of the things we offer:



  • Remuneration competitive with industry and level of experience.

  • Macbook, peripherals and standing desk.

  • Expense budget & travel.

  • Subsidised Therapy

  • Noise-cancelling headphones.

  • Spotify Premium or Apple Music.

  • Kindle Unlimited + free professional books.

  • Health Insurance & Pension.

  • Cycle to Work scheme.


 


We truly value our people and company culture. Want to know more about why Hubble is a great place to work? Check out this recent blog post.


Hubble is an equal opportunities employer. We are a diverse bunch of people who are committed to maintaining a welcoming culture of inclusion and equality. We encourage applications from anyone that meets the requirements for the role.

items.content:
Sr. Growth Marketing Manager // Your Superfoods

Company: Your Superfoods

Tags:
  • Performance Marketing
  • Growth Marketing

    • WE ARE YOUR SUPER

    We are a fun and fast-moving start-up based on improving people’s lives with the power of (super) plants.

    After closing our US Series A financing round, we are looking to further scale. You have the chance to join the founding team early and become a crucial part of our success story.

    As the Growth Marketing Manager, you will have the chance to work side by side to the founders and executive team. An opportunity unparalleled in this space.

    RESPONSIBILITIES:

    • Responsible for SEM related acquisition channels including Google, Youtube, Bing Ads
    • Responsible for other performance channels (Criteo, Gemini, Adroll)
    • Project management for funnel development and optimization
    • Improving, testing and developing different ad creatives together with design team
    • Set-up growth campaigns across all paid channels
    • Controlling and optimization of all relevant online marketing KPIs
    • Test new growth channels where appropriate
    • Partner up with the Head of Growth in diversifying marketing channels in the EU

    WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR

    • Previous experience (6-8 years) in growth and direct response marketing
    • Excellent analytical skills and a passion for numbers
    • Good communication skills and very solution-focused
    • Excited to scale a company and work in a small ambitious team
    • Fluent in English
    • An individual who is ready to lead a team
    • Experience with DTC brands

    WHY YOUR SUPER

    • Company culture can’t be beat, we love what we do and we are all on a mission to improve people’s health
    • Badass Abbot Kinney / Venice Office
    • We walk the walk! Health/wellness initiatives and perks
    • Free Superfoods
    • An awesome opportunity to help change the world with the power of plants
    • Flexible schedule and remote work opportunities available within the calendar year
    Apply for this position

items.title: Senior Product Manager (Software / Digital Transformation)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About Steer73


Steer73 are a Digital Transformation Agency. We work with a wide variety of clients to understand their needs, shape their product and to deliver the development work. In many cases we are the client’s in-house product, design and development team. 


Our HQ is in London, UK. We have teams in Ukraine and India, plus people working in various other locations around the world. We are a modern business that benefits from a remote and distributed global team.


The role


As a Senior Product Manager you will be expected to lead all product work on several projects. You will lead the investigation and ideation phases, as well as the composition of the product solution. You will be the primary company representative to the client and lead all non-commercial communication. You must be a confident and articulate communicator, conveying the value the company brings to our clients.


You will be confident of making decisions, explaining your processes and thoughts both internally to the team and to our clients, and have experience of consultative agency approaches, where we need to lead the client and not the other way around. 


You will work with the Managing Director where required, and work with a Product Manager to understand the needs of the client, gather the requirements for not just what they say they want, but what they really need. You’ll guide the product team and contribute the internal development of the product team skill sets.  


Working alongside the Managing Director and Product Director you will attend client meetings to discuss the product needs and the proposed solution; including market forces, the company pain points, marketing of the product and overall strategy of the company and the specific product. 


You’ll feed this information back to the clients and confirm all assumptions and hypotheses. Experience of leading product designers and graphic designers would be beneficial. 


You will oversee the Product Managers and Product Owners to make sure they deliver the build process, using Scrum, Kanban or Waterfall methodologies. You will work closely with the QA team to ensure the right quality of product is delivered. 


You will be responsible for estimation of work and the communication of the work, stories and tickets to the development team in a clear and unambiguous way.


You will be working on 3 to 4 client projects at a time, which whilst interesting will also be demanding, and you’ll need be able to clearly prioritise your time and efforts. 


Sounds interesting? It is. Sounds challenging? It really is!


Key tasks


You should have a good knowledge of all product management processes. You should be able to:  


·        Extract client requirements from unclear instructions  


·        Intelligently discuss the client’s product and company strategy in order to lead the client and the product team solution.  


·        Be familiar with greenfield ideation projects, and comfortable working on early stage conceptually fluid projects  


·        Drive action within the product team and the projects you lead 


·        Aim to simplify the proposal rather than complicate the product  


·        Understand the decisions that needs to be made and what information is the minimum requirement for those decisions 


·        Drive best practice through your projects and team 


·        Present clearly and dynamically to clients 


·        Manage project deliverables, including resource planning, project velocity and juggling of competing deadlines 


You should be very comfortable producing the below yourself or assisting the product team on each of the following:  


·        Documenting meeting outcomes and actions 


·        Analysing client requirements 


·        Documenting client requirements 


·        Writing user stories from documented requirements 


·        Writing acceptance criteria and definition of done for user stories 


·        Managing Scrum and using project management tools (e.g. Azure Devops) 


·        Managing Waterfall, Kanban or Agile workflows 


·        Developing wireframes 


·        Creating user flows, and lifecycles 


·        Creating user types and personas  


·        Researching competitors and competitor products 


·        Conducting end user research 


·        Manually testing acceptance criteria from user stories 


·        Working with product managers to refine and agree scope and detail of tasks 


·        Helping a product team with product related work as necessary  


Key skills 


You will need to be able to deliver accurate and detailed documentation, and your skills will reflect this. 


Essential Skills 


·        Excellent written and verbal communication 


·        Highly analytical 


·        Excellent attention to detail 


·        Full SDLC experience 


·        Knowledge of Agile Scrum / Kanban 


·        Ability to write user stories 


·        Ability to write acceptance criteria 


·        Wireframing 


·        QA testing  


Desirable Tools 



  • Azure Devops 

  • Excel, Word, PowerPoint 

  • Wireframing tools 


More about the company 


Steer73 is a small company and an important factor in our hiring is finding people who share our values and who will thrive in our business. 


 


We have a flat management structure and we look for people who want to get things done, are comfortable making decisions, take ownership of their roles, and want to progress. 


 


Joining Steer73 offers you the opportunity to work on high-profile and meaningful projects for a wide range of clients and industries, as part of a company with cross sectoral expertise.

items.content:
Inbound Marketing / SEO Specialist

United States, Illinois
Company: FurstPerson

Overview

We are looking for a motivated marketer to help fuel our inbound funnel! The ideal inbound marketing specialist will be a high-energy, creative and hard-working team member to support our social media, email marketing, online advertising and conversion optimization efforts, in order to grow both our overall database and company revenues. We’re a small, fast-paced team so we need someone with that mindset – someone who learns quickly, is detail-oriented, organized, self-driven, passionate and most importantly, gets things done (well). FurstPerson helps customers achieve better performance and profitability by partnering with HR and Talent Acquisition Teams to create tailored solutions that dramatically improve the quality of hire. The unique blend of high-touch consultation, advanced technology, measurement accuracy, and employment lifecycle analytics enables FurstPerson to build innovative, award-winning pre and post-hire assessments that deliver an average $20:1 return on investment. This is a remote position for job candidates based in the United States or you can work in our Rockford, IL headquarters. Responsibilities and Duties Ongoing competitor analysis to ensure proper keywords are targeted on site and in marketing and other campaignsReviewing and analyzing company website that can be improved and optimizedPreparing detailed strategy reports and presenting recommendations for updates, changes, and improvementsIdentifying powerful keywords to drive the most valuable traffic and implementing approved strategiesAdvising on, creating and monitoring PPC campaignsPartnering with company writers and designers to design and launch effective SEO content for blogs, websites and social media accountsKeeping updated on both white hat and black hat SEO strategies to avoid stay within search engine guidelinesExecute tests, collect and analyze data and results, identify trends and insights in order to achieve maximum ROI in paid search campaignsTrack, report, and analyze website analytics and PPC initiatives and campaignsManage campaign expenses, staying on budget, estimating monthly costs and reconciling discrepancies.Perform ongoing keyword discovery, expansion and optimizationResearch and implement search engine optimization recommendationsResearch and analyze competitor advertising linksDevelop and implement link building strategyEnsure SEO best practices are properly implemented on newly developed code. Must know how to execute codingProactively recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords Professional Skills and Experience Required:Proven expertise in content marketing, content growth and SEOProven expertise of search engine optimization practices and white hat SEOOutstanding ability to think creatively, strategically, and proactively identify and resolve problemsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work within a team and independently3+ years’ experience in Google analytics3+ years with website optimization tools2+ years with Hubspot Marketing Hub and CRM 2+ years in Google Ads and LinkedIn Ad campaignsProven SEM experience managing PPC campaigns in Google and LinkedIn2+ years’ experience with bid management tools3+ years with A/B and multivariate experimentsMust be able to work remotely from the USABachelor’s Degree or relevant work experience FurstPerson is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: FurstPerson is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at FurstPerson are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. FurstPerson will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. FurstPerson encourages applicants of all ages.

items.title: Email and Content Design Marketing Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)

items.content:
About Flora & Curl Haircare


Hello, we’re Flora & Curl! We are a UK based haircare start up formulating products with plant-based ingredients for healthy curls. You can find our botanical haircare products in Denmark, Norway, India, Bermuda, Spain, France, Germany, Switzerland and in the USA. Rooted in science, backed by nature, our beauty products are crafted with care and conscience. We are looking for a creative Social Media Content Design Executive to join our team.


About You


You are a creative thinker who is able to generate engaging and creative content in alignment with a beauty brand. You pride yourself in delivering the high quality and professional work, no matter how big or small the job.


Your Role and Key Responsibilities
Deliver Print and Web ready artwork and content for our social media channels and email campaigns.



  • Deliver creative assets for Flora & Curl Social Media accounts (Instagram stories, posts, Twitter and Facebook) in line with brand and platform guidelines (including still and animated/gifs)

  • Deliver email designs and assets for weekly newsletter campaigns in Mailchimp (ability to code them is a big plus)

  • Process and edit photography and videography files to make them fit-for-use for digital marketing

  • Manage our Asset files, keeping them up-to-date and well-organised at all times

  • Working closely with brand director to maintain marketing schedule and content calendar


We would love to hear from you if you have the following skills:
Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator or InDesign, HTML/CSS
Photography, animation or video editting experience is a plus
Proficiency with Mailchimp and its analytics


Our top candidates would also have:



  • University degree or equivalent, and/or transferable work experience in previous role

  • Experience in writing, developing engaging content and/or copy for a beauty brand or beauty related media.

  • Experience in social media management and managing a marketting calendar - Ability to analyse, measure and react to social media KPI’s to guide decisions and recommendations and able to think strategically about social media growth


Develop and utilise your skills in a fast growing beauty company and receive free haircare products for you, family members and friends (need we say more?)

Location: UK (Birmingham or London) or Remote: work from anywhere.
Commission: Paid 

Application: Provide links to your porfolio or past body of work (blog, emails, videos, graphics, social media). Please include a Cover Letter in your application and tell us why you would like to join our team.

items.title: PR and Content Marketing Internship
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=18, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Hello…


Don't feel like working for a corporate? Tired of too much hierarchy? All you want to do is use your entrepreneurial spirit to be in charge of something amazing that YOU can proudly grow while picking up experience in various items?


Most importantly are you now looking to be a key player in a company’s growth instead of sitting in the back seat?


Then keep reading…


My Beauty Matches™ is the world’s biggest online marketplace for beauty products and provides personalised recommendations to its users. Our innovative personalisation technology is leading the way for the beauty industry globally and hence our founder was named as 1 of the Top 10 beauty entrepreneurs in the world by Vogue. Due to the success of our B2C service, My Beauty Matches™,  we have now also launched a B2B business, Beauty Matching Engine™, the world’s 1st white label beauty-specific personalisation software to help beauty brands and retailers provide personalised experiences to their customers too.


Why did we build it?


Well we were tired of biased advice from sales assistants and unpersonalised suggestions from the media and even more frustrated with having to spend hours trying to find the right products at the right price! So we decided to do something about it and now we are also selling the software to help other companies offer the same to their customers.


Who are we?


We are not your conventional bunch. We love our team banter in the office, food and fun but at the same time we are sooooo ambitious that we left our lucrative salaries to build innovative companies and now are up for the Best Customer Experience Award using AI at the Data Science Awards and our founder is also EU-India’s Top 50 Influencers in Beauty. 


Role (for both businesses)



  • Social media

  • Writing blogs and newsletters

  • Research

  • Writing press releases, contacting journalists & looking for PR opportunities (awards, speaker events, possibly organising events, etc)

  • Preparing marketing and PR material (google ads, social media ads, organising events, etc)


Requirements



  • A proactive/entrepreneurial spirit.

  • Good spelling, grammar and attention to detail.

  • Good at creative writing.

  • Experience running social media 

  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in an organised manner and meet tight deadlines.

  • Photoshop/ indesign or equivalent

  • A good knowledge of Excel


Benefits



  • Grow with one of the hottest startups and get hands on experience in various domains

  • Working side by side with experienced professionals who have worked in worldwide leading companies

  • Learn about SEO, digital marketing, UX & UI, PR and beauty

  • A fun, family like office or the flexibility to work remotely from home

  • See your ideas come to life without layers of hierarchy

  • Work in beauty and possibility of free products and treatments

  • Ability to get promoted to a job


To apply



  • Send your CV and cover letter to info@mybeautymatches.com

  • Please submit 2 sentences on how you would pitch Beauty Matching Engine to a B2B journalist and what image and caption you would post for My Beauty Matches’s Instagram.

items.title: Uscreen: Content Marketing
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=20, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Content Marketing


Ready to create some magic? Are you a smart, motivated individual seeking to jump into a company and learn a whole bunch?

Our marketing team is growing and we’re looking for amazing talent to join our pack. This position is best suited for a junior content marketer, with a strong desire to grow their skills. The right person will help us execute our content strategy by supporting our lead Content Marketing Manager’s everyday tasks: from content planning to publishing. 

We need someone ready to start contributing without a steep learning curve, so this position isn’t suited for entry-level applicants. SaaS experience is preferred, but not a dealbreaker. We use WordPress for our blog, so a working knowledge of the WordPress platform is a must.

Our team is incredibly passionate, smart, supportive, skilled, open to learning, happy to take constructive criticism and use it to level up. We’re looking for someone who can match that energy and help us scale. 

About the role:
Our future Jr. Content Marketing Manager will support our lead Content Marketing Manager by splitting the workload. You’ll be focusing your time on research, creating content for landing pages, publishing content on our website using WordPress as well as working with Mailchimp for our newsletters, and of course email marketing campaigns. The remainder of your time will be working with our marketing team, and also helping with other inititaves, launching campaigns and other interesting initiatives to help drive in leads. And of course we are a video company so any interest with video is a plus.

This is a full-time remote position, and is not suited for a digital nomad lifestyle. We require a steady internet connection and a mandatory overlap of working hours with the rest of the team. 


REQUIREMENTS

Must have:
  • 1+ years of experience writing (with writing samples to support)

  • 1+ years of experience managing content

  • Working knowledge of WordPress

  • Basic HTML knowledge

  • Impeccable sense of grammar and punctuation (American English)

  • A fully functioning workstation and a quiet place to work (with their own laptop)

  • Genuine interest in the video market

Must be:

  • Able to overlap at least 4 hours with our distributed team: from 6AM to noon ET

  • Quick to learn and able to understand audiences

  • Able to work independently

  • Native or near-native English speaker

  • A confident researcher who loves facts, hard evidence and numbers, with source info to prove it (‘Trust me bro’ doesn’t count)

  • Overall a kind and fun person :) 

Our ideal candidate will also have:

  • Experience with Mailchimp or similar email marketing system is a bonus

  • Experience in SaaS industry / team

  • Degree or relevant experience in Marketing Communication, Journalism, or similar

  • Knowledge of OTT or video industry in general (Nice to have but not a deal-breaker)

  • Good sense of content trends 

Benefits:

  • Full-time (40 hours per week) remote job with contract. We want to make it clear that this is NOT a freelance / part-time position you can do in tandem with other professional endeavors

  • Join an amazing, creative and motivated team

  • Advance your career and progress within the team

  • Work from anywhere (OK, almost anywhere…), as long as you have regular overlap with Eastern Time business hours and reliable internet connectivity.

  • 20 paid days off per year (eligible after the first 6 months with the company)

  • Budget for personal development

HOW TO APPLY:

Before applying, please note:

  • Apply using the link below

  • We review the applications and email candidates who qualify for the second round

  • The qualified candidates will be asked to do a test task: usually a video of yourself answering a few questions

  • After we review the submissions, we will organize a Skype interview with the successful candidates

Heads up! Due to the high volume of applications, we are thrilled to receive, at this time we are only able to respond to successful candidates.


APPLY HERE

https://bit.ly/2NCp0PR

items.title: Senior Social Media Manager
items.content:
Senior Social Media Manager at Public Library of Science - PLoS

Remote | International

Marketing

  • Full-Time
  • Remote

PLOS is a nonprofit, Open Access publisher empowering researchers to accelerate progress in science and medicine by leading a transformation in research communication. Since its inception, PLOS has helped break new ground for Open Science to provide more opportunities, choice, and context for researchers and readers.

We are looking for a talented and creative individual to join our growing team in the role of Senior Social Media Manager. This role will be remote, based in the U.S. or U.K. and will report to the Sr. Communications Manager and partner closely with the outreach and editorial teams. The Senior Social Media Manager is responsible for the creation and execution of a comprehensive social media strategy designed to engage our authors and other stakeholders. This person will manage PLOS’ brand presence and reputation on social media and provide a common voice and persona aligned to our brand across all channels.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a social media strategy for PLOS and its journals, the PLOS Blogs Network and PLOS Communities. This will include community engagement with current and prospective authors and be fully integrated into outreach and editorial communications strategies, ensuring alignment to and in support of company priorities and objectives.
  • Develop an editorial calendar and curate content for existing social media channels while managing PLOS’ social media handles, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn activities and YouTube channels. Secure necessary content approvals and publish/schedule using social content management system.
  • Manage complex public-facing escalations by diplomatically leading and influencing the parties involved including editorial staff, external authors, bloggers, and advocates. Assist in real-time monitoring and reporting on reputational concerns or issues.
  • Stay well-versed in emerging trends in social media, new media, and technology. Conduct research on new and potentially useful platforms and make informed recommendations on their potential value to PLOS to meet organizational objectives.
  • Work with and utilize analytics team and resources on an ongoing basis to identify effective social content strategies. Responsible for analytics and reporting for our social channels and blogs.
  • Translate organization-level messages into different formats for different platforms, including blog posts and micro-blogs, to be distributed on PLOS Blogs or social media; distribute official statements as well.
  • Assist in strategy development and real-time monitoring for specific projects and launch initiatives.
  • Internal responsibilities include;
    • Develop programs and procedures to streamline communication between editorial staff and social media representatives for individual journals/PLOS social media team to optimize social media presence and coverage.
    • Create training materials and hold in-person and remote training sessions with staff on how to use social media to disseminate research for different research communities, different journals.
    • Design and implement semi-annual workshops updating journal social media representatives on new strategies to achieve organization and journal-level communications goals. Also, provide a quarterly update of the results of social media campaigns and output.
    • Assist PLOS editorial staff and other departments in shaping and developing social media tone, voice, and use of social listening insights to maximize PLOS awareness and community engagement through trainings and day-to-day interactions around social media.

Qualifications & Experience

  • The successful candidate will be an accomplished social media professional with broad experience within publishing or a science-related environment, with an avid interest in and demonstrated knowledge of social media, including strategy, content development, and community management.
  • Experience with social media tools for publishing, monitoring, and listening. The platforms we currently use are Sprout Social and Meltwater.
  • Exceptional writer and storyteller, with experience in writing for traditional, online and social media. In-depth understanding of target audiences, expertise in high-impact messaging to broad audiences.
  • Solid understanding and familiarity with new and emerging communications tools and digital channels.
  • Experience in developing and executing strategic communications plans and correlating metrics, utilizing both media relations and social media tactics.
  • Ability to distill complex information into compelling and simple terms, with an understanding of public perception and issues as they pertain to the scholarly publishing industry
  • Strong interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work well within an organization and to influence teams to accomplish common goals and objectives.
  • Ability to work well under pressure, with demonstrated success at working under deadlines with tight timeframes.
  • Effective relationship-building skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment.
  • Bachelor’s degree. Journalism, communications and/or scientific discipline preferred.
  • 7+ years in the publishing industry or related field; science communications experience a major plus.
Apply for job

Their brand is highly esteemed and valued around the world by forward-thinking clients, employees and communities. items.content:
Solutions Engineer, Analytics

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Data Scientist
Industry: B2B, Information Technology, Intranet Software
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: CoEnterprise | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time

Technologies

tableau
tableau-server
analytics

Job description

Company Description

CoEnterprise is an award-winning B2B software and professional services company headquartered in New York City. Founded in 2010, CoEnterprise delivers Supply Chain and Business Analytics solutions and services that transform how companies connect and do business. CoEnterprise approaches each relationship and engagement from the perspective of three core values: collaboration, ownership, and excellence. We value collaboration with both our partners and clients in order to present the best possible outcome for our customers. Our vow to accept ownership ensures that our entire staff takes pride in our work and it is our commitment to excellence that ensures that this work is at the highest standard possible.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • Effectively articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical audiences
  • Lead strategic technical initiatives throughout the sales process and demonstrate CoEnterprise’s technical advantages.
  • Pursue the technical sales process with a coordinated focus on solutions development through discovery and requirements gathering, personalized demo, validation and documented design across assigned product groups.
  • Manage and interpret customer requirements and use astute questioning skills to understand, anticipate and match CoEnterprise’s customer technical capabilities to the products.
  • Create and deliver compelling, customer centric technical presentations and demonstrations by connecting technical features to customer business capabilities and drivers.
  • Identify all technical challenges of the customer to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process.
  • Seamless collaboration with the sales account managers and functional consultants fostering an integrated team approach to customer engagement.
  • Research new technologies, tools and methodologies as they emerge that may be applicable
  • Be the customer advocate and liaison for product management and development. 
  • Act as an integral team member working to achieve regional and team sales goals. Must be able to establish and maintain strong relationships throughout the sales cycle

Qualifications

  • Tableau experience is a plus
  • Ability to travel 50-75% of the time
  • Knowledge and experience selling or reselling analytics software for Big Data solutions is a plus
  • Proven track record in Big Data & Analytics software and/or services sales
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to juggle multiple opportunities and relationships
  • Customer service-minded, focused on addressing needs and fulfilling commitments
  • Self-motivated and able to work both independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to develop and manage professional networks with partners, prospects, and clients
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong sales closing and relationship management skills
  • Exceptional presentation and demo capabilities
  • Experience customizing and building the storyboard for demos and POC
  • Demonstrated success in achieving strategic deal wins
  • Ability to manage multiple, complex sales opportunities simultaneously
  • Ability to communicate from C-level executives down to Agent/Front Line level employees
  • Bachelor’s Degree
Apply now

About CoEnterprise

CoEnterprise is an award-winning B2B software and professional services company headquartered in New York City. Founded in 2010, CoEnterprise delivers supply chain and business analytics solutions and services that transform how companies connect and do business.  Syncrofy, CoEnterprise’s industry-leading EDI visibility software, provides data-driven business insights to key team members without requiring any advanced technical knowledge, enabling customers to analyze, interpret and act on information faster and more effectively.  

Benefits

  • Bagel mornings
  • Commuter Benefits
  • Generous PTO
  • 401K Match

items.title: Social Media Producer
items.content:
Social Media Producer at Matador Network

Remote
Matador Network is looking for a creative and analytical Social Media Producer who will own the day-to-day running of our social media platforms.
Daily job duties:
  • Work directly with Director of Social Media and editorial team on daily production
  • Collaborate with Director of Social Media and Managing Editor on social strategy
  • Schedule content throughout the day across social media platforms (including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, Twitter)
  • Maintain social media partnerships
  • Perform social outreach for different types of editorial content
  • Curate Matador’s Instagram (feed and stories) and Pinterest
  • Provide analytics support for video and written content
  • Stay proactive about scheduling seasonal content, including around holidays and pop
  • culture events
  • Be available for digital communication throughout the day on Slack and email

items.content:
Marketing Manager at WP Media

Remote | International

REMOTE

DESCRIPTION

ABOUT THE JOB

We’re currently looking for a Marketing Manager to join WP Media and be part of our marketing team.

As a Marketing Manager, you will implement, track and optimize our digital marketing campaigns. Your mission is to improve new customers acquisition and strengthen customer loyalty and retention, first for WP Rocket, and after a few months for Imagify.

What you will do:

  • Plan and execute paid traffic campaigns (SEM, paid social)
  • Manage and develop resources like customer reviews, videos, and ebooks
  • Set up inbound marketing campaigns to drive more new customers
  • Create, test and optimize landing pages to improve the conversion rate
  • Plan and execute email campaigns (for promotions and new releases) using Klaviyo – our email platform: segment database, create coupon codes, send emails & reminders…
  • Increase retention optimizing email flows (renewal, cart abandonment, etc…)
  • Measure and report performance of all marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs)

Both autonomous and team player, you are able to handle various activities and to prioritize. You have an analytical mind and a good sense of detail. You will join the marketing team composed of a content writer, an affiliate manager, and a CMO.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Being highly organized, analytical, and detail-oriented.
  • Speaking English (French would be a bonus)
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Min. 3-5 years of experience in managing marketing campaigns
  • Comfortable in technical environments
  • Love working in a team
  • In love with cats, corgies or both

BENEFITS

WP Media is the company behind WP Rocket and our other performance plugin Imagify.

Founded in 2014, we’re a fully remote distributed team of 23 people.

Here’s what we offer:

  • Friendly team
  • Work remotely
  • Flexible hours
  • Loose vacation policy
  • Profit-sharing plan
  • Annual Bonus
  • Annual budget to go to WordCamps and conferences
  • Monthly budget for your remote work needs

We encourage employees to enjoy their personal life by having flexible hours and unlimited vacation. We care about the work you do not the hours you do, and we want you to feel happy and fulfilled.

We have a very strong transparency culture, within our team and to the public, for example we have a Public Salary Grid

Apply for job

items.title: SEO SEM Analyst - REMOTE
items.content: The RoleRun organic and paid search for the Moment Shop, the largest online store for photography, filmmaking, and travel. The role is bigger than Moment the gear maker. It extends to the gear, apps, and photography trips we sell in the Moment Shop. This means supporting 20 different brands and making our store the place you shop before your next trip. On one side you'll be following the traditional role for search in making sure every article, trip, and product page is authoritative. This means managing both our organic and paid efforts to rank for the searches that matter. This also extends to multiple search boxes with Google, Amazon, Youtube, and iTunes to name a few. If people are searching for photography, filmmaking, and travel we want to win these searches. On the other side you get to work creatively with our content and commerce teams as they explore what content to publish and what products to sell. You will be collaborating with them from the beginning, using data to help them make better decisions. We expect search boxes to be an integral part of the new campaigns we launch, therefore search will have a seat at the table during inception. We're looking for an analyst with a methodical approach who appreciates creative collaboration. What you'll be working on+ Collaborating with our content, commerce, and travel teams to provide insights on what content they should be publishing, gear to be carrying, and trips to be running.+ Supporting new campaigns with all of the SEO and SEM.+ Analyzing a lot of search data to find cheaper opportunities.+ Creating, managing, and optimizing our SEM campaigns.+ Working with fellow analysts on the team to forecast traffic from search, by platform.+ Using and managing our SEO tracking tools.+ Working with designers and engineers to make changes that improve our SEO results.+ Building and maintaining dashboards in our Looker BMI tool.+ Customer service, because everyone on the team does a few hours per week. And we mean everyone in the company. You need these qualifications+ Passionate about photography and travel.+ Organized, detailed, and a simple communicator. Your analysis should be easy to follow.+ 2+ years managing SEO and SEM campaigns.+ Deep experience with either excel or SQL for data analysis.+ Experience forecasting search traffic.+ Experience building dashboards for others to understand our results.+ Experience with Google's platform.+ Experience with Amazon, YouTube, and iTunes a very big plus.+ Experience at an e-commerce, media, or creative agency a big plus.+Experience in a remote culture is helpful. Compensation And BenefitsThe Moment culture is about ownership so the more you take on the more you make. Otherwise we keep compensation simple... + Equity in the company.+ A salary.+ Medical insurance or $550 per month to do what you want.+ A free Moment Trip every year.+ Moment gear.+ A $500 stipend per year to spend on your own equipment.+ Three company offsites per year.+ Unlimited vacation. Are you in?

items.title: Digital Marketing PPC Specialist (Remote working with Central London meetings 1-2 days per week)
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Job Description



Part-time 3 days a week (ideally Mon-Weds)


£25-35K pro-rata depending on experience. 


Remote working with Central London meetings 1 to 2 days per week.


Are you a digital marketing professional looking for a flexible role?


We are looking for a highly motivated, analytical and creative Digital Marketing Specialist/Executive to join the UK’s fastest-growing booking platform for counselling and psychotherapy. Reporting to the Head of Marketing this exciting new position will focus on building and optimising two large PPC accounts and growing Paid Social to deliver engaging marketing campaigns centred around ROI. 


We pride ourselves in giving team members room to learn and grow, so you will be expected to be self-sufficient quickly and organise your working time to deliver value.


If you are looking to move in-house from an agency or to gain more varied marketing experience early in your career, this is an ideal position for you. You will be able to learn from other team members, gain exposure to other marketing channels and have the opportunity to develop skills outside of PPC.


Who You Are




  • At least 1 year’s PPC experience (ideally agency)




  • Bucket loads of enthusiasm, drive and potential




  • Excellent attention to detail with impeccably high standards




  • A self-starter, able to plan your own time and prioritise effectively




  • Excellent knowledge of Excel




  • Personable and articulate with excellent written and spoken English




  • Knowledge and experience of Google Analytics (other platforms a bonus)




  • Highly analytical and data driven




  • SEO / Social knowledge is advantageous




  • Previous experience of managing and implementing technical changes to paid campaigns




  • You may not have worked in PPC previously but have worked in a very data-driven role




Key Responsibilities




  • Developing and managing PPC campaigns to maximise ROI; on a daily basis your remit will include campaign monitoring, optimisation, reporting and troubleshooting.




  • Drive traffic, awareness and increase sales through digital channels




  • Building and managing Paid Social and video campaigns on Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn 




  • Constantly reviewing areas to improve conversion rates




  • Identifying trends in data and providing actionable insights




  • Produce reports for management (e.g. dashboards) 




  • Optimise campaigns and build new ones to cover new locations as new therapists sign up to the Harley Therapy platform, including writing ad copy




  • Curate and execute a pipeline of tests and share results and learnings with the rest of the team




  • Support the Head of Marketing in other marketing and advertising tasks




  • Enable Harley Therapy to be an early adopter with new products




  • Attend daily team meeting by Zoom




  • Work with developers in order to set up tracking




  • Carry out competitor analysis, keeping an eye on what they do well and how this could be introduced into own strategy





Qualifications



Essential Requirements




  • Degree Qualified, ideally in Maths, Economics, Computer Science or Business




  • At least 1 years' experience working on PPC campaigns in an agency or in-house environment, including technical changes, reporting and setting up A/B experiments




  • Exceptional analytical skills - A sharp eye for detail, capable of identifying and making actionable insights and optimisation opportunities from data




  • Ninja-level Excel skills




  • Ambition, drive and the ability to manage your own time




  • Strong understanding of the dynamics of PPC auctions




  • A keen learner, you have worked hard to keep abreast of the latest trends in PPC best practice




  • Capable of devising robust experiments with minimal supervision.




  • Proactive and constantly looking for ways to improve




  • Strong written English, capable of conveying complex messages in a clear and concise way




  • Strong organisation skills - You will be expected to prioritise your workload with minimal supervision




  • Familiarity with Google Analytics and other third-party tracking tools




  • Real people skills - professional, honest, approachable and empathetic




Preferred Skills And Experience




  • Interest in mental health/psychology




  • Marketing qualification




  • Familiarity with reporting tools such as Tableau or Data Studio




  • Experience working with Intercom




  • AdWords certified




  • Experience of remote working




  • Familiarity with HotJar





Additional information



Benefits




  • We are very flexible, friendly and personable. Each and every one of our employees gets a say in how we move forward as a company




  • Remote working




  • Opportunity to grow and develop in a growing company




  • In-house training 




 


Please note, due to the high level of applications, if you have not heard back within 14 days, unfortunately your application was not successful on this occasion.

items.title: Crossword Hobbyist: Customer Relations Manager (remote work, ~12hrs/wk)
items.content:
Customer Relations Manager (remote work, ~12hrs/wk)

Company Description


Begun in 2012, Crossword Hobbyist (https://crosswordhobbyist.com) and My Word Search (https://mywordsearch.com) are the best way to make crossword puzzles and word searches online. Our newest tool, My Worksheet Maker (https://myworksheetmaker.com), helps teachers make many other worksheets as well. We are an all-remote team comprised of the company founder, a couple Developers, a part-time Email Specialist, and a part-time Customer Relations Manager (soon to be you!). The Customer Relations Manager is in charge of making sure all customers have what they need, primarily through email-based customer support.



Customer Relations Manager Job Summary


Communication with customers is conducted almost exclusively over email. The Customer Relations Manager will have ownership over all incoming communication to the company, and responsibility for providing prompt support to customers.


  • Respond to email and voicemail messages
  • Investigate and resolve customer issues using our internal customer portal
  • Process refunds
  • Compile and submit chargeback disputes
  • Escalate issues where appropriate



Customer Relations Manager Qualifications


  • Be among the most reliable people I’ve ever met
  • Self-motivated and self-directed
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • 1+ year(s) experience in a dedicated customer support role (food service does not count)
  • Bachelor’s degree, 3.0+ GPA
  • Experience in banking or handling payment transactions preferred



Compensation


$600/month, with a target $1500 bonus after 1 year if your average “first reply time” is under 12 hours.





Fit


This position is not a good fit for everyone. This section should make you feel excited! If it makes you feel concerned, this is probably not the right position for you.


The job is all remote work, ~10-15 hrs/wk in fall-winter-spring and ~4 hrs/wk in summer. You are expected to maintain an average “first reply time” under 12 hours, and no customer waiting more than 24 hours. You have full flexibility on your scheduling to get this done.


To succeed, you will need to be comfortable checking the customer support queue multiple times per day, 365 days per year.


The person who currently holds the role (who will train you) has maintained an average “first reply time” over the past year of 8 hours, so the job is comfortably doable -- it’s just important that you’ll be happy with this sort of schedule.





Applying


Please include in your cover letter why you will be excellent in this position, both in terms of your qualifications and in terms of the fit.

items.title: Client Operations & Analytics Superstar
items.content:
Summary:We're a fast-growing healthcare technology company with a very unique culture looking to add to our team. par8o is looking for a full time superstar Manager of Client Implementations and Analytics to help us implement and establish/maintain strong, successful relationships with our client healthcare organizations. We have had tremendous market success and now face the exciting challenge of rapidly scaling our operations.
Sure, we ve built an awesome product that the market really seems to like ..but we ve also built a really unique culture that makes par8o a great place to work. We value individual contribution and also prize team effort. Our team enjoys flexibility like work from home on Fridays and we are dog friendly.
The role:You ll come into this position at a critical junction the foundations have been laid for this new offering, and we re now scaling our product/technology and operations to help our growing clients succeed. Using your analytical skills and effective communication, you ll establish and maintain strong relationships and successful programs from pre-launch and ongoing. The insight provided by your work will have a direct influence on client success and how will inform how we drive growth and continuous improvement.This is a substantial opportunity for someone looking for experience working in a fast-paced environment where you can see the impact of your work quickly - best-suited for someone who is both a meticulous detail-oriented do-er but also can take a step back and figure out how to continually improve processes to scale. We are a small team, which means you will collaborate closely with others and gain exposure to a variety of aspects of product development, client account management, and analytics.
Your responsibilities:Coordinate new client implementationsProactive tracking and execution of implementation steps across all stakeholders, internal and externalAdvocate for client success by creating client program performance reports and proactively identify strategies for improvement regularly with clientDeliver the best client service and support by helping clients troubleshoot, triage, and resolve requests quickly and effectivelyPrepare frequent ad-hoc reports/analyses, troubleshooting for external 340B entity clients, business partners, and internal teams (e.g. sales) as neededEstablish internal reporting mechanism by working cross-functionally to determine what metrics, reports, dashboards, and analyses are needed to drive business and measure impact of new initiativesConduct monthly accounting reconciliation and prepare reports for client invoicingReview / audit program monthly for program integrity and complianceProvide feedback on product development as neededUphold and comply with par8o s professional conduct, security, confidentiality and availability policies as outlined.
What will help you get the job: 3-5 years experienceHealthcare IT experience - 340B is a major plus!Excellent project management skillsExtensive analytics and data management experience - you can define problems, collect data, conduct analyses, and present conclusions effectivelySTRONG attention to detail - you are the kind of person who doesn t let balls dropExpert use of Excel and familiarity with other analytics/BI tools (Tableau, SQL) a plusClient-facing experienceAbility to independently prioritize work, creatively and proactively problem-solve and deliver results when opportunities aboundEager to work in a small company on a new product, with all of the ambiguity that will entailWillingness to do whatever is needed to grow the business even if it s outside of exact roleBA/BS degree or moreStrong work ethic, interpersonal skills, sense of urgency (and humor)Please note, applications without a cover letter will not be considered
Why it's great to work at par8o:Collaborative culture with plenty room for growthWork from home Fridays - we understand and encourage work-life balanceFlexible vacation and excellent health benefitsGreat location near Faneuil Hall with accessible transitWeekly lunches on the houseWe also love dogs - and bring them to work

More about us: Here's where to apply:
