United States
Healthcare IT
Aug 16, 2019Post Date
19207877Requisition #
Apply for JobShare this JobSign Up for Job Alerts
CTG is looking for a resource for a 3-month remote, part-time opportunity. The Professional Billing Analyst will be focused on build and workflow efforts.
Responsibilities:
* Workqueue rules
* Billing Indicators
* Account activities
* Packages
* Support third party testing
* Build within the Epic HB module, attend meetings, and meet with upper management/business owners
* The consultant will be expected to come in as an expert and conduct analysis as well as build and testing within the system
* Understanding of hospital operations and workflows
* Knowledge of best practices and how each area integrates with others
* Solves complex problems and takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information
* Ability to interact effectively with peers, management, physician office staff, vendors, and other customers
* Effective organization skills and attention to detail; effective follow-through, and commitment to excellence
* Ability to hear and communicate with others in a clear, understandable, and professional manner
* Demonstrated use of good written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent time management skills
* Strong analytical and multi-tasking skills
* Experience participating in optimization projects including design, build, testing, and support
Please apply online or for immediate consideration, please send your updated resume to ...@CTG.com
CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.
CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).
CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.
CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.
Additional Information
* Job Function: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations
* Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (16 years)
* Work Remote: Yes
* Travel: No

items.title: Reviewshake: Chief Technology Officer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=11, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Chief Technology Officer

Reviewshake is building the home for all online reviews - be it local business reviews, products, mobile apps, music, movie, podcasts and more.

Our main platform is a SaaS product that provides a management layer for businesses to manage reviews on 70+ review sites, including Facebook, Google, Yelp and Trustpilot. As a technology company, we also commercialize the tech that powers our company through several APIs in our Supervisor product.

We're an established business with hundreds of paying customers and a team of 8, and are searching for a full-time CTO that can help us get the company to the next stage. Being bootstrapped (not venture-backed) and fully remote, we don’t strive for growth at all costs, and are building a company that we can be proud of, and enjoy working for.


In a typical day, you will:
  • Architect, build and scale new features
  • Be responsible for overall code quality, reviews and unit tests
  • Coach, mentor and support our small team of engineers
  • Make sure we’re meeting our product roadmap
  • Maintain technical documentation

Our ideal candidate has:
  • 7+ years of experience building web applications
  • Managed a team of developers and led a project to production
  • Expert-level proficiency in Ruby on Rails and Python
  • 3+ years hands-on DevOps experience (Ubuntu, AWS, GCE)
  • 3+ years with SQL (MySQL / PostgreSQL)
  • Expertise with Git and CI / CD workflows

Nice to have:
  • Experience with machine learning (text classification, NLP)
  • Data science (data analysis, visualization)
  • Web scraping (residential proxies, captchas, high throughput)
  • An eye for building beautiful and intuitive apps

Our team is fully-remote and we communicate primarily through Slack, Asana, Google Docs and a few short, weekly meetings via Hangout — we believe the best work happens when given lots of uninterrupted time that’s free of distractions.

  • 5 - 15% options
  • $60 - 120k salary

items.title: Marketing Internship PAID
items.content:
Are you a positive & passionate do-er?  Are you a self starter who gets a kick from learning? Do you want the chance to work for an exciting Food-tech start-up on a mission to transform the food industry? 


We're on the lookout for an outgoing, creative and proactive marketing intern to engage our passionate audience of professional chefs, foodies, farmers and producers. We want someone creative and self-motivated with a keen interest in food, sustainability and innovative technology.  


You'll be helping our Head of Marketing with a range of tasks but your main responsibilities will be focussed in content creation and community management. This role offers a huge amount of scope for the right person, with the opportunity to move to a permanent hire if it’s a fit on both sides. 


Key takeaway - Mindset is more important than experience.


Direct report: Head of Sales and Marketing


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Create and manage all social media content. Reporting to and learning from the Head of Marketing, you will be responsible for our social media strategy and its execution.

  • Managing and creating all video content, ranging from product walk-throughs, supplier produce demos,farm/unit tours, chef interviews and more!

  • Social media accounts for 20% of our growth, we leverage organic social channels to drive qualified leads to our sales funnel, therefore you will be responsible for maintaining and increasing this lead funnel, under the supervision of your direct report. This includes proactive outreach to current and potential members of our community to encourage further connections on the platform, public endorsement of the brand and referrals.

  • Analyse and report social media performance, proactively test new approaches and report monthly findings

  • Event management: initially alongside Head of Marketing and Sales, with a view to owning events. This includes Supper Clubs, panels, conferences, visits to suppliers etc. 

  • Working closely with teams across the organisation: primarily Sales and Supply Operations to complement efforts; feeding back insights from social media on trends as well as highlighting high impact customers and supplier partners.


SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE



  • Some experience in marketing and social media (professional or personal)

  • An interest in all or some of the following: the hospitality industry, the social media landscape, food sustainability, technology

  • Excellent writing skills & a cheeky sense of humour. Someone with an eye for crafting persuasive copy

  • Some creative/design skills- even if only hobbyish using Canva or similar. 

  • An ability to switch seamlessly between tasks and adapt quickly to new conditions, strategies or role requirements 

  • Proactive and self-motivated, someone hungry to learn and grow quickly within the business. Someone who can operate both within a team, running a team, or can act independently

  • Someone who isn’t afraid to challenge the status quo and bring new ideas to the table

  • Someone who loves analysing people and what makes them tick.


MONTH ONE OBJECTIVES



  • Full management of Social Media Platforms 

  • Full understanding of Foodchain’s customer personas & growth strategy

  • Triggered at least 5 leads from social

  • 5% growth of social media following

  • Put together a proposal for suggested strategies for growth to review and approve 


BENEFITS 



  • 3 month paid internship with the opportunity to join full time. 

  • Eligible for employee options upon completion of probation period in full time role

  • Flexible, remote working available on agreement with your direct report 

  • Wholesale pricing on restaurant-quality produce

  • Invites to hospitality events and restaurant openings

  • Quarterly Foodchain dinners 


COMPENSATION 



  • TBC

items.title: Digital Marketing Manager/Paid Social
items.content:
About us:


If you're looking for a bog standard job, where you're told what to do and just do it then stop reading this now. If you're looking for somewhere where you're given ownership of what you do with the trajectory to become a Head of Marketing for a fast growing company, then we should talk.


Fanbytes is an influencer agency helping the world’s biggest brands like younger audiences on social media.


Started in January 2017, we’ve grown pretty quickly counting brands like McDonald's, Deliveroo, Apple Music and the UK Government as our customers whilst featuring in publications like Forbes, Evening Standard, and The Times for our global campaigns.


We're based in Old Street with our rapidly growing team of 30 people. We're entering into a new phase of growth and looking for someone to help grow the brand of Fanbytes through paid social across Facebook, Instagram and Google Ads.


Our team is one filled with entrepreneurs with our CEO and CTO having sold companies at 17 and 19 in both the media and data worlds respectively and this role is perfect for someone who wants to get stuck in and eventually lead the marketing team.


Responsibilities



  • Working with our content and social teams to design and implement paid social strategies across Facebook, YouTube and Google Ads.

  • Creating marketing funnels with our content partners to help drive leads and inquiries.

  • Working with our content, social and video teams to scale the distribution of our Fanbytes brand.

  • Working with our SEO specialists to develop a coherent SEO strategy.


Key skills:



  • Strong writing experience in a B2B setting - we're big fans of using content to drive leads here at Fanbytes.

  • Experience running paid social campaigns on Google or Facebook.

  • Analytical and creative mindset used to test and optimize best performing campaigns on social.


What we offer:



  • Large progression for growth - the national trajectory for this role is to become a senior position in the marketing team within a year. We believe in building entrepreneurs and this is no different/

  • Beautiful offices in Old Street with exposed brick walls.

  • Fun days out like Axe throwing (our CEO is a pro).

  • Millennial vibe - we believe in working hard but also creating a fun environment with other young forward-thinking people

  • Base salary including commission for converted leads. 


To show you’ve read the whole application, please put “Axe throwing is life” at the start of your application and share an example of how you’ve used data and creatives to drive results

items.title: Senior Rails Engineer, Product
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=72, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=38}
items.content:
Senior Rails Engineer, Product

Fleetio is a modern software platform that helps thousands of organizations around the world manage a fleet. Transportation technology is a hot market and we’re leading the charge, with raving fans and new customers signing up every day. We're looking for an experienced, driven, product-focused Senior Rails Engineer to help us deliver amazing features to our customers.


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
Your work will be heavily focused toward high level, high impact areas. You’ll work closely with Product Managers and Designers to plan, design, and implement some of our more complex features. You’ll have a strong voice in the development and planning processes, so prior senior level experience is key.

We work in weekly sprints and use Pivotal Tracker to keep things organized. While we keep meetings to a minimum, our remote team is heavily collaborative and takes advantage of modern tools such as Slack, Google Drive, and Zoom to stay in touch.

Our stack includes Ruby on Rails, Stimulus, Postgres and Heroku. We’re currently on Rails 5.2 and strive to keep our frameworks and libraries up to date.

This is a position we consider essential to the company’s success. Be sure to mention coffee in your application so we know you actually read this.


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU
  • Be a part of an incredible team of “A” players who go above and beyond to make Fleetio a successful company. We’re a customer-centric team with a great product, excellent support, and countless happy customers.
  • Work remotely! Over 50% of our Engineering Team works remotely (including our CTO), and as a company, we strive to promote a strong remote working culture.
  • Build software used by people all around the world. So many different types of companies and organizations operate a fleet each day, and Fleetio is a good fit for most of them (it’s a huge market).

OUR TEAM
We're hardcore believers in easy-to-use software. Crafting a delightful user experience is hard work, but we welcome the challenge and are looking for team members who share our ambition.

We're in "scale-up mode" and now to 70+ employees. We’re past the days of just a couple of people in a small office, but we’re still very much a fast-paced, highly collaborative company.

Our top goal as product engineers is adding value to our customers and we love to get changes out quickly. We've optimized our CI/CD to make it painless to run our test suite and get code into our production Heroku environments easily, resulting in an average of 40 deploys per week.

We place great value on work/life balance - we have families and know you do, too. Check out our careers page for a fun video and more information about working at Fleetio: https://www.fleetio.com/careers


REQUIREMENTS
  • 5+ years of Ruby/Rails experience
  • Deep understanding of relational databases
  • 3+ years experience in front end frameworks such as Angular, React, Backbone
  • Expert knowledge of modern UI/UX
  • Master of frontend web technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST APIs, JSON, Ajax, etc.
  • Knowledge of extension languages like HAML, SASS, CoffeeScript
  • Understanding of the balance between scrappiness and long-term code maintainability
  • Compelled to make things look beautiful and work flawlessly
  • Level up if you know a thing or two about cars and engines

BENEFITS
  • 100% coverage of health and dental insurance
  • 401(k) + match
  • Company stock
  • Dependent Care FSA and Medical FSA
  • Generous PTO and 8 company holidays
  • Maternity/Paternity leave
  • Mac laptop, book stipend, and professional development funds
  • Health and wellness initiatives
  • Remote working friendly

Apply now

items.title: Hotjar: Product Designer (EMEA)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=7}
items.content:
Product Designer (EMEA)

 
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are only looking for candidates in European timezones between UTC-1 and UTC+3.


We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Product Designer who is passionate about creating practical, simple and human solutions to complex problems which will help design the future of Hotjar – a product used by thousands of users worldwide. Product designers serve an important role here by creating simple, engaging experiences, iteratively improving the user journey, and crafting every product detail. Your success will be defined not only by the quality of your design work, but by the success of the product.


Hotjar is a flourishing startup which gives thousands of website owners, teams and professionals the tools needed to discover how their visitors are really using their sites. This is an excellent remote career opportunity within the product team, playing a part in delivering the next wins for Hotjar.



You will:

  • Create thoughtful and appropriate solutions to design challenges of all sizes by generating research insights and translating them into simple and engaging user interfaces which satisfy user needs, company requirements and technical constraints.

  • Form part of the product and engineering team by collaborating with product managers and engineers - from discovery to delivery, on to monitoring after release.

  • Design engaging experiences in an iterative manner, using flow diagrams, sketches and prototypes, taking care to validate your concepts with customers along the way.

  • Translate validated concepts into experiences, by means of interaction design and high-fidelity visual composites.

  • Follow internal style and brand guidelines for UI/UX, whilst contributing to the maintenance and improvement of such guidelines.

Requirements

  • A minimum of 4 years experience designing and shipping digital products and systems.
  • Ability in the entire product development process, from discovery through to delivery and monitoring of the solution.

  • Natural inclination to always thinks MVP first.

  • Sound grasp of technical constraints and their impact, and ability adjust the design approach taken accordingly.

  • Experience leading user testing sessions and validating design efforts.

  • Can prototype ideas quickly and iterate as many times as needed using tools such as InVision, Sketch, UXPin, HTML/CSS/JS, etc.

  • HTML / CSS development considered an asset.

  • Desire to work in a respectful, transparent, and collaborative work environment, following Hotjar’s company values, culture and ways of working.

  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third-party.



What we offer

  • A remote and accomplished diverse and international team.

  • An opportunity to positively impact people’s experience online and make the web a better place.

  • Annual learning and development budget.

  • Several perks designed for your well-being and a healthy work-life balance. (Holiday Budget, Wellbeing Allowance, Working Together Budget, 16 weeks paid parental leave, and much more).



Compensation Range

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €55,000 to €90,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered will be based on relative experience. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta, and Germany (for candidates who don’t require visa sponsorship). All other team members will join as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

items.content:
Product Analytics Lead at SocialChorus

Remote

REMOTE – US

PRODUCT & ENGINEERING

FULL-TIME

SocialChorus is a platform for communicators. We help them become heroes within their organizations by giving them the tools and expertise they need to unify their enterprises. Companies thrive and win when all of their workers feel aligned, informed and supported.

Joining SocialChorus means joining a movement where every worker matters. This movement has taken root and is evident in our world-class customer base their millions of employees worldwide. Now we need your help to achieve our goal of connecting every worker. Ready to make a difference?

The Role: We are currently seeking an experienced Product Analytics Lead to join our Product team. You’ll work remotely from your home office collecting and researching product and customer data, facilitating knowledge sharing among key stakeholders, and presenting recommendations to Product as well as company wide.

Responsibilities

  • Lead product analytics by analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of users and large sets of content and usage data
  • Conduct in-depth investigations using complex data sets using advanced statistical methodologies and tools
  • Develop strong hypotheses, diagnose and solve problems, and uncover business insights to drive growth (ie. data stories)
  • Design SQL queries and data visualizations that deliver insightful metrics to internal customers (Product, CTO, Engineering, Customer Success etc.)
  • Work directly with the Product team to bring actionable data-backed recommendations on improvements to areas such as program health, feature health, adoption, user retention, and future product roadmaps
  • Communicate and present actionable results and findings in a clear and concise data story to help drive product strategy and educate internal teams
  • Identify gaps in our existing data infrastructure and develop corresponding solutions

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Math, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, etc)
  • 3-5 years of or relevant working experience as a Data Analyst or Product Analyst using advanced statistical techniques
  • Strong knowledge of SQL with comfort working in large data sets
  • Experience using data to build SaaS products highly preferred
  • Highly proficient in Excel
  • Passion for building better software through data, with demonstrated experience finding hidden data stories that impacted product development
  • Comfortable dealing with a wide range of data sources and formats (internally generated, customer supplied, 3rd party) and performing the associated data normalization/de-normalization as appropriate
  • Ability to assess, analyze and distill complex concepts into simple communication and visuals

Why SocialChorus?

Because you care. About people, the work you do, and the connections you make. Work is such a large part of life, it only makes sense to make it awesome.

If you want to engage brilliant minds in a true start-up environment where ideas are rewarded regardless of who they come from, join us. This is a rapidly changing space so if you thrive on ambiguity, are hungry for a challenge, and have the guts to speak your mind it could be a perfect fit.

Come for the challenges, come for the people, and the unlimited PTO, health benefits, 401k plan, casual and friendly environment, and a leadership team who truly believes in your growth both professionally and personally will keep you here.

Apply for job

items.content:
Product Designer at InVision

Remote

Location: Remote

InVision is the digital product design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development. Today, more than 5 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes 100% of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

Our team is in search of a Product Designer to help us change the way digital products are designed.

About the Team:

As a product designer within our Core zone design team, you will play an important role in contributing to, and executing on our key initiatives to increase customer engagement across our platform. Working collaboratively with your design team partners, you will solve problems and deliver world class design solutions that improve our customer conversion, onboarding, activation, and retention. You will be expected to utilize your full range of product design, interaction design, and industry-leading visual design skills.

What you’ll do:

  • Shape the next generation of digital design tools by taking broad, conceptual ideas and turning them into something useful and desirable for our customers and impactful for our business
  • Drive innovation by exploring creative ideas that will elevate the product experience by designing flows and interfaces that are incredibly simple, effective, and elegant
  • Consistently prototype your designs to illustrate your knack for beautiful motion design
  • Give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise our bar for quality
  • Work closely with designers, product managers, engineering, and leadership in a highly collaborative environment
  • Contribute to high-level strategic direction with the rest of the product team
  • Learn from a diverse international team. Find mentors and get support for your professional growth
  • Push boundaries and break the status quo to get us to our ideal future state

What you’ll bring:

  • 3+ years of industry experience in product and visual interface design
  • An awe-inspiring portfolio of first rate visual design and interface work across desktop and mobile experiences with detailed descriptions of your process, role, and contribution
  • Deep understanding of customer problems and ability to create elegant but practical solutions
  • Ability to define problems & goals, map user flows, prototype interactions, and oversee the implementation by partnering closely with engineering
  • An obsessive interest and knowledge of the product design tools landscape
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Experience working within a cross-functional team in an agile environment is a plus

About InVision:

InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs a diverse team all over the world. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose.

The benefits we offer in the United States and Canada include competitive health plans and retirement plans. Some InVision-wide benefits offered to all employees across the globe include a flexible vacation policy, monthly coffee shop stipends, annual allowances for books related to your profession, and home office setup & wellness reimbursements. InVision is an international employer so some benefit offerings will vary from country to country.

InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Apply for job

items.title: Lead Business Analyst
items.content:
You’ll be the first hire in our data team, working closely with the Founder and Senior Management to build an amazing data infrastructure, drive commercial projects and inform decision-making throughout the company. 


We need someone who is as passionate about the growth potential of Shift as we are. Since our first investment of £300k, our GMV has increased by 2000% and our business and market fundamentals are as strong as ever. This means you’ll be comfortable adapting to the demands of rapid growth, like changing focus, getting stuck into many big and little tasks at once, and bringing your own ideas to the table.


This role will operate out of the newly formed London office with some travel to our other offices required, particularly in the first few months. 


You’ll do an awesome job if you:



  • Have exemplary Google Sheets & SQL skills; we need the best of the best with both 

  • Can take the lead and work with the team on structured tasks 

  • Are a structured problem solver who could explain anything to anyone

  • Bring a heap of common sense to the table


And if you we see evidence of the below, that’d be nice too:



  • Delivered analytical projects you’re proud of in a high growth/pressure setting

  • Worked in an early stage consumer tech startup

items.title: Enhancv: SEO Outreach Manager 🔗🔗
items.content:
SEO Outreach Manager

At Enhancv, we build the world’s best resume-editing platform. Each month we help thousands of customers worldwide get the job they love. We are a small 11-person team spread across Europe , Asia , and North America whose goal is to put an Enhancv resume on every recruiter’s desk!

We are looking for a passionate and smart ♂️SEO Outreach Manager to grow our organic search traffic. The market is huge and the question is – are you up for the challenge and ready to roll-up your sleeves?

Well, here’s what you’ll be doing:

You’ll drive organic traffic to millions of searches per month. Literally. There’re thousand of interesting things you can do at Enhancv
You’ll do it all -- 1️⃣establish an outreach plan, 2️⃣find opportunities, 3️⃣ produce content 4️⃣ monitor and improve our link profile quality 
You’ll be equally responsible for outreach strategy, and the content production that comes with it
You’ll work with us, brainstorm ideas on PR pitches for data-driven linkbuilding campaigns
You’ll build a network of freelancers to manage and automate some parts of our linkbuilding programs
♂️ You’ll work in a competitive industry at a fast pace. Just check our competitors and what they are doing

Ideally, you’re no stranger to these:

You’ve scaled to 1M+ views per month or topped some really competitive niches through link earning (not building) techniques
You’ve been featured in 50+ “picky” websites. When we say picky, we mean blogs that don’t accept every other guest post. Also, you’ve never been hit by a Panda, a Penguin or any other animal, that’s an enemy of an off-site SEO marketer
♂️You can support linkbuilding operations, you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves to write content, and you can manage 10+ freelancers to support your guest posts on a large scale
Ahrefs, Moz, Semrush and such are not just in your bookmarks. You use them daily to navigate your efforts. You read between the lines (send a pitch to one of our founders and mention his email in the typical day question of the application to let us know you saw this)
♂️You love content and know the difference between good and bad. You bring evidence and make sure content marketing is done right

Where you'll work

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it's a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly ✈️ and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that's why we are expanding. Join us in our office in Sofia , or work remotely.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way -- we believe that's how we'll win. And while the sky's the limit, remember you'll also positively change people's lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, FastCompany, BuzzFeed, and other media.

Salary, Benefits & Perks:

Work remotely.
Market salary based on location and results you produce.
♂️ 22 days of paid leave.
⚕️ Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.
️♂️ Sports allowance.
Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.
Transport allowance.
✈️ Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.
Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.

How to join us:

1️⃣ Apply and fill out the short form. 2️⃣ We'll review your application and invite you for an online interview to get to know you better. 3️⃣ If we like each other an assignment follows. 4️⃣ Finally, we'll make an offer if we feel you are the best fit for the position.

(view full job posting and apply here https://enhancv.com/outreach-manager/)

--------
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Hotjar: Content Marketer (EMEA)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
Content Marketer (EMEA)

 
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are only looking for candidates in time zones between UTC-1 and UTC+4.

At Hotjar we help marketing, product, and UX teams answer the questions their traditional analytics can’t, helping them provide a better user experience. To lead the way in our space, we’re creating an exciting, memorable, and unique brand—it’s a good time to join :-) We’re a distributed, 100% remote team that loves to collaborate and help each other grow. Personal and professional growth is at our core.


We’re looking for an inspired and passionate Content Marketer to join our growing marketing team. Reporting to the Director of Demand Generation and working directly with our Editor, you’ll contribute to our content strategy and help drive new MQL (Marketing Qualified Leads) growth. You will contribute optimized writing and edit weekly, with an eye on the needs of our readers and the other one on the SERP. As part of your role, you will reach out to and interview experts and customers, perform SEO research and optimize your work accordingly, and write compelling short articles and long-form stories.


If you have a passion for storytelling, a strategic mind, and know where to focus attention to drive the best results, keep reading...

 

You will:

  • Identify, reach out to, and interview subject matter experts (Hotjar customers, e-commerce pros, analytics experts, etc.) to create helpful, specific, practical, and never-seen-anywhere-else content.

  • Brainstorm, plan, and create authoritative and meaningful content to promote new MQL (marketing qualified leads) growth through free channels (editorial content, content hubs, head-term landing pages, etc).

  • Be involved at both tactical and strategic levels (it’s a small team, so we’re looking for a doer—a mover and shaker, if you will).

  • Find ways to always bring our content back to our product (Hotjar) and how it can help our readers solve their most painful challenges.

  • Put the customer at the center of everything you do by speaking to them, listening to them, and creating unique content-driven experiences for them.

  • Analyze our existing content to see what’s driving the most and best traffic to propose new content ideas.

  • Use whitehat SEO techniques from the beginning stages of content development.


Requirements

  • You have experience in content creation for companies serving the e-commerce or analytics industries.

  • You are a Hotjar user or have used it in the past.

  • You know how to lever editorial-based SEO to promote meaningful, high-quality traffic.

  • You’ve got a special talent for the written word and can create meaningful, customer-centric content that creates results.

  • You have experience identifying, reaching out to, and interviewing subject matter experts. 

  • You’re a customer-centric marketer.

  • You have a desire to work in a respectful, transparent, and collaborative work environment, following Hotjar’s company values, culture and ways of working.

  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third-party

 

What we offer

  • A remote and accomplished diverse and international team.

  • A chance to positively enhance people’s experience online and make the web a better place.

  • Annual learning and development budget.

  • Several perks designed for your well-being and a healthy work-life balance (Holiday Budget, Wellbeing Allowance, Working Together Budget, 16 weeks paid parental leave, and much more).

 

Compensation

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €50,000 to €70,000, annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to our new team member will be based on relative experience. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta, Germany, and the UK. All other new team members will join as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

items.content:
About Stay Nimble


Our Mission


We are a certified UK social enterprise with an ambition to support everyone to find their purpose in the new world of work.


Stay Nimble exists to improve financial wellbeing and reduce poverty by helping people find their purpose in a rapidly changing world. We do this by supporting people to discover and secure in-demand careers that align with their natural talents and based on local labour market needs.


This support is enabled by the digital career coaching platform we are building, taking the best of breed analogue career coaching techniques and scaling these using technology to help millions find better work.


Working Practises


We operate following the principles of the Blueprint for Better Business, with fully remote working practices. We put trust and mutual respect for each other at the heart of our business, and aim to create a working environment that helps people thrive and bring their best performance as often as they can.


Funding


We’re looking to raise our Series A funding round early in 2020, following a successful crowdfunding round in Q1 2019 and partnership with Accenture. It’s an exciting time to join us as an early stage startup with a strong social mission.


Product Design


When designing products, we care deeply about:



  • Getting out of the office and understanding our customer needs. We put these upfront in design and decision making.

  • Continuous Product Discovery, the process of validating our ideas and experimenting with real customers before we put them into Product Delivery. We aim to be discovering new insights daily.

  • Working towards key outcomes for our business and customers, rather than focusing on output.


We're current in private beta, please check out our latest product designs here: https://marvelapp.com/93cii83/screen/58903807


Brief


We are looking for a Product Designer to create beautiful and simple user experiences for our customers. You will work closely with our Product Director, combining user research with your creativity to deliver features that create value for customers.

We work in Design Sprints, testing bi-weekly with our customers to validate our designs - you work closely with the Product Director to deliver these sprints.


You will thrive in this role if you are an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp customer needs and solve problems. A strong portfolio of successful UX and digital projects is essential. Ultimately, you will make our product more valuable, user-friendly and intuitive to our customers.

**Please note**


This role involves working face-to-face with customers (1 day every two weeks is spent user testing), please only apply if you are London based.




REQUIREMENTS


Responsibilities



  • Create personas through user research, data and behavioural psychology

  • Lead the design vision of the product and work with the team to define feature specifications

  • Conduct product discovery sprints, to build out design ideas, testing and gather feedback from customers

  • Define the right product interactions and evaluate feature success

  • Develop wireframes and prototypes around customer needs

  • Find creative ways to solve UX problems with valuable, usable, intuitive designs.

  • Use your graphic & interaction design skills to implement attractive designs

  • Work collaboratively with the development team to enable validated designs to be delivered into a high quality live product.

  • Be aware of competitor products and industry trends


Skills and Experience


Must Have



  • 2+ years experience as a UX-UI Designer, demonstrating experience with end-to-end (hybrid UX & UI) product design.

  • Strong portfolio of design projects

  • Strong UI skills (graphic & visual design) with an ability to develop high fidelity prototypes

  • Strong core UX skills - user research/needs analysis, idea generation, creating user flows, wireframing, lo-fi/hi-fi prototyping

  • Proficient using design software (e.g. Sketch, Marvel, Invision, Zeplin, Adobe Suite)

  • Strong problem solving ability and able to work at speed, comfortable making decisions in uncertain conditions.

  • An analytical mind with sound business acumen

  • Excellent communication skills and ability to empathise with customers


Nice to have



  • Knowledge of frontend programming (HTML/CSS; JavaScript) is a plus

  • Experience copy writing to bring designs to life

  • Experience managing projects




BENEFITS



  • Salary: £35-50k depending on expertise.

  • Personal learning budget of £750 per annum towards personal development.

  • Remote working - we're a remote company, we welcome flexible working so that you can manage your time how you see fit. We find this saves on daily expenses, such as commuting costs, but more generally makes for a happier team. :)

  • Blue Print for Better Business - We’re building our company using the blue-print for better business – a new approach to ethical operating principles.

items.title: Digital Marketing Engagement Associate

items.content:
Digital Marketing Engagement Associate at American Red Cross

Remote

Digital Marketing Engagement Associate (work from home)

  • RC29349
  • Full Time

Please use Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox when accessing Candidate Home.

By joining the American Red Cross you will touch millions of lives every year and experience the greatness of the human spirit at its best. Are you ready to be part of the world’s largest humanitarian network?

Job Description:

Please note: Candidate will work remotely from their home office & can be based in any US city.

The American Red Cross is seeking a Digital Marketing Engagement Associate to join our national marketing team. Candidate should be a strategic digital marketing professional who is able to work collaboratively with cross functional teams/departments to ensure that the RedCrossBlood.org website and Blood Donor mobile app deliver best in class user experiences and support organizational digital goals and objectives.

This person will report to the Director, Digital Engagement for Biomedical Services. Candidate should be a strong communicator with a deep understanding of content management, testing and optimization, and using analytics to continuously drive digital thought leadership. Experience with the Adobe Experience Cloud or proven technical skills sufficient to rapidly learn new technologies is required.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with internal and external partners to identify and prioritize website and mobile app improvements that align with strategic business objectives and meet the needs of both key stakeholders and our user base.
  • Manage digital projects through complete product lifecycle including requirements documentation, development, testing and implementation.
  • Liaison with IT and business stakeholders to prioritize development backlogs, coordinate releases, and roadmap future enhancements.
  • Utilize strong analytic intelligence to understand user engagement and craft strategy that delivers high-value website traffic, improves visitor interactions, and optimizes site performance.
  • Develop a comprehensive testing and optimization strategy that drives A/B/MVT testing, personalization, and conversion rate optimization initiatives aimed at optimizing the user’s online experience and improving performance across critical conversion flows.
  • Review and publish content on Biomedical websites using Adobe Experience Manager.
  • Understand and deliver comprehensive verbal and written explanations of performance metrics to all levels of internal customers – from product managers to executive management.
  • Provide digital engagement subject matter expertise and consultation to business partners and stakeholders.

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of website or mobile app management experience
  • Bachelor’s degree required. Marketing, Communications or related field preferred
  • Minimum of 3 years experience developing and executing website testing and optimization strategy.
  • Minimum of 3 years experience maintaining web content using a content management system, preferably Adobe Experience Manager
  • Ability to work remotely and collaborate effectively with off-site team members and stakeholders; experience working in a virtual environment (from home office) preferred.
  • Experience communicating complex digital concepts in engaging and creative ways
  • Excellent interpersonal and time management skills
  • Demonstrated experience creating and delivering client presentations relating to site performance and website strategy
  • General understanding of usability design and conversion optimization design
  • Attention-to-detail; demonstrates a high degree of accuracy

Required Technical Skills:

  • Working knowledge of Adobe Experience Cloud, particularly Experience Manager, Target and Analytics
  • Experience with A/B and multivariate testing tools, such as Visual Website Optimizer (VWO), Optimizely or Adobe Target
  • Demonstrated experience collecting, analyzing, and reporting web analytics.

Apply now! Joining our team will provide you with the opportunity to make a difference every day.

The American Red Cross is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Apply for job

items.title: Regional Corporate Market Sector Leader, Northeast - New York
items.content:
Job Summary

In partnership with the Americas Corporate National Business Line Leader, AECOM is seeking visionary and dynamic leadership for our Northeast Region Corporate Practice with the primary responsibility to lead and grow the Corporate Architecture, Engineering, Interiors, Planning (Design Planning & Economics) & Consulting (Strategy +) regional business, with a focus on positioning AECOM as a fully integrated multi-disciplinary market leader in Corporate Consulting, Master Planning and Design, and with the goal of driving innovation and excellence in Corporate Design & Thought Leadership, Project Management, and Technical and Delivery success for local, regional and global Corporate clients. This position will be based in the New York Studio and collaborate with staff across the Northeast Region.

We are seeking an individual who is an industry-recognized leader in the Corporate Architectural/Engineering Design & Planning Community in the Northeast Region, has strong client relationships, and an established client and industry network. The ideal candidate understands and has a proven track record in driving business fundamentals that include client leadership, business development, financial oversight, design quality, project delivery, and has the ability to convey innovative design thinking and solutions.

Leadership Goals:

  • Responsible for developing and executing the Corporate strategic growth plan for their region, including developing and executing client outreach goals.

  • Advocates design excellence and quality leads the regional Corporate strategy in assuring that we are building client relationships, strategically pre-positioning winning and delivering the most important Corporate work in the region

  • Together with regional business line management committee, builds high performance Corporate design teams soliciting and managing client feedback to align operations and allocate resources according to strategic priorities, recognizes and unleashes the potential of others by providing the needed environment, resources, coaching, experiences and other support, champions an innovative and collaborative culture.

  • Champions change makes the AECOM Corporate vision understandable, creates buy-in to the vision by linking day-to-day work to the attainment of the vision, engages and mobilizes others to drive change, reduces organizational ambiguity.

  • Illustrate a keen understanding of market trends and client expectations in the Corporate sector.

    • Minimum Requirements

  • BA/BS and 12+ plus years of related experierence or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education, including 4 years of leadership

  • Professional design degree in Architecture (or applicable field) required

  • Registered Architect, Engineer, Interior Designer or Planner

  • Deep knowledge of the regional Corporate marketplace with national and global reach, key clients, and industry trends is paramount

  • Experience and skill in strategic business development, client relationships and driving sales and revenue

  • The ability to support and lead business development activities through early client interaction, scope of work development, interviews, and on-going client maintenance interface

  • Acted as principal-in-charge of a large/multi-disciplined Corporate project /consultant team

  • Together with Regional Managing Principal, Principal-In-Charge and Project Directors, established project scopes, work plans and work schedules.

  • Successfully delivered Corporate projects within the clients budget / schedule requirements

  • Successfully delivered project scope and fee, delivering targeted profit to the firm interfaced with project managers on schedules, project review meetings, issues management and client expectations

  • An ability to travel and/or work remotely with teams

  • A strong desire to train

    • Preferred Qualifications

  • 20+ years of related experience is strongly preferrred

    • What We Offer

    When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is

    pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions

    inclusion, diversity and overall

    employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our

    core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only

    delivering a better world , but working to make amazing happen in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each persons potential, and well help you reach yours.

    Job Category Management

    Business Line Buildings & Places

    Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)

    Country United States of America

    Position Status Full-Time

    Requisition/Vacancy No. 211024BR

    Clearance Required No

    Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

items.title: Planned Giving Associate (Remote)
items.content: Are you an experienced fundraiser looking to start a career in planned giving Plan International USA is looking for a Planned Giving Associate to join our team. This position offers growth and development opportunities. Position Summary As a Planned Giving Associate at Plan you will shape the futurefor the worlds most vulnerable children by securing commitments for financial support from Plans most generous and dedicated supporters. You will enter into relationships with your donors, learn their aspirations and concerns, and partner with them and their advisors to create a giving plan that suits their needs. You will do this important work as part of a dynamic and collaborative team of passionate fundraising professionals who are here to support and mentor you into this new phase of your career. This role will build upon your fundraising experience foundation to help you develop into a successful planned giving professional. Requirements Bachelors degree required; 1 year of direct fundraising experience required, 1-3 years of fundraising experience preferred Overnight travel will be required as needed to meet goals Outstanding people skills and excellent communication skills both written and oral; Outgoing, confident and graciously persistent personality; Excellent problem-solving, time management and organizational skills; Ability to work as a team player, as well as function independently in remote office setting; Ability to maintain confidentiality; Knowledge of Salesforce and PG Calc preferred Success Factors A proven fundraising track record, as well as a possible history in finance, sales, and marketing Ability to develop personal relationships with a variety of people in a variety of contexts Ability to relate effectively with upper management, peers and others ; A high degree of comfort in dealing with individuals of influence and affluence Strong listening skills with ability to extract key takeaways and report them to team members Willingness to learn planned giving Ability to secure and increase gift commitments from donors and prospects; Ability to represent both the programs and heart of Plan to external audiences; Excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills; Demonstrated passion for fund raising and genuine interest in the international relief and development world; Ability to meet annual goals set for the position. Work Environment This is a remote position with domestic and international travel up to 60% of the time. When you are not traveling to visit with donors you will be working from your home office. The majority of our front-line fundraising team works remotely including the Director of Planned Giving, your immediate supervisor. We regularly utilize Zoom, Skype, and other video conferencing services to stay connected to each other. Apply on our careers site at: Plan is an equal opportunity employer and follows all laws associated with the EEOC.

items.title: Change Consultant, Google
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Appirio is a global cloud consultancy that helps customers achieve results in weeks, not years by harnessing the power of the world's top talent. Appirio's 600,000 member topcoderTM community and crowdsourcing platform, combined with the company's business and technical expertise, have helped 800+ enterprises confidently use technology to increase innovation and transform business. Founded in 2006, Appirio is a trusted partner to companies such as Apria, Coca-Cola, eBay, Facebook, Japan Post Network, L'Oreal,

NetApp, The Four Seasons and Virgin America.

Brief Summary of Role

The Consultant will work onsite with customers to analyze their change enablement (change management, training, communications, and supporting content and media) requirements, and then design, develop and lead deployment of the user adoption portion of enterprise implementations of G Suite / Google Cloud.

Responsibilities

* Understand client's business strategies and associated organization and change management issues
* Explain the business, organization, leadership and individual contributor factors that influence organizational solutions to deliver value to the client
* Approach change management as both an art and a science, leveraging proven change methodologies as well as a strong understanding of individual and organizational psychological factors that influence and drive behavior change
* Develop eLearning training
* Lead and/or execute stakeholder engagement and organizational readiness, leadership alignment, change impact analysis, education, communications, and adoption and adaptation measurement workstreams
* Help re-align the organization, its people, and their actions with critical business imperatives and specific objectives
* Assist with the workforce transition from internally managed operations to outsourced operations
* Identify opportunities to provide or create additional client value
* Develop trusted relationships with key clients, partners and colleagues

Education and Required Experience (Requirements)

* B.S. degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience
* 3 + years experience related to the successful delivery of change management work in the disciplines of change management methodology, job/role design, stakeholder engagement and organizational readiness, leadership alignment, change impact analysis, education, communications, training and adoption and adaptation measurement
* Direct experience in G Suite deployments or Google Cloud feature rollout
* 5 + years general management consulting/software consulting experience
* Understanding of the different training and user adoption approaches needed for successfully deploying cloud (SaaS) applications
* Proficiency in program design, curriculum design, content and course development, and multiple forms of media development and deployment
* Experience conducting business interviews and leading client workshops
* Strong proficiency with presentation tools and applications (Captivate is preferred, also Jing, Articulate, etc.)
* Ability and confidence to work closely with, and advise, senior executives at a given customer
* Progressive and professional experience leading and/or supporting organizational change management for large scale global projects, particularly in human resources, information technology, CRM/Sales or other organizational transformations
* Experience assessing business objectives and defining change strategy to meet objectives as well as developing appropriate work plans and leading the project according to the plan
* Hands-on change management experience with implementing large-scale SaaS solutions
* Demonstrate ability to work across all areas in an organization and manage various functions and resources
* Excellent communication skills and strong leadership and presentation skills
* Strong writing skills including the ability to synthesize information into clear, concise messages both for detailed analytical reports and executive summaries
* Ability to work independently, work with a remote team, think creatively, manage own time, and take initiative to drive projects
* Exceptional client relationship management skills
* Ability to work from home and travel up to 60%
* Not eligible for visa sponsorship

We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
Associated topics: business, business advisory, business analysis, business intelligence, business systems analyst, consult, consultant, crm, sales, support analyst

items.title: REMOTE EPIC CERTIFIED HB BILLING ANALYST
items.content:
REMOTE EPIC CERTIFIED HB BILLING ANALYST

United States



Healthcare IT



Aug 16, 2019Post Date



19207877Requisition #



Apply for JobShare this JobSign Up for Job Alerts

CTG is looking for a resource for a 3-month remote, part-time opportunity. The Professional Billing Analyst will be focused on build and workflow efforts.

Responsibilities:



* Workqueue rules



* Billing Indicators



* Account activities



* Packages



* Support third party testing



* Build within the Epic HB module, attend meetings, and meet with upper management/business owners



* The consultant will be expected to come in as an expert and conduct analysis as well as build and testing within the system



* Understanding of hospital operations and workflows



* Knowledge of best practices and how each area integrates with others



* Solves complex problems and takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information



* Ability to interact effectively with peers, management, physician office staff, vendors, and other customers



* Effective organization skills and attention to detail; effective follow-through, and commitment to excellence



* Ability to hear and communicate with others in a clear, understandable, and professional manner



* Demonstrated use of good written and verbal communication skills



* Excellent time management skills



* Strong analytical and multi-tasking skills



* Experience participating in optimization projects including design, build, testing, and support



Please apply online or for immediate consideration, please send your updated resume to ...@CTG.com

CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.

CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).

CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.

CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.

Additional Information

* Job Function: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

* Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (?16 years)

* Work Remote: Yes

* Travel: No
