DescriptionAbout UsAppirio, a Wipro Company helps customers create next-generation Worker and Customer Experiences using the latest cloud technologies. Our free-thinking consultants deliver unmatched customer value by creating actionable strategies, delivering results quickly, and helping organizations adapt to a new experience-driven era. We do this by harnessing the power of one of the world's largest crowdsourcing communities and thousands of pre-built solution accelerators. Appirio is a trusted partner to some of the world's largest brands, including YP, Cardinal Health, Coca-Cola, eBay, Facebook, Home Depot, Sony PlayStation, Moen, and IBM.(Please see Marketing Wiki Link to ensure you are using the most up-to-date company description verbiage. )Brief Summary of RoleAppirio is focused on enabling companies to migrate to Google Apps as an alternative to legacy messaging systems such as Microsoft Exchange and Lotus Notes. Consultant will primarily work remotely, but some onsite work will be required. This position will need to work with customers to analyze their requirements and Domino applications, develop designs, and implement Google Apps, Google Cloud Platform, and other appropriate solutions. ResponsibilitiesAiding customers in application remediation, migration planning, system design, and implementation of Google Messaging and Apps.Assisting customers with the remediation ofLegacy Applications to the appropriate cloud-based platforms, such as Google Cloud Platform elements like AppEngine, BigQuery, Cloud SQL, and other accepted platforms.Facilitating administrator and end user training and adoption.Integrating Google Apps with on-premise mail, calendaring, and directory services using the Google Apps API.Leading customers through the development of Google-based dashboards.Integrating Google Apps with other software-as-a-service systems such as Salesforce.com.Legacy messaging system configuration and migrations.Education and Required Experience (Requirements)B.S. degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS, or equivalent5 years working knowledge of development experience in legacy applications like Lotus Notes/Domino. Competency with API-level programming in Python, Javascript, Java, PHP, or HTTPFamiliarity with the Google Development Platform - Google Cloud Platform, AppEngine, Geo, BigQuery, and othersFamiliarity in configuring and administering a messaging system. Experience with Microsoft Exchange, IBM Domino/Notes or Novell GroupWise is a plus.Familiarity with messaging-related protocols such as LDAP, Active Directory, XMPP, iCal, SMTP, IMAP, POP3, and MX routingFamiliarity with authentication methods including single sign-on with SAMLFamiliarity or experience with Salesforce.com a big plus.Strong presentation and communication skillsLocated in the U.SAbility to travel up to 40-60%Not eligible for visa sponsorship We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

by Jobble

Job Description - Digital Experience Product Manager-Remote ()Job Description Digital Experience Product Manager-Remote - ()Description This role can be remote or located in a Windstream office (if available)This position is part of the Digital Experience group, which is responsible for supporting the digital vision and strategy goals for Windstream. We're looking for an innovative, proven individual to be an active contributor to our digital experience team to support the long-term growth and sustainability of Windstream's client portals while ensuring that we are a market leader and exceeding customer expectations. The position will assist in developing new and/or improving current products and organizing their execution based on a deep understanding of stakeholder and end-user needs, product and market insights and other in-depth analysis. This person will assist in communicating and reporting intelligence and analysis to senior managers in marketing, sales operations, base management and product marketing. Responsibilities may include: Product DevelopmentWork with other team members to deliver new functionalities in the customer portal on time, in scope and in budget.Identify and help prioritize truly innovative product features that deliver a competitive advantage and an exceptional user experience. ?Work closely with internal and external teams of developers, UI/?UX professionals, graphic designers, Q/?A experts, and marketers-driving the product deliverables at all phases of the product cycle. Sales/Support enablement - assist in the communication of the value proposition of the portals internal teams including, sales, training, and client services. Also assist in the development of sales and training tools to support the selling proposition and usage of the portals.Develop and present recommendations to increase effectiveness of customer portal adoption, retention and usage programs. Qualifications Minimum Requirements: College degree and 4-6 years professional level experience with 1-3 years supervisory experience; or 8 years professional level related experience with 1-3 years supervisory experience; or an equivalent combination of education and professional level related experience required. Who are we

 

Together with you we are simplifying the way businesses work with sensitive data. Combining safety and simplicity. In order to accomplish that, we combine state-of-the-art Machine Learning with cutting-edge Cryptography to allow analytics on any confidential dataset.

 

Your Job

 

You will set-up and run a creative digital B2B marketing processes to
create outbound material and get the right inbound requests.

 

You will be mainly working with the commercial team in connecting with key industry players and
polishing our marketing strategy. Due to the technical nature of our business
sometimes the tech team might be involved.

 

You will be also conducting market validation and helping our outside communication.

 

What are we looking for

 


  • Having or pursuing a master’s degree related to Marketing

  • Previous experience in B2B marketing through consulting or SaaS startup

  • Native in workChannels such as Twitter, LinkedIn, and Reddit

  • Native English speaker

  • Knowledge and interest about the data economy ecosystem

  • Availability at least 2 days per week


The position can be remote

items.title: Public Relations and Outreach Coordinator
items.content:
Public Relations and Outreach Coordinator at Single Grain

Remote

REMOTE · United States · Marketing

DESCRIPTION

About Us

Single Grain is a small, but mighty, digital marketing agency in downtown LA. We specialize in PPC, Paid Social, SEO, and Content Marketing working with clients such as Intuit, Uber, and Amazon. Our founder and thought leader, Eric Siu, has led Single Grain to where it is now and is continuing to grow its audiences through a variety of channels.

Eric hosts two podcasts – Marketing School (1M downloads/mo) and Growth Everywhere (100k downloads/mo). Growth Everywhere posts weekly interviews of world-class entrepreneurs and C-level executives and pulls out actionable insights to help you grow personally and professionally. Marketing School brings you 10 minutes of marketing advice and strategies every single day. We speak at conferences as well as host our own, we run a blog with over 200,000 visitors/mo and have a YouTube channel with 22,000+ subscribers. We even have our own SaaS tool and educational products.

All of this is to fulfill our mission to create meaningful predictable growth for business-owners and companies from Series A start-ups to tech giants and enterprises.

About You

We are looking for a humble, hungry and smart PR and Outreach Coordinator to join our growing Content team. You will be a great fit if

  • You are tech-savvy, self-starting, resourceful, entrepreneurial, endlessly curious, and highly ambitious
  • You have effective time management and organization skills, strong communication and interpersonal skills, a positive attitude and a growth mindset
  • You meet deadlines, pay attention to details, think on your feet, ask for help when you need it, and consistently demonstrate respect for others

When you apply, please include the words “PR is Cool” in your cover letter. Any applicants that do not include this phrase will not be considered.

About the Role

The ideal Public Relations and Guest Outreach Coordinator will leverage their own insights and industry knowledge to uplift Single Grain and its properties to new heights through strategic partnerships and collaborations with other brands, publications, and influencers. This creative thinker will need to be a people-person and be able to communicate professionally, both written and verbal. You will report to the Single Grain Founder as well as the Head of Content. This position is a remote contractor role.

  • Research, qualify, and outreach to influencers/bloggers, publications, and Single Grain’s business audiences for collaborations
  • Proactively pitch new engagement ideas and opportunities for partnerships, sponsorships, and advertising to reach new customers and audiences, ensuring content is compelling and aligns with Single Grain’s voice and objectives
  • Assist with product launches and promotions while maintaining editorial and events calendar for the Marketing team
  • Compose press pitches, media alerts, and social media copy as well as assist in writing articles for newsletters, blogs, magazines, and websites
  • Analyze, measure, and report on influencer activity during and after campaigns to evaluate, address learning, and optimize future initiatives
  • Continuously monitor the latest trends and changes in the digital publication world to ensure we are always ahead of the curve in our knowledge and capabilities

REQUIREMENTS

  • 3+ years in PR/Communications/Marketing
  • Demonstrated interest in digital marketing industry, entrepreneurship, and startups
  • Impeccable written and communication skills including rapport building and interacting with team members at all management levels
  • Excellent time and project management skills with the ability to work remotely and independently
  • Extremely detailed, organized, reliable, trustworthy, and takes initiative with a positive attitude
  • Ability to use G-Suite and PowerPoint
  • Please include the words “PR is Cool” in your cover letter (or else your application will not be considered)

BENEFITS

  • Remote position
  • Growth-oriented culture that values open communication and transparency
  • Already working with a large audience, thriving email list, and prominent influencers and entrepreneurs in the industry
  • Close-knit hard-working team members!
Apply for job

items.title: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Product Designer at Dia&Co

Remote | Freelance

Location: New York, NY or Remote (US-based only)

Who We Are

Dia&Co is the only retail service dedicated to meeting the plus size community’s full range of style needs. We’re applying the best of data and technology to serve women who have been ignored for far too long from developing the shopping experiences she’s always wanted, to building community platforms that inspire her, to ensuring she sees herself represented in the world around her.

Background

Design is required for a new flow and page (or series of pages) as part of our logged-in customer’s account management experience. This work will also incorporate applying our new design system (UI components) to the page content to ensure design consistency. The design engagement will last approximately 3-4 weeks, with the potential to extend as both parties deem necessary.

You will be responsible for creating and improving the way our users manage their Dia account. These use cases include updating key account preferences such as contact information, address, payment method, and contact preferences. This work will also incorporate how users view and track past purchases with Dia.

Primary stakeholders are the engineering team, our customer service team ( for their insights). As well as Growth pod ( the team that works on the logged-out experience) to ensure consistency.

You

We are looking for a strong designer who has had experience working with:

  • UI /pattern libraries
  • Understanding of responsive design principles
  • Customer-facing site design experience
  • User Flows and Journey Mapping
  • Sketch usage is a MUST
  • Developers and PMs to bring a Design to life
  • Highly Collaborative
  • E-commerce experience is a plus

We

  • Strive daily to transform the fashion industry, from working with existing top brands to creating our own private label collections from the ground up
  • Are a Sequoia Capital-backed, growth-stage startup co-founded by two women
  • have styled countless amazing women across the country in the past three years they are at the core of everything that we do
  • Foster a culture of autonomy and accountability your contributions make a big difference
  • Have an office that is buzzing with excitement we are genuinely happy to be at work each day
  • Celebrate each other’s individuality and unique skill sets
  • Create good karma by aiming to surprise and delight at every touchpoint
Apply for job

items.title: Product Owner
items.content:
Product Owner at AirDev

Remote | Freelance

Remote / San Francisco, California | Contract / Full-time

Thanks for your interest in this position – we’re excited to build great software together! Below is some basic info about us and the role, so you know what you’re getting into.

About AirDev

We founded AirDev to change how custom software is made. Our goals are to dramatically lower the technical and financial barriers to making technical products and to enable people without traditional coding skills to make a good living building those products.

Co-founders Andrew and Vlad were some of the original Bubble users in 2013, and were amazed at the web platforms they could build without a technical background. They started AirDev in 2015 as the first Bubble agency, building apps for clients of all shapes and sizes.

We’ve grown significantly since and now help hundreds of clients all over the globe, from one-person startups to large enterprises, build high-quality software in a matter of weeks.

About the role and its responsibilities

Product Owners act as the Head of Product/CTO for our clients, helping them think through their idea and turn it into concrete requirements that our developers and designers can execute on. Their primary task is to create a product that’s as good as possible while ensuring that it’s scoped to meet the client’s timeline and budget. Their specific responsibilities include:

  • Discuss the project with the client and determine what functionality is needed
  • Help the client think through their different options, corner cases, and simplest ways to build something
  • Research answers to technical questions that involve API integrations or complex workflows
  • Put together detailed specifications and wireframes based on the project requirements as well as our standards
  • Work with the development and design teams to execute on the project, providing feedback and guidance as needed
  • Help the client iterate on the product based on data, development best practices, and customer feedback

Qualities we look for

We value a mix of hard and soft skills, as well alignment to our core values in all of our people. Some specific qualities for this role include:

  • Excellent communication skills: Product Owners spend majority of their time interacting with clients, so they need to be very clear and structured in both verbal and written communication.
  • Product sense and commitment to simplicity: We see a large range of ideas and Product Owners should be able to quickly figure out the simplest way to turn those ideas into products, no matter what the industry or application.
  • Analytical skills: Designing software can be quite complex, so we look for strong conceptual and logical thinkers.
  • Software Experience: Ideal candidates will have 2+ years of experience building software, using Bubble or code (as either a developer or Product Manager).
  • Time management and being task-oriented: We work with lots of clients at once and always stick to our deadlines, which requires diligence and constantly moving the ball forward.
  • Enjoy intellectual & creative challenges: Finding the right technical solution to a human need is both an art and a science, and those who enjoy solving complex problems tend to be best suited for this role.
Apply for job

items.title: Product manager - leading London Fintech
items.content:
Who are we?


Squirrel is a simple app that changes people’s lives for the better – by managing their money for them. Instead of getting paid into a bank account, Squirrel users get paid into Squirrel! The app then saves and budgets for them. Paying money into their bank account just before they need it – for bills, weekly spending, and when they finish saving up for something. It’s rare for ideas to be good for the world, unique, profitable, and be fun and challenging to work on – but Squirrel is all of these things!


The opportunity:


We are developing the next generation of Squirrel using Open Banking technologies. This is an amazing opportunity to help shape a product of the future from the outset. We've been awarded government funding through the Innovate UK Smart Grant initiative. You'll be leading a top tech team to design, develop and evolve a life-changing product.


What we’re looking for:


The ideal candidate will be a product manager with some experience handlng complex onboarding. We're looking for individuals who are grounded in user feedback and testing, with demonstrable experience in a relevant field. Fintech experience may be a bonus, but isn't essential.


Location: Ideally you’ll be London based, but we’re willing to consider remote workers in other parts of the UK (with occasional travel to the London office).

items.title: Health Educator - Remote (Preferred locations: Denver, CO or Atlanta, GA) - PS24629
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Health Educator - Remote (Preferred locations: Denver, CO or Atlanta, GA) - PS24629
**Location:** **United States**
**New**
**Requisition #:** PS24629
**Post Date:** 1 day ago
_Your Talent. Our Vision._ **At Anthem, Inc.,** it s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will **drive the future of health care** .
This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.
**Health Educator**
**Location:** Remote; Preferred locations: Denver, CO and Atlanta, GA.
**Hours:** Mon-Thur 3:30 pm - 12:00 am EST
Friday- 2:30-11:00 pm EST
Every 5th Saturday 11:00 am - 7:30 pm EST
Your knowledge of chronic health conditions and enthusiasm for health education and wellness is just what our members are seeking! At Anthem, emphasizing the importance of health and wellness among our members means healthy living as well for our employees. That's why we seek Health Education professionals who embody our commitment to living well, who share a
passion to influence others and advocate healthy living. The knowledge and information our health educators provide to our members positively impacts healthy life choices, provides a sense of well-being, helps prevent chronic and/or preventable conditions, and helps them to access the numerous resources available to them.
As we add Health Educator staff for our call center's Health and Wellness telephonic Coaching Programs, we look for individuals who share in our beliefs. If you are enthusiastic about helping others live healthier lives and a rewarding career opportunity, this unique opportunity is just for you. In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, our educators enjoy every Sunday off plus paid holidays, and work from home.
As a **Health Educator** within a call center environment, you'll be focused on:
+ Making enrollment calls to members who are eligible for telephonic wellness programs.
+ Assessing health information for members with various coaching needs that may include chronic conditions, lifestyle management, weight management, and smoking cessation.
+ Setting up goals and providing coaching as well as telephonic follow up calls to members to continue to work on health goals.
+ Encourage members to get connected to resources that are available to them through their insurance, which could include participation in additional or different coaching programs.
Here are just a few ways in which your clinical knowledge and expertise may be utilized:
+ Utilize motivational interviewing skills to provide health coaching for members with chronic conditions or other identified health needs.
+ Implementing and/or coordinating coaching care plans and discussing clinical health recommendations and preventative recommendations.
+ Assist with increasing participant's motivational level by addressing barriers and assessing needs.
+ BA/BS in appropriate field of specialization (health educator, public health, nutrition, exercise physiology, RT, SW, or other related field);
+ 2 years of medical health coaching related experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
+ Medical Health coaching with adult population is strongly preferred.
+ PC skills within a windows environment are required.
+ Prior call center or telephonic health education/clinical coaching experience a plus.
+ CHES certification an added plus.
+ Bi-lingual English/Spanish a plus.
This position is remote, must live within 50 miles of an Anthem office location. Preferred locations are Denver, CO or Atlanta, GA.
**_Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of America s Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2018 DiversityInc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.antheminc.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran._**

items.content:
We Are Hiring
What if you found an opportunity where your skills were used to impact lives? We are looking for a Remote Transformational Consultant to propel Ascension into the future. If you enjoy creating something new, dreaming big, and have a passion for your expertise we encourage you to apply!
Why Join Ascension?
Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the largest non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, with special attention to persons living in poverty and those most vulnerable. In FY2018, Ascension provided nearly $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs. Our Mission, Vision and Values guide everything we do at Ascension. They are foundational to our work to transform healthcare and express our priorities when providing care and services, particularly to those most in need.
Ascension includes approximately 156,000 associates and 34,000 aligned providers. Our national health system operates more than 2,600 sites of care - including 151 hospitals and more than 50 senior living facilities - in 21 states and the District of Columbia, while providing a variety of services including physician practice management, venture capital investing, investment management, biomedical engineering, facilities management, clinical care management, information services, risk management, and contracting through Ascension's own group purchasing organization.
In 2018, Ascension adopted our Advanced Strategic Direction, reaffirming our commitment to provide Healthcare That Works, Healthcare That Is Safe, and Healthcare That Leaves No One Behind, for Life, while embracing a Dual Transformation strategy with a new perspective that reflects the rapidly evolving healthcare environment. Our Advanced Strategic Direction provides the transformational strategic agenda that will enable Ascension to continue to deliver on our Mission commitment while ensuring a vibrant, sustainable health ministry for the future.

What You Will Do
As one of the early members of Ascension's newly-formed Transformation Management team, you will play a key role in establishing and growing this critical team with a System mandate to help transform our current core healthcare delivery system, while also developing new, transformational models for the future.
In this role, you will have the ability to make an immediate impact. You'll be in the thick of the action for Ascension as you work side-by-side with senior leaders who were hand-picked to lead our transformational journey.

items.content:
We Are Hiring
What if you found an opportunity where your skills were used to impact lives? We are looking for a Remote Transformational Consultant to propel Ascension into the future. If you enjoy creating something new, dreaming big, and have a passion for your expertise we encourage you to apply!
Why Join Ascension?
Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the largest non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, with special attention to persons living in poverty and those most vulnerable. In FY2018, Ascension provided nearly $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs. Our Mission, Vision and Values guide everything we do at Ascension. They are foundational to our work to transform healthcare and express our priorities when providing care and services, particularly to those most in need.
Ascension includes approximately 156,000 associates and 34,000 aligned providers. Our national health system operates more than 2,600 sites of care - including 151 hospitals and more than 50 senior living facilities - in 21 states and the District of Columbia, while providing a variety of services including physician practice management, venture capital investing, investment management, biomedical engineering, facilities management, clinical care management, information services, risk management, and contracting through Ascension's own group purchasing organization.
In 2018, Ascension adopted our Advanced Strategic Direction, reaffirming our commitment to provide Healthcare That Works, Healthcare That Is Safe, and Healthcare That Leaves No One Behind, for Life, while embracing a Dual Transformation strategy with a new perspective that reflects the rapidly evolving healthcare environment. Our Advanced Strategic Direction provides the transformational strategic agenda that will enable Ascension to continue to deliver on our Mission commitment while ensuring a vibrant, sustainable health ministry for the future.

What You Will Do
As one of the early members of Ascension's newly-formed Transformation Management team, you will play a key role in establishing and growing this critical team with a System mandate to help transform our current core healthcare delivery system, while also developing new, transformational models for the future.
In this role, you will have the ability to make an immediate impact. You'll be in the thick of the action for Ascension as you work side-by-side with senior leaders who were hand-picked to lead our transformational journey.
You will serve as an important supporting role to the managers and directors helping coordinate cross-functional Design Teams tasked with defining transformation opportunities, designing prototypes, piloting solutions and implementing validated opportunities to reimagine the future of our industry consistent with our Advanced Strategic Direction and commitment to Dual Transformation.
This work will require you to be agile and proactive and utilize your analytical capabilities, presentation creation and delivery skills, and your ability to draw insights from large complex datasets.
As Transformation Consultant, you will report to Ascension Strategy Ministry Wide Function leadership, with exposure to senior level executives across the organization.
In this role, you will have the ability to work remotely with understood accessibility to a major airport for required travel.
Key Responsibilities
As a Transformation Consultant, your analytical, interpersonal, and critical thinking skills will be called upon from day one. You will be working alongside a team pursuing transformational opportunities that will shape and drive the overall strategy of Ascension consistent with our Advanced Strategic Direction and commitment to Dual Transformation.
  • Partner with and support Transformation Directors and Managers working in an agile manner to support Design Teams tasked with developing transformational opportunities
  • Aggregate, clean, consolidate and analyze complex data sets across multiple sources and develop key insights
  • Develop complex analytical models that provide insight and drive decision making
  • Identify and analyze research articles, secondary data, and industry reports
  • Create profiles of competitors / model companies, technologies, processes, etc.
  • Create required PowerPoint presentations
  • Support key deliverables for business case, Minimally Viable Product (MVP) or solution development
  • Assist with Design Team project management on an as needed basis
What You Will Need
Education:
  • Bachelor's degree required with a focus in business preferred; MBA preferred
Experience:
  • 1-3 years of experience in consulting, finance, or other similar experience where analytical and critical thinking skills are transferable.
  • Health care experience a plus.
  • A detail-oriented and highly-organized structured thinker who possess exceptional organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced, complex work environment
  • Superior analytical skills with the ability to draw insights from complex datasets to inform decision making; proficient in financial modeling
  • A solid team player who is also an independent thinker
  • Must be deadline driven, organized and able to multi-task
  • Advanced Microsoft Office expertise (including PowerPoint, Word, and Excel)
  • Ability and willingness to travel 50+% to perform essential duties of the job
#m!t2020
Equal Employment Opportunity
Ascension is an EEO/AA employer: M/F/Disabled/Vet. For further information regarding your EEO rights, click on the following link to the \"EEO is the Law\" poster:
\"
Please note that Ascension will make an offer of employment only to individuals who have applied for a position using our official application. Be on alert for possible fraudulent offers of employment. Ascension will not solicit money or banking information from applicants.
E-Verify Statement
Ascension participates in the Electronic Employment Verification Program. Please click the E-Verify link below for more information.
E -Verify (link to E-verify site)

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
At WeGift, we’re on a mission to completely reinvent rewards by delivering open value, real time digital gifts, on demand. So far, we have built a unique and trusted product and work with many of the world’s leading gift card brands (like Amazon, Nike and Uber) and corporate partners (like Perkbox, Vouchercodes.co.uk and Coinbase). 


We recognise that building a world-class business requires a world-class effort, so we make sure that each team member is appreciated for the unique value and skills they bring. We are driven by the knowledge that there are still millions of businesses and consumers (in a £600 billion industry!) that we can help. If you’re looking for an environment that will inspire you to dream bigger, work harder and make a difference every day, you’re in the right place.


The Role


We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to take the lead on the go-to-market strategy for our new products and features. In this role you will support our sales and marketing teams by articulating a compelling value proposition and company vision to our brands, buyers and customers. 


On a day-to-day basis you will: 



  • Create a go-to-market strategy and manage execution for our new products and features that is best-in-class and differentiates from the competition. 

  • Build core content that tells compelling stories about our products internally and externally.

  • Carry out market analysis and pricing analysis to drive strategic decisions that are in line with our growth plans.

  • Obtain insights into customers’ usage of current products and untapped opportunities through sales data and customer interviews .

  • Work with the Product,  Marketing and CS teams to deliver data sheets, marketing content and user guides.

  • Assist with product release planning, market feed-back, and product launches.



What we are looking for: 



  • Background in B2B sales or marketing, with 4+ years of specific Product Marketing experience

  • Ability to understand complex concepts and translate them into simple and appealing propositions 

  • Strong project management skills 

  • Experience in the SaaS tech sector 

  • A desire to work in a small collaborative team

  • Great organisational and time-management skills


Compensation 



  • £60k-70k


Benefits



  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new WeWork office based in Monument, London.

  • A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.

  • Catered lunch once a week.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Email Marketing Manager
items.content:
Email Marketing Manager at Illuminate Education

Remote

Level: Experienced

Job Location: Irvine, CA – Irvine, CA

Position Type: Full Time

Education Level: Bachelor’s Degree

About Illuminate Education

Illuminate Education partners with K-12 educators to equip them with data to serve the whole child and reach new levels of student performance. Our solution brings together holistic data and collaborative tools and puts them in the hands of educators. Moment-by-moment, our users can visualize each student’s progress, determine the right instructional or intervention strategy, and take the next best action. Headquartered in Irvine, CA, Illuminate supports over 17 million students and 5200 schools and districts across all 50 states.

About the Opportunity

Position Overview
Do you have a knack for getting the right emails into the right inboxes at the right times? Do you live to see those open and clickthrough rates climb higher? We’re seeking an expert email marketer to join our team. You’ll be expected to develop and track email campaigns to ultimately increase our business’ email marketing success.

Location
Remote option for the right candidate.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage various email campaigns, including the template designs, calls-to-action, and content used in our email sends.
  • Segment lists based on behaviors like past email engagement and website interactions (content downloads, site page visits, etc.).
  • Measure results and optimize the lead nurturing workflows for these segments to convert leads into customers.
  • Work to minimize list decay and unsubscribes while increasing the productivity of our email sends.
  • Develop documentation and road maps for processes, A/B tests, and promotions that succeed through email.

Key Experience & Qualifications

  • BA/BS in English, journalism, marketing or a related discipline.
  • Past experience with email marketing, lead nurturing, marketing automation, and web analytics.
  • Excellent understanding of email marketing concepts and metrics such as sender score, deliverability, and sender reputation.
  • Proficiency in email marketing and marketing automation technology.
  • Highly analytical and able to derive meaning from data through A/B testing and email optimization.
  • Excellent writer and communicator (in both written and verbal form).
Apply for job

items.title: SEO Specialist (Remote)
items.content:
Pandable is a small but experienced SEO Agency with a remote team spanning across Europe and the US. We’re ambitious and fast-growing, and our clients range from exciting early stage startups to global companies, predominantly in finance and tech. We have big growth plans and are looking for a proactive SEO Specialist to help deliver outstanding results for client campaigns.


 


The role is both exciting and challenging: you will be given autonomy and responsibility, whilst being fully supported by the Managing Director and Performance Strategist.


 


Key Responsibilities



  • Work with leadership team to deliver successful campaigns for Pandable’s SEO clients

  • Communicate directly with clients where relevant

  • Develop in-depth, actionable strategic SEO roadmaps to achieve client goals

  • Carry out on-page and technical audits to identify issues and opportunities

  • Carry out content and backlink analysis to identify issues and opportunities

  • Work with clients and development teams to fix technical SEO issues

  • Perform ongoing keyword research and analysis

  • Research content and contribute to topic ideation and brainstorming sessions

  • Manage the production of and optimise on-site and off-site content

  • Develop and implement link building campaigns, including data research, content development, and outreach management

  • Report on performance against benchmarks and propose improvements

  • Work with leadership team to measure, monitor, and analyse SEO performance

  • Contribute to Pandable’s marketing activity when relevant


 


Personal specification



  • 2+ years experience in a similar agency based role

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=57, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=29}
items.content:
Technical Co-Founder / Head of Engineering (for Post-$X million Seed)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Customer Data Platform, Financial Technology, Insurance
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Trellis Technologies | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time +/- 4 hours

Technologies

node.js
reactjs
javascript

Job description

We are looking for an engineering leader with a “find a way or make a way” attitude who can report to the CEO, build a team of 3-4 engineers, and lead them both technically and managerially.

This opportunity is for someone excited for autonomy, ownership, and breadth of responsibility.

We are currently 100% Remote. Our CEO happens to be based in San Francisco, CA.

Our environment is typical of a start-up:

  • Small team, fast-paced, we all get a lot done by everyone wearing many hats.
  • We are serious about optimizing our time and staying focused on the most important goals and outcomes.
  • We have remote team members and are completely on board with 100% remote work.
  • We coordinate using a kanban board, hold a daily standup, and mostly communicate via ad hoc video calls and Slack.
  • Our technology is written in NodeJS and React and lives on the Google Cloud Platform.

We use Javascript full-stack

  • Our technology uses NodeJS and React
  • We have a variety of services on different parts of Google Cloud Platform (GAE, GKE, GCF).
  • We are looking for someone proficient in Javascript/ES6 and ideally quite familiar with the technologies above

Build something challenging.

This isn't just another CRUD application. Your challenge will be to deliver a highly-available service on top of a dynamic collection of third-party data sources whose priority is anything other than making your job easy. Explore the limits of your own resourcefulness by designing human and automated systems that deliver true reliability in an otherwise unpredictable environment.

See if you fit our requirements.

For this role, we are looking for someone with the following characteristics:

  • 2+ years experience building and managing a team of engineers
  • 5-10 years experience working in back-end applications
  • 2+ years experience working with front-end applications
  • Deep familiarity with ES6/NodeJS including deep understanding of promises, async/await
  • Bonus for familiarity with Chromium/Puppeteer and/or DOM manipulation/selection
  • Ability to acutely focus on company objectives and mission at hand.
  • Proven dedication to creating maintainable, functional, and reliable systems.
  • Ability to pass a background check; have appropriate work authorization

To achieve our mission, we always look for high-caliber people who share our core values:

  • Grit: Resilient problem solvers who finish what they start and love tackling problems of all sizes. We take critical feedback and push through to get the job done.
  • Collaboration: Egos can be left at home, our focus is on the best outcome, which means regularly challenging each other and being willing to be wrong.
  • Extreme Ownership: We sign up for big challenges and take extreme ownership to see it through. We make lemonade out of lemons when we have to and don’t let frustration get in the way of getting it done.
  • Curiosity: We’re passionate learners and get excited to nerd out over non-work related topics at a perhaps unnecessary level of detail.
  • Honesty: We’re transparent and honest because that’s the right way to treat other people. Integrity is the basis of trust, and trust is everything when you’re creating the future together.
Apply now

About Trellis Technologies

About the Team
Brand new company; brand new team!

We'll be a small team of 3-4 engineers + 1 Business Development leader + the CEO.

Our Founder & CEO, Daniel Demetri, is a second-time founder. He was most recently the Co-Founder & Chief Product Officer of States Title, a VC-backed insurance start-up recently valued in the $XXX millions. Prior to States Title, Daniel led Product Management for Earnest, an online student loan refinance company helping millenials save millions on their student loans. Daniel is a graduate of Google's Associate Product Manager program, where he led parts of Google Ads and Google Maps.

Our technology so far has been built by ex-Google colleagues of the CEO, on a contract basis, but we just signed our first customer and need to upgrade to a full-time team!

About Trellis
Founded in 2019, and backed by a syndicate of top VC's led by General Catalyst, Trellis is on a mission to to make it simpler and easier for Americans to get the right insurance with the best value.

We offer elegant, modern software and API's that make it safer and easier for anyone to share private insurance information and for developers to replace complex and effortful user journeys with personalized, delightful experiences.

In the market for personal lines of insurance, where $25+ billion are spent each year just on marketing and distribution, this is a very big deal.

If you have car insurance, you can try our demo at https://trellisconnect.com/demo

Benefits

  • 100% Remote OK
  • Equity grants in %-points, not shares #'s
  • Ground-up development; no tech debt
  • Small, nimble, fast-paced, high-impact start-up
  • Terrific culture focused on focus, efficiency, impact, and inclusion
  • Backing by Top Silicon Valley VC's

items.title: Product Manager, Community Edition Manager at Contrast Security (Baltimore, MD)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Product Manager, Community Edition Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Cybersecurity, Enterprise Software, Security Software
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Contrast Security | Baltimore, MD

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Baltimore, MD. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

security
saas
ab-testing
product-management

Job description

Ready to shake things up? At Contrast we recognize that the cloud has dramatically changed the dynamics of application development, and that modern software requires a modern software security model. We strive to make security intrinsic to DevOps without compromising speed and without the need for specialized skills. Our business is growing at an incredible pace and we are expanding teams across our organization to support customer demand. Now is the time to get on board. It’s an awesome place to work, and we’re looking for super stars. We are looking for a dynamic product manager to lead growth initiatives for our Assess and Protect offerings. These initiatives include:

  • Contrast Community Edition – a freemium version of our SaaS services targeting the developer and DevOps community.
  • Software Composition Analysis (SCA) offering – focused on capturing the market for open source security use cases.

We need an energetic, talented, and data-driven individual who can drive strategic services and marketing campaigns with a targeted focus on user acquisition, engagement, retention and conversion.

Responsibilities

  • Own the business and roadmap for our new Software Composition Analysis (SCA) offering, driving the product vision, strategy, and execution for the service across SaaS and on-prem deployment models.
  • Own the strategy and roadmap for Contrast Community edition focused on the Developer and DevOps personas. Drive new features and marketing campaigns to grow the freemium user base and convert users to our paid Assess and Protect offerings.
  • Inform product decisions with quantitative analysis based on user behavior analytics and experimentation (A/B testing, ...)
  • Drive and own the product requirements process while working collaboratively with key stakeholders to prioritize and validate technology, features, product direction and strategy.
  • Influence the Product Development and R&D teams while helping them better understand what to build and why.
  • Collaborate with customers, sales, engineering and designers on fresh new concepts
  • Establish clear metrics and KPIs to continuously evaluate business performance and feature usability with a direct feedback loop into the product strategy.
  • Develop a deep understanding of the market landscape and identify key areas of competitive differentiation and market disruption.
  • Work side-by-side with product marketing on positioning and marketing campaigns.

About You

  • A talent for driving organic growth through freemium offerings and user conversion.
  • Demonstrated ability to leverage service usage analytics, user research and financial analysis to drive decisions and service improvements.
  • Excellent communicator, with natural ability to communicate effectively with internal stakeholders, customers and at trade shows, industry events and webinars.
  • Detail oriented and organized. You’re able to transmute various, conflicting inputs into a focused narrative that engineering can drive and deliver.
  • Experience owning a SaaS product line ideally targeting the Developer and DevOps persona.
  • Experience in one or more of the following markets and technologies: Developer/DevOps Tools, Software Composition Analysis (SCA), Open Source Software Security, Application Security Testing, Web Application Firewalls (WAF)
  • Previous knowledge of the most prevalent web application security vulnerabilities and exploits is a strong plus.
  • Solid understanding of the developer community, tools and supporting ecosystem.
  • Strong customer empathy and relationship building
  • Demonstrated ability to distill and present research findings, market analysis and product requirements for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Demonstrated strong, structured and data-driven problem-solving and prioritization skills for multi-dimensional problems.
  • Demonstrated experience with Agile and Lean development practices.
  • Outstanding organizational skills to coordinate various creative, technical, and administrative projects across the organization.
  • A minimum of 2 years of experience in Product Management for SaaS based security offerings.
  • Bachelor's degree in engineering; MBA preferred
Apply now

About Contrast Security

At Contrast, our goal is the make the Internet safer day by day. We are always interested in meeting talented and creative technologists who share this goal. We’ve built some amazing technology thus far and are shaking up the way the world looks at application security. We know that our products can get better with new voices and ideas.

Are you looking to make a difference? Are you a problem solver, but want to be challenged with complex and interesting problems. Do you believe the best work is the result of finding the simplest solution to complex challenges? Do you long to be an early contributor to a product and a company culture? Do you ever wish you were there in the early days of these startups everyone is talking about? Here's a little about what we offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Daily team lunches
  • Meaningful stock plans
  • Medical, dental, and vision benefits
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Choice of a MacBook Pro or Microsoft Surface Pro 

Benefits

  • Fantastic Medical, Dental and Vision which we cover most of the costs!
  • Free lunches most days and a packed fridge of snacks and drinks
  • Stock options, Competitive comp, Performance-based option grants
  • Flexible and open vacation model
  • 401k, HSA, FSA options
  • Choice of a brand new MacBook Pro or Microsoft Surface Pro
  • Amazing views of Baltimore including 2 outside decks on the water.
  • Exciting work in the field of security using cutting-edge tech stack
  • Competitive benefits and time off for new/expecting parents
  • Dog friendly office

items.content:
Technical Product Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Healthcare, Information Technology, SaaS
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Redox | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

continuous-integration
amazon-web-services
typescript
node.js

Job description

Redox is seeking an outstanding Technical Product Manager who thrives in a fast-paced Agile Scrum development lifecycle and quickly evolving market landscape. As a Redox Technical Product Manager, you will be the primary stakeholder for a product area - working with a highly motivated, boundary pushing delivery team to take feature concepts to delivered customer value. You will be the key decision maker for the product area backlog for the delivery team. In addition to embedding with the delivery team, Product owners at Redox work closely with all aspects of the company, including product marketing, sales, engineering, and customer success.

Responsibilities:

    • Collaborate with sales engineers, the product marketing team, and company executive leadership to transform big picture strategy into detailed user stories
    • Develop and maintain a strong understanding of our customer base and core business value in healthcare to ensure we continuously deliver more value to our customers and are thinking five steps ahead of the industry
    • Collaborate with engineers on a daily basis to share vision and context for decision making as they design and develop the product
    • Provide feature details and business context to the product marketing team for product releases
    • Develop clear and detailed product specifications for developers
    • Reviewing and contributing to technical documentation on product features

Preferred Skills and Experience:

    • Experience in product development, with prior experience as a product owner
    • A bachelor’s degree in computer science or corresponding professional experience (3+ years) as a programmer, DevOps Engineer, or Linux system administrator
    • Experience with teams building complex, horizontally and vertically scaling software systems using microservices, APIs, and cloud infrastructure such as AWS or Azure
    • Familiarity with continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) process
    • Familiarity with network and enterprise security concepts
    • Strong communication skills with an ability to share context from the customer experience with actionable detail
Apply now

About Redox

At Redox, our mission is to make healthcare data useful.

We believe that true change in healthcare depends on technical innovation and that technical innovation will only happen when developers have access to useful healthcare data. The systems that currently store this data are decades old. They exchange data over antiquated, confusing, and inconsistently implemented standards. We are building the data exchange platform, backed by a network of hundreds of health systems and thousands of app developers, that provides consistent, easy access to the developers building the next generation of healthcare technology.

By eliminating access to healthcare data as a barrier to entry, we are enabling the technical innovation that will allow healthcare providers to better care for patients and for patients to better control their health.

Benefits

  • Transparent Communication- Regular All Team Meetings
  • Remote work - work anywhere in the US!
  • Open Source languages
  • Open PTO - Flexible time off
  • Health Insurance Day 1
  • 401k Day 1
  • Parental Leave
  • Productivity Stipend

items.title: Pandable: SEO Specialist
items.content:
SEO Specialist

Pandable is a small but experienced SEO Agency with a remote team spanning across Europe and the US. We’re ambitious and fast-growing, and our clients range from exciting early stage startups to global companies, predominantly in finance and tech. We have big growth plans and are looking for a proactive SEO Specialist to help deliver outstanding results for client campaigns.

The role is both exciting and challenging: you will be given autonomy and responsibility, whilst being fully supported by the Managing Director and Performance Strategist.

Key Responsibilities
  • Work with leadership team to deliver successful campaigns for Pandable’s SEO clients
  • Communicate directly with clients where relevant
  • Develop in-depth, actionable strategic SEO roadmaps to achieve client goals
  • Carry out on-page and technical audits to identify issues and opportunities
  • Carry out content and backlink analysis to identify issues and opportunities
  • Work with clients and development teams to fix technical SEO issues
  • Perform ongoing keyword research and analysis
  • Research content and contribute to topic ideation and brainstorming sessions
  • Manage the production of and optimise on-site and off-site content
  • Develop and implement link building campaigns, including data research, content development, and outreach management
  • Report on performance against benchmarks and propose improvements
  • Work with leadership team to measure, monitor, and analyse SEO performance
  • Contribute to Pandable’s marketing activity when relevant

Personal specification
  • 2+ years experience in a similar agency based role
  • Confident written and verbal communicator
  • Ambitious person who never wants to stop growing and learning
  • Self motivated, with excellent organisation skills
  • Love solving complex problems by being creative and thinking on your feet
  • Entrepreneurial spirit, with a willingness to work independently
  • Highly proactive approach to client and agency performance
  • Genuine enthusiasm and a can-do attitude

Benefits
  • Unlimited holidays
  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote working and team building events
  • Opportunity for fast progression within the agency

Salary range: £22,000 - £28,000 DOE

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) MM/PP - Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP

We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP MM/PP specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong MM/PP experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to.

What You Will Be Doing

- The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Materials Management and Production Planning (MM/PP) modules
- SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the MM and PP modules in the SAP functional area
- Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution
- Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support,
- Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices,
- Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas,
- Supports multiple projects and BAU activities,
- Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration
- Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles

What You Need for this Position

- 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment,
- Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success,
- Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite,
- Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls,
- Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation,
- Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles
- Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape,
- Experience in designing SAP software components,
- Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools,
- Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies,
- Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment,
- College or University (IT /Business) Degree,
- Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of MM/PP
- Expert SAP technical knowledge,
- Expert Integration understanding,
- Strong spoken and written English,
- Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP MM/PP specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.title: TaxJar: Technical Product Manager
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Technical Product Manager

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 20,000 businesses.

Our core values

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 100+ people is growing quickly. We have an immediate opening for an experienced Product Manager to join our Product Engineering team.

We're looking for an entrepreneurial, creative and analytical product manager that is eager to make an impact on a game-changing product in eCommerce. Someone that has the passion to lead the product decisions for TaxJar's core products to drive significant growth and adoption for the business.

On our team you will have the opportunity to shape our product strategy and roadmap as well as helping ensure each feature launch is a success. Working with our senior team leaders at TaxJar you will be right in the middle of making eCommerce easier for everyone.

*This is a full-time remote position available to folks located in the US.

As a Technical Product Manager for TaxJar you will

  • Deeply understand the needs and desires of merchants, developers, and CPAs who collect and remit sales tax. You're experienced at demonstrating the value of a software solution to multiple segments of customers, and you know how to tailor the experience to each.
  • Use your experience and your full range of product development skills to produce thoughtfully simple sales tax features.
  • Analyze data to help make better product decisions and always be fine tuning our product strategy and roadmap.
  • Manage, maintain and communicate the product roadmap to the company
  • At times, communicate directly with states and local jurisdictions to identify and clarify sales and use tax laws and rules and understand how they impact our customers.
  • Be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming the next product innovation to working directly with designers, marketing and developers leading up to launch.
  • Bring new perspectives on how we can improve our product to better serve our customers, while ensuring we stay true to our focus, core values and mission
  • Be comfortable with ambiguity, have strong attention to detail, and be excited to work in a fully-distributed environment with multiple teams.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 3 - 6 years of experience in agile SaaS product management, preferably in small business, payroll or taxes
  • Experience in strategic planning and implementation of product launch campaigns
  • Data driven, with strong problem framing and analytical skills. You must be able to properly frame and size complex problems, then break them down into actionable steps
  • Strong interpersonal skills; you will need to develop strong relationships with developers, customer success, sales and marketing team members, state employees, and stressed-out customers
  • You have the perfect combination of patience and an intense bias for action
  • Superior attention to detail, with strong process and documentation skills
  • Clear, concise writer
  • Self-directed, self-motivated
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (Basecamp, chat, zoom, email, etc)

You’ll be a great fit on our team if you

  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • 401k Plan
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

items.title: Insights Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Who are Opensignal?


Opensignal, a mobile analytics company, is the global standard for measuring real-world mobile network experience. Using billions of measurements collected 24/7 from tens of millions of smartphones, we analyze real-world mobile network experience at the largest scale and frequency in the wireless industry. We believe measuring how the network performs directly through users’ eyes is key to building better wireless networks. Our insights are used across the industry by mobile operators, telecoms regulators, equipment manufacturers and analysts. We have done business across six continents and have driven press headlines in 80 countries, in an industry impacting the lives of billions around the world.


Founded in 2010, Opensignal is a high-growth global company harnessing the power of mobile technologies and big data analytics to redefine how the mobile industry measures network performance. We’re part of the Global Telecoms ‘Power 100’, TechCity Future Fifty, and backed by an impressive portfolio of investors.


Having doubled our employee base to 60 at the beginning of 2019, we plan to grow beyond 80 by the end of 2019, to help drive our vision further. We're headquartered in London, UK, where you’ll find most of our employees, who we like to call 'Opensignalers', although we do have local teams based in the US who you will also work with. A truly international company, our ‘Opensignalers’ work across four continents, and represent over 25 nationalities.


Find out more by visiting our website


 


Purpose of the role


Opensignal collects vast amounts of unique data on the real-world experience of mobile networks globally. We are looking to add to our existing team of analysts to enhance our ability to communicate important data-based insights on the mobile telecom market, further cementing our position as the independent global standard for understanding the true state of mobile network experience. This is a US home-based role.


 


As an Insights Analyst, you will be responsible for:



  • Developing ideas on new ways to explore Opensignal’s data

  • Communicating your analysis in writing for publication externally

  • Placing Opensignal data and analytics into wider context with the developments in the mobile telecom industry e.g. the arrival of 5G, mobile operator strategies, auctions of wireless spectrum, mobile video streaming etc.

  • Adapting the analysis to the needs of different audiences and countries, for example across the US, South America, EMEA and Asia.

  • Collaborating closely with the wider Opensignal teams including Data Science, Engineering, Marketing and PR, to uncover and produce innovative insights

  • Creating compelling visualizations using Opensignal data


 


What we need from you:



  • The ideal person for the role will have experience working in the telecom industry or media outlet, for example: industry website; trade newsletter or magazine; industry analyst company; telecom consultancy; industry organization, telecom operator or vendor.


    • Knowledge of the US telecoms market would be a bonus!


  • Excellent and proven written communication skills - the ability to write clearly and concisely and communicate both quantitative and qualitative analysis in English is essential

  • Strong desire and passion for writing – we’d love it if this is something you really enjoy!

  • Excellent organisational skills – the ability to collaborate on multiple projects and pieces of insights in parallel is essential for the success in this role

  • Numerate, with the ability to use basic quantitative tools e.g. Excel

  • Ability to structure thinking using both qualitative and quantitative sources, adapting and showcasing this in an audience-centric manner


Ideal, but not essential:



  • Experience creating clear visualizations of data which succinctly communicate the insights from a piece of analysis.

  • Experience with visualization tools, e.g. Looker, R, Tableau, PowerPoint, plot.ly, etc


 


What will you get in return?



  • Competitive salary, stock options and on-target commission program to share our growth

  • Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, matched-based 401(k) plan, attractive time off allowance and MacBook of your choice

  • Constant exposure to learning opportunities in your role and the ability to make an impact from day one, as well as a personal development budget for conferences, courses & training

  • Our 'Opensignalers' - an ambitious, focused and friendly team backed by some of Europe's top investors

  • Ability to work flexibly as well as regular all-company events, such as our bi-annual away days and quarterly company updates, where we bring our global ‘Opensignalers’ together at HQ.


To understand how we will be holding your information please take a look at our Recruitment Privacy Notice.

items.title: Content Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We’re Tailify - awarded Europe’s best influencer marketing agency in 2019. They told us influencer marketing couldn’t work. But since 2013, we’ve been shaking up the media landscape with our simple, data-driven solution to connect advertisers with social influencers. The result? High-impact content, powerful partnerships and multiple awards. Great ideas can come from anywhere, and at Tailify we let everyone hold the mic. You’ll get real responsibility in an exciting, entrepreneurial environment with big global clients and plenty of room to grow. We think media land should have a wider horizon. Come and join a real game-changer and be part of something unstoppable.


A day in the life of the Content Marketing Manager


Your role as a Content Marketing Manager sits in the heart of Tailify and you’ll be responsible for creating impactful marketing campaigns and PR activities to showcase who we are, what we do and how we do it. You’ll work directly with the founders and executive team of the company on the following:



  • Defining and refining our content marketing plan and strategy

  • Profiling our perfect clients and create campaigns towards similar clients

  • Understanding what type of content our clients wants to see in order to invest more into influencer marketing

  • Delivering on a full mix of campaign activity including content creation, copywriting, and digital channels

  • Managing and executing PR strategies, as well as working together with the PR agency to develop new strategies

  • Host internal and external events for existing and new clients

  • Managing the redesign of the company website

  • Briefing external web and design agencies

  • Positioning Tailify as thought leaders

  • Creating a portfolio of collateral to support both sales and marketing

  • Managing Tailify’s social media accounts – can be outsources

  • Executing email campaigns 


We're looking for an entrepreneurial candidate, someone that can take ownership and is also hungry to gain experience from a successful start up. You'll be a very organised and proactive person that is confident and accurate in your work. There are no limits to how this role could evolve, you will be expected to take a lot of responsibility, but also get a lot of support and learn quickly.


You’re good at:



  • Owning your workload and managing your time

  • Being proactive, anticipating challenges and juggling multiple tasks at once

  • B2B Marketing, with a BSc or MA degree in Marketing, Journalism, Business, Management, Advertising or similar

  • Creating content and copywriting (blogs, whitepapers, web copy, press releases).

  • Understanding what audiences consume and how to create it with an editorial mindset

  • Creative design with working knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign to work on things like digital illustration, graphic design, newsletters, emails and merchandise 

  • Using Wordpress, Google analytics, Slideshare

  • All things Social media! E.g. Hootsuite, Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc. 


Working with us means…



  • Working with high profile brands like L’Oréal, Coca-Cola and Universal not to mention some of the most high-profile influencers.

  • Joining ‘the startup most likely to revolutionise the media industry’ (Starcom MediaVest).

  • Enjoying every moment with a sociable bunch from all over the world.


The cherry on top



  • Holiday: 23 days plus bank holidays

  • Equipment: Your own MacBook, screen and a phone bill allowance (plus all the tech tools you could ever need)

  • Flexibility: Enjoy work-from-home Wednesdays 

  • Health: A £30 monthly wellness allowance which can go towards gym membership

  • Office: New WeWork office space with beer and prosecco on tap

  • Socials: Monthly out-of-office activities and our incredible summer party on the Thames!

items.content:
Remote Work Option
  • As a Business Analyst, you will be part of a highly collaborative scrum team with members on two continents.
  • This is an integral role in product development by ensuring the organization?s needs are articulated in the user story acceptance criteria consumed by the Agile Scrum Team.
  • In this role you will practice fundamentals of requirements gathering, system conceptual design, and scope definition.
  • You will be responsible in facilitating the shared understanding of business processes and articulating this in user scenario driven user stories
  • You will be assisting the product owner by writing and defining the acceptance criteria for the user stories included in the backlog.
  • Additionally, you will assist in conducting functional and usability testing to ensure that the Agile Scrum Team?s deliverable meet the business requirements and needs.
Key Accountability?/ Duties:
  • Uses the Product Backlog to remain highly flexible and respond to changing realities and requirements.
  • Responsible for the analysis and definition of the business and system requirements, recommends solution together with the scrum team.
  • Participate in testing efforts for the product that lead to high quality releases
  • Adds business value by delivering working products, with quality and on time, based on agreed-upon release dates
  • Self-organizes and applies cross-functional competencies to create high-value products.
  • Participate or lead backlog refinement calls and actively participates in Scrum Ceremonies.
  • Pursues continual growth related to the business domain within the respective line of business.
The Requirements:
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience as a Business Analyst
  • Requires strong business analysis, requirements gathering, and communication.
  • Willingness to solve problems by being inquisitive and curious. Strong critical thinking, attention to detail and problem solving skills are essential.
  • Experience working in Agile Development environment. Familiarity with the Scrum ceremonies.
  • Self-starter attitude and ability to work well within ambiguity
  • Demonstrated ability to multi-task and work on virtual teams
  • Adeptness at learning new technology and tools
  • Manages time effectively by placing the right focus on value added operations
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Commitment to quality and continuous improvement
  • Experience in the Human Resource domain is preferred, but not required
Tools knowledge requirements:
  • JIRA?
  • Confluence
  • PPT, Word, Excel?
  • Visio (plus)?
  • Azure Devops (plus)
Additional skills required:
  • Agile / SCRUM experience
  • Working with Remote teams
  • Global team experience
  • Strong written and speaking communication skills
  • Problem solving skills
  • Stakeholder management skills (plus)
  • Some HR knowledge (a plus)
