items.title: Growth Engineer - Remote at Toptal
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=62}
items.content:
Growth Engineer - Remote

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer, Frontend Developer
Industry: Information Technology, Recruiting, Technology Staffing
Company size: 501–1k people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Toptal | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Warsaw +/- 4 hours

Technologies

frontend
backend
seo
sem

Job description

About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $100+ million in annual revenue and triple-digit growth, Toptal is the largest fully distributed workforce in the world.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun (see this video from The Huffington Post). We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

The Growth Hacking team has the goal of delivering results as quickly and accurately as possible to address the needs of the Growth Team at Toptal. We work on diverse projects related to Traffic, SEO, SEM, front-end development, back-end development, site performance, and anything else that needs immediate attention. We run an extremely agile planning process that is directly tied to the business needs of Toptal. We are looking for developers that enjoy a diversity of projects, rapid development and release, and being more connected to the business needs of the company.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere, with a preferred location in Europe. All communication and resumes must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities:

You will join the Growth Hacking team that consists of front-end and back-end engineers to work on different projects and technologies. You will craft pages on our website to meet the marketing goals quickly, refactor back-end and front-end code to optimize website performance, and be involved in a wide variety of short-term projects covering things like SEO, SEM, conversion optimization, content marketing, website information architecture, etc. You will collaborate with the teams on both edges of the spectrum, the CMS team that is responsible for the website engine and the Public Pages team that builds pages. To thrive and flourish in the Growth Hacking team, you will need an open but critical mind of an experimenter and a get-things-done attitude.

In the first week you will:

  • Go through the Developer Bootcamp to understand and integrate with our systems.

In the first month you will:

  • Be working on technical projects related to growth.

In the first three months you will:

  • Learn and understand growth at Toptal and how our projects relate to our growth objectives.

In the first six months you will:

  • Have a deep understanding of the levers of growth as it relates to the goals of our growth channels at Toptal.

In the first year you will:

  • Help evaluate and prioritize the projects that drive growth.

Requirements:

  • Experience as a front-end developer for 2-3 years with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Experience as a back-end developer for 1-2 years, preferably with Ruby on Rails and PostgreSQL.
  • Knowledge of popular frameworks and libraries such as Bootstrap, Material UI, jQuery, Backbone, and React is a plus.
  • At least a year of experience with foundational developer tools such as git and shell, ssh.
  • An open but critical mind of an experimenter.
  • Appreciation for mostly short term project-based work and its benefits.
  • “Get things done” attitude.
  • Interest in web marketing, particularly in SEO, paid media, analytics.
  • Experience with e-commerce, advertisement, growth hacking, and conversion optimization.
  • Ability and interest in prototyping, exploration, and adopting new technologies.
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
Apply now

About Toptal

At Toptal, we value people for their contributions, not their time spent in a chair. We track goals reached, not hours worked, and we don't waste time in useless meetings. We are a completely remote company and foster a culture of relentless problem solving, direct feedback, and constant collaboration.

We analyze ideas rigorously, foster accountability, and have extremely high standards for everything we do. We are deeply invested in making sure Toptal is a place where everyone is continuously growing and learning.

Benefits

  • Remote
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Unlimited Vacation Days
  • No Mandatory Hours
  • Mentorship
  • Travel Any Time, Anywhere
  • No Office Politics

items.title: Ads Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Ads Specialist at Barrel Roll

Remote | Part-time

We’re seeking a Google Ads Specialist to join our team on a part-time basis. You will participate in strategy, planning, buying, and executing digital media campaigns on Google Ads and other advertising platforms. This is a part-time position with an estimated 20 hours per week to start. As it’s a remote position, you’ll be able to work from home or wherever you’d like!

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

You will be involved in the entire campaign cycle from start to finish, determining budgets, strategy, optimization, and even helping to create and modify the creatives used.

We’re looking for someone with a hands-on work ethic that will edit campaigns manually rather than trusting automated tools to do their work.

You’ll be working on accounts for our clients and our own campaigns. You’ll work directly with clients and as part of our team. We’re looking for people who are fluent in English, both verbally and in writing, and who can expertly communicate solutions to clients.

More About What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Actively participating in digital strategy and media planning meetings
  • Creation of paid search campaigns from ideation to execution
  • Creating detailed reports of campaign performance
  • Performing keyword research and writing ad copy
  • Detailed analysis of account performance, providing advanced recommendations for optimization
  • Work with other team members to implement a cohesive and integrated strategy
  • Analyzing online media buys
  • Compiling daily, weekly, monthly, and lifetime reports to quantify the results and communicate them to management.
  • Staying informed with Paid Search industry best practices, new trends and technologies and platform updates (e.g. Google Ads, Bing, Facebook, etc.)

REQUIREMENTS

  • Google Ads Certified (Certification must be current)
  • A minimum of 3 years experience buying online media for direct response
  • Must be an independent contractor – we’re not interested in outsourcing work to an agency
  • Experience with building and managing a media plan
  • Proven track record of success in previous job (e.g. helped a client achieve X business goal; retained a client for X amount of time)
  • Preferred example(s) of success: Helped a client grow their overall profit with paid search and has the numbers to back it up, helped a client reach a target CPA/ROAS and has the numbers to back it up. ROI examples of 500% or greater strongly preferred.
  • Experience in native channels, Facebook, and/or experience with programmatic display
  • Extensive split testing experience and serving as a primary stakeholder for conversion funnel improvements
  • Experience with copywriting and writing copy for conversions. Provide examples and some of your best-converting copy
  • Digital marketing background is preferred
  • Understands basic marketing concepts (e.g. sales funnel)
  • Familiar with jargon (e.g. PPC, CPC, CPA, ROAS, bounce rate, pages/session, etc.)
  • Reliable, takes initiative and finds ways to solve problems independently
  • Passionate about developing knowledge and personal growth in Media Buying
  • Know the basics of media buying from both the client and media buyer’s perspective
  • Analytical – able to take data and identify trends, improve performance, solve problems, etc
  • Quick at learning; attentive to detail
  • Background and/or experience with design a plus (i.e Photoshop)
  • Working Knowledge of WordPress, HTML and CSS are pluses
  • Experience with CallRail, Slack, and Toggl are all valuable

BENEFITS

  • Competitive Market-based Salary
  • Work remotely with flexible hours
  • Two weeks of paid vacation
  • Flexible work hours
Apply for job

items.title: BriteCore, Intuitive Web Solutions: Product Designer
items.content:
Product Designer

Fully Remote Position

BriteCore is seeking to hire a Product Designer to help us take complex workflows and distill them into a thoughtful experience for people using our app. BriteCore is a cloud-based platform used by insurance companies to manage all aspects of their business. We are in the process of rewriting key pieces of our app as standalone products, unified by a centralized user interface and design system. Each of these products tackles a different set of problems and workflows for our users. As a result, our team focuses on delivering a great user experience across our platform.

We are looking for a Product Designer who can work within a product team as part of our iterative design process. Our design team also has a dedicated design researcher you would be working with to help inform and validate design decisions. Although this position emphasizes UX design skills, you will also be expected to leverage our design system to create high fidelity mockups, and understand how to apply user experience research and principles to the final experience for people using our app.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work closely with product owners and developers in an iterative design process
  • Build design understanding within a product team through design sessions, collaborative research
  • Inform and validate design decisions with qualitative and quantitative data
  • Leverage industry best practices in design work
  • Understand and dissect complex workflow and product interactions
  • Communicate clearly and effectively with internal teams and external clients
  • Create effective and beautiful interfaces that solve our user's problems 
Required Skills

  • Several years of experience in the design field is preferred
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to back up design decisions with data
  • Welcome feedback and collaboration
  • Be friendly, confident, and patient with others
  • Self-direct
  • Experience with applications similar to BriteCore (B2B) is preferred
Benefits

  • Retirement plan with 3% company match
  • Comprehensive health insurance coverage including medical, dental, and vision
  • Short and long term disability
  • Flexible schedule with unlimited vacation time
  • Fully remote work in a remote-first company
  • Relaxed work environment
About BriteCore

BriteCore is a fully managed administration platform for property casualty insurance providers. We focus on building gorgeous, scalable, and usable cloud-based solutions. Our team of top performers enjoys working together and takes tremendous pride and ownership in our platform. The environment is progressive, innovative, and energetic. We love great technology and it shows in every aspect of our product. Our team enjoys a very flexible, balanced, and stimulating environment. Bring creativity, focus, and productivity to your job, and enjoy 40 hour work weeks, flexible paid time off, and remote work.

items.title: 1 Second Everyday: Social Media Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Social Media Manager

About us 

1 Second Everyday is a video diary app that makes it easy to create the movie of your life. In a couple of minutes, parents can relive the first year of their child's life, look back at their last family vacation, or see their entire journey together. It gives anyone the power to reflect on school, friends, projects, and adventures. From our humble Kickstarter beginnings, we've grown into an award-winning app with millions of downloads. We’re consistently one of the Top 10 Paid Apps on the App Store, hitting #1 several times in 2018.

About the Social Media Manager Position

We're looking for an awesome Social Media Manager to join our small but growing team! This position is full time and fully remote. Our team works from all over the world including Russia, Canada, Mexico, and the US.

We are looking for someone to manage our accounts, post consistently, and bring some fresh ideas to our social content. The Social Media Manager is responsible for generating unique and engaging content (text and video) to share with followers, as well as managing posts and responding to the queries or comments across all of our platforms.

The Social Media Manager is expected to remain current on the latest social, online, and digital trends. You'll work directly with our Brand Manager to execute marketing campaigns and ensure that everything we post aligns with our Brand's core values and tone of voice.

The details:

  • This is a full-time, remote position. 
  • We’re offering between $55,000-$85,000 USD per year for this role based on experience and cost of living.
  • No share options or equity.
  • This position requires travel to our semi-annual retreats (Last one was Peru and allowed families to come too!).

About You

You might describe yourself as a multitasker, a doer, someone who isn't afraid to jump in and get things moving. You're inspired by those around you and use that inspiration to fuel your work. Your communication skills are excellent, you have no problem conveying your ideas, and you're a pro at adapting your writing to fit any brand's tone of voice.

Social Media Manager responsibilities are:


  • Align social media strategy with overall business goals and brand values.
  • Set specific objectives and report on engagement, growth, and traffic across all channels.
  • Conceptualize, create, edit, and share engaging content daily, through a variety of mediums (text, video, blog, etc.)
  • Manage our hashtags, track, and inform different campaign ideas based on user-submitted content trends.
  • Engage, engage, engage. Your job is to keep the conversation going!
  • Suggest and implement new ideas like promotions or giveaways and campaigns to develop newfound brand awareness.
  • Assist the Brand Manager on noting and tracking influencers who are engaging with the brand.
  • Ensure brand consistency through collaboration with other departments.
  • Monitor customer reviews, DM's, and comments responding in a timely and polite manner.
  • Oversee digital design of social media platforms, i.e. Facebook Timeline cover, profile photos, etc.
  • Manage our monthly giveaways on Instagram and oversee the distribution of merch to winners.

Social Media Manager requirements are:

  • Proven work experience as a Social media manager.

  • Hands-on experience in content creation, tracking, and community management.

  • Remote experience

  • Excellent skills in the following areas:

  • Copywriting

  • Communication

  • Data Analysis

  • Multitasking

  • Community management

  • Ability to deliver creative content (text, image, and video) 

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Share and embody our company values
  • This position requires travel to our semi-annual retreats.

    • Benefits & perks:

    • Paid open vacation policy - We offer a MINIMUM of 2 weeks off each year. This isn't a vague policy where open vacation means no vacation.
    • Healthcare benefits (currently only available in the United States).
    • Travel Bonus - $500 per year for a NO WORK vacation on your anniversary.
    • Wellness Bonus - $50 a month for a gym membership, yoga class, book club, or whatever makes you happy.
    • 2 weeks paid parental leave.
    • Conferences of your choice.

    Why work at 1SE?

    • Travel the world for our semi-annual paid retreats (Last one was Peru and allowed families to come too!).
    • You'd join our 100% distributed team - we value autonomy and flexible lifestyles.
    • We're a diverse team across 6 countries, 5 languages, and 7 time-zones (First remote-baby for us!)
    • You would work on an award-winning and beloved product with a diverse community around the world! 
    • Help continue our story.

    We are an equal opportunities employer. We are a diverse team and welcome all walks of life. 1 Second Everyday is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

    We are continuously expanding our hiring capabilities in other geographies. However, at this time we are unable to hire employees and contractors in the specified countries below:

    • Argentina
    • Brazil
    • Crimea
    • China
    • Cuba
    • Egypt
    • France
    • Iraq
    • Iran
    • Italy
    • Japan
    • Nigeria
    • North Korea
    • Spain
    • Sudan
    • Sweden
    • Syria
    We encourage you to continue to check back with future postings as we continue to expand our operational abilities in these countries.

items.title: Animalz: Content Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Content Marketing Manager

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies—particularly B2B SaaS businesses—grow by making great content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (Executives, Managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the SaaS/tech field.

This is a writing-focused role that also requires direct contact with customers. In addition to high-quality writing, successful candidates should be able to demonstrate strong skills and/orinterest in managing customer accounts and content workflows. 

An ideal content manager at Animalz:

  • is deeply passionate about writing and approach all forms of content with a creatively curious mindset
  • writes clearly, concisely, and in an organized way
  • has a marketing sense of storytelling
  • understands the business side of writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves working directly with customers
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future.
Requirements:

For our current openings, we're particularly interested in subject matter experts in the following areas:

  • sales/CRM
  • accounting/bookkeeping
  • digital marketing
  • thought leadership in the fields of startups and SaaS
(Tip: When applying, mention your field of expertise, and choose the 3 articles that best demonstrate your expertise in that specific field.)

You should also have experience with at least some of the following, though we'll train the right subject matter expert in these as needed (which also means desire to learn and grow in these areas is paramount):

  • You are able to articulate a basic B2B content strategy
  • You can clearly explain why a piece of content needs to be written
  • You know how to do on-page SEO for any piece you write
  • You have a strong writing ability
  • You've worked directly with customers and understand the basics for handling that relationship
  • You have a good basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social marketing function (on a theoretical level, at least) and how they can work together to get results.
About Animalz

We’re a remote team with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world. We have an eclectic team of scientists, journalists, operations folks, and more.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the Position:

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote position. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is NOT a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional or academic endeavors.
Benefits
  • Work from anywhere you like, as long as you have regular overlap with Eastern Time business hours and can schedule overlap with Pacific Time business hours when needed for customer calls.
  • Health insurance, covering 80% of the premium for health and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and attending conferences
What's it like to work at Animalz? Join us on a live webinar to find out and ask any questions you may have about our company or the hiring process. Click here to register!

items.title: Growth and Marketing (Associate!)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
We are hiring employees number 4 and 5 to work on growth andanalytics! We’re an incredibly lean (heh :smirk:) Cambridge-based commercialteam who has just raised Seed, and we’re growing our user base 10-20% monthover month. You’ll be working with the Chief Commercial Officer and a seniorGrowth and Marketing team lead, both of us young, hungry startup professionalswith 2-3 companies under our belts. Come on board if you want to pull weight atone of the most interesting young technology companies to come out ofCambridge.

SpecificDuties and Responsibilities

GrowthSprints

DataSwiftis developing a growth and marketing engine targeting developers, startups, andother fast-growing businesses. You will contribute weekly to the businessdevelopment and marketing sprints, working with the Head of Growth andMarketing and CCO to develop a scalable engine of growth. If Eric Ries said it, we’re doing it.

ExternalComms

Yourtools will be the websites, social channels, and emails that we use every dayto have conversations with our users, and in our weekly growth sprints you willuse them to learn more about all our awesome customers. You will need to write,joke, chat, listen, and empathise with them, and will hold the face of ourcompany in your purview.

Reportingand Insights

TheWeekly Growth Sprints are our primary tool for generating all of the HAT’s newbusiness, and the Head of Growth and Marketing that you’ll be working with isresponsible for reporting on how well that work is going to the wholecommercial team, our developers and engineers, and of course the CEO andexecutive. You’re going to help - we’ll all work together like a little hitsquad to make sure we learn as much as we possibly can about our customers.

Skills,Qualifications and Experiences:

Communications– you are joining an elite (*buffs nails*) team of early business-sidestartuppers, working on the hardest job in startups: early-stage growth. Good,no, great communication is essential. If you’ve never worked in startups beforethat’s ok too - we’ll teach you everything you need to know. Which reminds me…

Learning- very, very few people have elite-level experience in high-growth startups. Ifyou do (awesome, come work with us!!) you know that learning is a huge part ofthe job. If you don’t this is going to be a place where you can pick uphundreds if not thousands of new skills, and really stretch your abilities.Sound fun?

Timemanagement – we have too much to do, and you will too. If you can work wellunder pressure and manage your time and tasks efficiently, you’re going to loveit here.

Marketing– ultimately, our job is to know and love our customers. The more we get them,the easier they’ll be to find, onboard, and make happy, which is the whole jobof a new startup like ours. That’s how we think marketing really works at thisstage of growth. Sure, we may use websites and social and advertising to dothat work, but it’s a communications job at heart.

Problem-solving– no one has ever (!!) sold our product before, and no one we’re selling to hasever bought it before. This job is all about problem solving. If you’re good atpuzzles, or can’t rest when you have a juicy conundrum in front of you, thisjob will give you a lot of satisfaction.

What’sin it for you:

Thisis an entry-level role paying £20,000-30,000 a year, and you’ll earn equity aswell. You’ll work in a fast-paced environment with a lot of flexibility, andyou can more or less work as remotely as you like. You’ll get some expensescovered, you’ll have lot’s of opportunities for advancement, and you’ll bejoining us right after we’ve raised Seed (and before Series A), which is almostthe perfect time to join a young Startup. You’ll have a lot of responsibilitiesand you’ll learn a ton.

The pitch from us:

This is a chance to work on the most important problems in tech: data problems. You can fix Cambridge Analytica and help pioneer the future of the digital economy. 

You'll work with a young, driven growth team with a range of skills. You can also help shape that team, as we're still small and are building our internal culture. 

We have good flexibility. We can foster remote working and we have family-friendly setups and understanding for our teams. We're very international as well, with team members from Canada, the UK, Malaysia, Greece, and Germany. 

Things are going to move quickly here, and your personal development is one of our big focuses, and so is the development of our team as we onboard our new customers. You're joining the company right at Seed stage - so stable enough to be responsible, but young enough for there still to be lots of responsibility to go around. 

We cultivate a culture of open-mindedness and flexibility with discipline and hard work. On top of a competitive salary, you get financial perks like equity, and the responsibilities of leadership. We're building a representative team and you'll work under one of the highest-paid female academics and CEOs in the UK. Hope you can join us.

items.content:
Senior Product Manager – Mobile (f/m/d) // Comvel

Company: Comvel

Tags:

Berlin, Germany
Full-time

Company Description

lm group is a publicly traded multinational Group, among the worldwide leaders in the online travel industry, and we operate a portfolio of well-known brands such as lastminute.com, Bravofly, Rumbo, Volagratis, Crocierissime, Jetcost and Hotelscan.

Every month, the Group reaches across all its websites and mobile apps (in 17 languages and 40 countries) 43 million unique users that search for and book their travel and leisure experiences. More than 1,200 people enjoy working with us and contribute to providing our audience with a comprehensive and inspiring offering of travel-related products and services.

Job Description

In the lm group Berlin office, we are creating a unique travel experience, re-defining the way people organize their travels. You will lead the lm group mobile roadmap and your responsibility is to make sure it is implemented according to the traveler’s needs.
This includes re-shaping the user journey on our mobile apps for iOS and Android, for all brands.
Keep in mind that we are not product driven, we are traveler driven. Which makes you the travelers ambassador, ensuring our product fulfills their unspoken desires.
In other words, we are not looking for a babysitter for developers (they are more than able to take care of themselves). We do look for an amazing and passionate product lover, who can bring people together to deliver the best experience for travelers.

Qualifications

Our definition of Senior Product Manager includes the mastery of these 5 areas of expertise:

  • Customer: You know the importance of user research and customer intelligence, you know how to conduct interviews and get insights out of them.
  • Design: You have an eye for beautiful design and are experienced in mobile user interaction on iOS and Android.
  • Data: You know how to read analytics, to pursue the right metrics and to stay away from meaningless data.
  • Lean development: You are experienced enough to tell the difference between lean development and a bad attempt.
  • Tech: you know how software development works, you are familiar with the strengths and limitations of mobile apps and how to use technology to create great products.

You are a maker. You have shipped successful products and are capable to autonomously convert a Product vision into an amazing solution.
You are organized. You better be, because you will have to organize different work streams within different teams.
You are a learner. We don’t expect you to be the master of anything, but we do expect you to be able to catch up quick enough to the topics that matter the most.
You are humble. We all believe in our Product because we test it every day with our travelers. You are able to listen to the travelers and convert their needs into a product prioritization.
You are a chameleon. Different people expect different inputs from you. Make sure you know how to adapt to different environments and conditions.
You are nice. You will be surrounded by very nice people, and we really don’t want to break this trend.

What We Offer

  • Working in an international agile environment
  • Continuous learning program with internal didactic units
  • Possibility to join conferences around Europe for continuous improvements
  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote working
  • Possibility to join the Erasmus program (temporary relocation among our offices)
  • Complimentary fruit, beverages, coffee and a dedicated lounge area
  • Preferential prices reserving through our platform
  • Discounts from external partners
  • Join a team of passionate and fun people keen on developing new ideas and learning from each other
  • Choose the tools and work methods you are most comfortable & effective with
  • Almost no hierarchies and quick decision-making process
  • The usual suspects: an attractive compensation package and amazing office in Berlin-Kreuzberg
  • Work and live in Europe’s most creative city
  • and many more!

Additional Information

At the lm group you will experience professionalism in a relaxed and informal atmosphere. Every day, you have the opportunity to engage with your ideas and contribute to the success of a fast-growing online business. Come along! We are looking forward to your application!

Apply for this position

items.title: SellerFlows: Chief Operating Officer For Digital Marketing Agency
items.content:
Chief Operating Officer For Digital Marketing Agency

About Us:
We're a fast growing digital marketing agency that helps a handful of Shopify stores with Carthook & Klaviyo.  Our mission is to add value to our clients by increasing key performance indicators ‘KPIs’ such as Average Order Value ‘AOV’ & Life Time Value ‘LTV’.  Our team is spread all over the world and works entirely remote. 


About You:
We're looking for an experienced operations manager who can manage various project managers that will work directly underneath them.  Experience with email marketing or digital marketing is a plus, but not required. The most important thing is being able to manage a fast growing team, ensuring that work gets fulfilled on time and that work is adding clear value to our clients.  

Other Requirements:

  • Excellent phone, email, and Slack correspondence skills

  • Experience managing remote teams

  • Demonstrates effective leadership skills.

  • Knows how to give feedback to direct employees that drives changes in future behavior.

  • Self-starter mentality, and ability to successfully work independently

  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

  • Has a track record of hitting clear performance goals & KPIs

  • Comfortable with Google Apps (Gmail, Drive, Calendar etc.)

  • Experience with Slack

  • Understands are Project Management tool ClickUp (like Asana or Trello)

  • Ability to hop on weekly calls at 8 AM EST on Tuesdays

If you're "IN", send us your cover letter and put ops master at the top of your cover letter so we know you have some attention to detail (which is key to working with us).

Thanks again for you time.

Best of luck!

*This position requires advanced knowledge in SEO or PPC.

At Directive, we make sure that every account we work with is treated with the highest level of attention and expertise. If you are looking for a competitive, challenging, fast-paced environment based on constant growth we're the agency for you!

Beyond results, you'll get to work with an enthusiastic team in an environment that values a work/life balance. Team building parties, competitions, and paid for conferences all add to our ethos of Teamwork and Unity.

You will manage no more than 8 client projects and will be responsible for communicating results and strategy to clients as their main point of contact in the agency. We believe that SEO, PPC, and Content all drive results, so you'll need to be able to communicate this in a way that excites your clients.

We recognize that great work takes time and do not want you to manage more than 8 accounts at any given time.

You will collaborate with your own dedicated team of an SEO and a PPC specialist to ensure that the deliverables are implemented and the accounts are achieving their objectives. When necessary, you can roll up the sleeves and deliver exceptional work.

You will communicate regularly with executives and must be able to clearly articulate strategic vision. You must be creative as well as data-driven, but ultimately you are responsible for managing client expectations and communicating success.

Requirements
  • 2+ years experience in SEO or PPC
  • Extremely organized + great at managing deadlines

items.content:
At Directive, we take great pride in knowing that every account we work with is treated with the highest levels of attention and expertise. We love contributing content to the industry and sending team members to top conferences to polish their skill-sets.

As a Google, Bing, MozLocal, and Unbounce partner, we like to think of ourselves as a launchpad for our clients and team member's careers. Building a proud alumni is just a slice of our core values.

If you are looking for the next step in your SEO career, please read on!

Here are some key things that you will be accomplishing:
  • You'll interface directly with senior in-house marketers
  • You'll drive traffic and increase ROI for our accounts via competitive analysis, keyword research, technical SEO, link building, and CRO
  • You'll do the creative side of SEO from outreach to content to link building
  • You'll measure success by reporting from a variety of resources including Data Studio, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Google Analytics, Ahrefs, Majestic, and Moz
  • You'll report your clients' online presence by tracking + reporting changes in traffic, rankings, trends, conversions, opportunities, deals, and revenue
  • You'll share your insights with our team and clients to keep all of us in the loop
  • You'll tie everything back to business objectives and focus on the initial reason the client hired us
The Skills:
  • 2+ years of hands-on SEO experience with mid-enterprise accounts
  • You're passionate about SEO, but you treat business and marketing from a holistic perspective
  • You're able to use SEO skills, such as keyword research, to understand your client's target market
  • You have technical SEO skills: comprehending crawl rate, architecture, content, etc.
  • When it comes to SEO trends, you know what's coming before it happens. Blogs are your thing, you might even contribute or want to
  • You know that SEO is not an isolated channel and you're willing to dive into other channels to provide insight
  • Deadlines? You never even get close to them because you are so ahead with your personal time management and communication
  • Solutions are your thing. Can't is not a word
  • The faster the work environment the better for you. You can't help but ask: "What's Next?
Bonus Points:
  • Run your own website or blog? Show it off
  • Experience at a top search agency (we love our agency friends who do it right)
  • Expertise in PPC and Analytics
  • Program a little? ...yes please
  • Desire to publish and speak for industry leaders

items.content:
Senior Administrative Analyst at GovernmentCIO

Remote
  • Job Locations: US-Remote
  • Job ID: 2019-2089
  • Category: Information Technology

Overview

Government CIO is seeking a Senior Administrative Analyst to support the Enterprise Program Management Office with the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA).

Responsibilities

The Senior Administrative Analyst, will:

  • PMO Senior Administrative Analyst must have experience in editing narrative and graphic products to identify and correct grammatical formatting and logic errors and to identify logical and technical inconsistencies that will require author attention.
  • Must have experience in the application of a variety of word processing, spreadsheet, graphics, and scheduling tools.
  • Must have experience and be proficient with a wide variety of graphic and office automation tools and produce documents without errors.
  • Must have experience and knowledge in proofreading and editing documents that are highly technical in nature which was created by others to ensure proper format, grammar, and style.
  • Must have experience in meeting with authors and other team representatives to review documents, compile inputs/corrections, resolve incompatible comments, and provide final publishable documentation.
  • In addition, the candidate must be able to facilitate internal and external customer facing meetings and provide meeting minutes within established parameters.
  • Must be a highly effective communicator and have the ability to communicate with a cross functional and geographically dispersed team.
  • Must be able to answer data calls and perform other ad-hoc PMO tasking as required.
  • Must be familiar with the SDLC IT process.

Qualifications

  • Education Requirements: Bachelors Business Discipline
  • Years of Experience Required: 5+ (8 years additional relevant experience may be substituted for education requirement)
  • Tools & Software Experience: Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and SharePoint.

items.content:
Content Writer – Social Media Manager at Content Allies

Remote | International

The founder of Lead Cookie recently launched a new venture called Content Allies that is focused on creating daily Linkedin content for our clients.

We are seeking content writers & social media managers who will work directly with customers to create daily social content for our clients’ Linkedin feeds.

Imagine having the ability to work from anywhere.

Your home, a coffee shop, Europe, Mexico, Thailand…

At Lead Cookie, our number one value is freedom.

You will have to work each day and put in time and hours, but you will have a significant amount of freedom where and when you work.

What Content Allies is:

Content Allies is a service that offers daily Linkedin content for our customers profiles to help them nurture their audience, appear as thought leaders, and drive leads.

So what is the content writer / social media manager role?

This role is very simple.

  • You will work underneath our lead content strategist.
  • You will write and schedule regular Linkedin content posts for them.
  • You will have support for graphic design of graphics.
  • We have systems, templates and processes that you will follow.

The tasks you will do on a regular basis include:

  • Creating customer summaries and strategies
  • Creating ~20 pieces of social content per month for each customer
  • Eventually managing a client load of ~20 customers
  • Working under direction of a lead content writer
  • Consistently learning, growing, and improving your skills to become a master of social content and copywriting

NOTE: Our customers will all be in B2B. So these will be businesses typically selling to other businesses. This is not B2C marketing where we focused on consumers.

Growth Potential: While this initial role is for a content writer, there is opportunity to be promoted to a lead content strategist in the future.

The ideal candidate:

  • Detail oriented
  • Has existing copywriting skills
  • Experience in social media management is a huge plus
  • Fast learner and a lifelong learner

Values

Purpose: Freedom

  • The actions we take create more freedom, not less for team members, clients & owners.

Values:

  • Life > Work
  • Lifelong learning
  • Positive thinking
  • Mutually Beneficial Transactions
  • Details matter
Apply for job

items.title: Growth Product Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
About Us


We’re TrustedHousesitters, the online platform connecting a caring community of home and pet owners with sitters around the world. Joining for one annual fee, our members connect to exchange home and pet care for a place to stay. It’s a money-free exchange that sees owners enjoy worry-free travel while the sitters care pets and unlock a world of unique accommodation.


In the last few years, we’ve achieved a lot. Consistently achieving high year-on-year growth, we’ve doubled from 25 employees to a team of over 50. We’ve moved to our fifth shiny new office based in SPACES, a co-working space in the heart of Brighton. We’ve recently announced funding to help continuously improve our platform, won lots of awards, including Amazon’s Growing Business Award. We have built a strong team culture and are supportive of flexible working.


Despite our rapid growth, our ethos remains the same. We aspire to transform the pet care and travel landscape. We believe we offer the best solution and our team are united by our commitment to delivering an enriching experience for our members and having a positive impact on the lives of their pets. We never lose sight of what makes TrustedHousesitters, trusted. We care hugely about our reputation, we have more five-star reviews on TrustPilot than any other travel or pet company globally.


Calling all Pet & Travel Lovers


At TrustedHousesitters, you’ll be part of a pet-passionate, fast-growing team who are all committed to collaborating, constantly improving and having some fun while we’re at it. Sounds exciting right? We think so. If you want the opportunity to be part of that, to create something special, driving change within the pet care and travel landscapes, we’d love to hear from you.


Role 
We’re looking for a talented Growth PM to join our Product team. This is a great opportunity to help scale TrustedHousesitters.


What you’ll do at TrustedHousesitters



  • Determine metrics that define success of your products and help implement tracking systems/processes for these metrics

  • Run ideation sessions across product, growth, engineering and data to generate ideas on how to drive metrics

  • Run user research sessions to understand the WHY behind data and to identify growth opportunities

  • Create clear hypotheses for experiments; establish the baseline, expected impact and effort required to deliver them

  • Use your analytical abilities to prioritise experiments, potential features and drive those projects forward

  • Be creative and scrappy in the tests you choose to run

  • Analyse results of experiments, learn and adjust your experiments accordingly

  • Analyse all aspects of our conversion funnel and own a roadmap to hit your goals




REQUIREMENTS


What we’re looking for



  • Analytical skills - You know how to leverage data and use it intelligently & with significance to make good decisions when confronted by ambiguity.

  • Research skills - You know how to run usability testing sessions and user interviews.

  • Growth Mindset - You can't stop thinking about how to optimise existing flows and coming up with new growth features to test. You don't only think of ideas and test them, but rather set up processes to increase the iteration speed.

  • Ability to manage complexity - You know how to work out the nitty-gritty without losing sight of the big picture.

  • Sense of ownership - You are self-driven and appreciate taking on ownership of broad problem sets and drive them forward.

  • Scrappiness - You know how to build MVTs and achieve high cadence of your experiments to learn fast.

  • Strong communication skills - You know how to work successfully with various stakeholders. Proven ability to meet deadlines and comfortable with fast-paced development cycles.

  • At least 3 years of Growth PM experience.

  • Hands-on experience of running A/B tests to drive CRO.

  • Strong knowledge of analytics tools, including GA, Mixpanel / Amplitude or similar


What we’d like to have



  • Digital marketing experience with one or more channels (SEO, paid, social, email)

  • Startup experience




BENEFITS



  • Of course, we’ll offer you a competitive salary based on your experience, 25 days holiday as standard and a workplace pension scheme.

  • Once you’ve passed probation you’ll receive a dedicated travel allowance and time to go sitting, you’re positively encouraged to get away from your desk!

  • Stay happy and healthy with our physical health and dental cash plan!

  • Great people know great people. If you recommend someone for a vacancy, and they are successful in their application, you’ll receive £500 once they complete their 3-month probation.

  • Getting a new pet? We give you the opportunity to work from home when you welcome a new furry friend to the family and up to £200 towards the rehoming fees if you choose to rescue a dog or cat.

  • What better way to stay connected to your fellow team mates. We’ll see you in our break out area on Wednesday afternoons for our weekly Lounge session, where a fully stocked drinks fridge will be waiting for you…

  • Stay energised with healthy snacks provided throughout the week.

  • With core hours between 10:00-16:00, we want you to have more control over your schedule and working environment. We believe in keeping employees happy.

  • And last but not least, you'll get the chance to hang out with the four legged members of the TrustedHousesitters family (aka our office dogs).

items.title: Social Media Hero for exciting startup
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Take day to day ownership of our social media, both paid and organic whilst experiencing all aspects of startup growth and entrepreneurship! Here at CLiKD We are currently recruiting for an intern with attitude. We are an early stage startup we are enjoying some great traction; you may have seen us featured on/in BBC News, Evening Standard, MTV, GQ, London Live, The Telegraph, Daily Mail plus many more, and we are looking for someone to join the team at this very exciting time. Our app is called CLiKD, you can find more info at www.clikdapp.com – we have been nominated for 4 awards and won best innovation in the dating industry 2017 as well as holding the number 4 spot for the UK’s best dating blog!


What we are looking for: People with a passion for business. Your number one aim will be able to help us to get grow our social media and the business! You will be immersed in social media strategy both unpaid organic content and guerilla growth tactics, as well as running paid advertising campaigns; primarily across Facebook, Instagram and Google but also Snapchat, pinterest, reddit, quora and more.


 


You will be part of fun and competitive team which is seeking innovative ways to stand out from the pack; organising events, collaborate with businesses and promotions etc. You will be managed by our business development manager but also have scope to push your own businesses ideas. If your looking to get experience, well we are a startup which believes in giving you the opportunity to try things. You will be a confident communicator, with strong communication skills and go-get attitude. You’ll need to be passionate about meeting new people and happy to muck in and get involved in a range of commercial initiatives as well as creative projects, content production aas well as having experience of using social media.


Whilst you’ll be working with our Business Development Manager and the CEO, you’ll also have independence to work on many of small projects, hopefully allowing you to build your own portfolio of great work. This role is best aimed at those with some self taught knowledge looking to gain some further experience, or those wishing to put their academic studies to practical use or maybe you have an app idea yourself and would like to see how it’s done, as long as you are passionate about what ever you do then we want you!


You will be required to give us 2-3 days a week though we can be flexible to extent as to the time though this will generally be expected during 9-5:30. The company is growing quickly and we are keen to take people with us on our exciting journey and we are currently fundraising so we hope that post fundraising we will look to hire interns who prove themselves to be asset to the company. Unfortunatly though we can only offer renumeration in expenses (normally £15 a day) and company equity.


 


DUTIES: As well as your focus on growing our paid social media and runing out advertising campaigns you’ll be working in the heart of a startup with plenty of room to learn and try your hand in a variety of roles including, but not limited to: 
– Marketing; traditional, digital and guerrilla/growth hacking! 
– Press, PR and Media Relations 
– Fund raising and investor relations 
– Creative content; images, video and text 
– Technical; web and app development 
– Operations; project management, event organisation and logistics


SKILLS: This opportunity is for someone with the right attitude, but we do need some basics experience with social media promotion and candidates with these basics:


Technically proficient in terms of using office equipment
Excellent communicator 
An enthusiasm for creating business and talking to people. 
Confidence, enthusiasm and the ability to challenge conventional thinking 
-Anything else you can bring the table is a plus! HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL, SEO, PPC, UAC, Web Design, Wordpress, Photoshop, Final Cut, etc. amazing, but by no means essential.


WHAT YOU’LL GET: The opportunity to work for an exciting new start up, learning about the fundamentals of marketing an app and growing a startup.

items.title: RoamX: Growth Marketing Fellowship
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Growth Marketing Fellowship

We'll PAY you to TRAVEL Southeast Asia while learning & gaining experience working with Silicon Valley tech startups.

We're looking for full-stack marketing interns for a 2 month program, where you will work with top-tier, venture funded companies in the Silicon Valley, get training from top-tier growth/marketing professionals and travel Thailand and Bali all expenses paid.

Details of the program:

- Program runs from October 15th to December 15th, in Thailand and Bali
- Your return flights from home & accommodations will be all covered
- You will be paid a $500 USD per diem each month to cover food/expenses
- You will work 30-40 hours a week full-time as a placed intern at a top tech company, remotely
- You will spend 5 hours a week getting training in growth marketing from some of the world's top Growth professionals

Some of the things you can expect to learn:

- Content Marketing
- SEO
- Performance Marketing
- Conversion Rate Optimization
- Comm. Marketing
- Referral & Viral Marketing
- AI in marketing

Qualifications we're looking for:

- Some demonstrated background in marketing, or a relevant educational background
- Understanding & experience with technology startups and software
- Interest in breaking into technology, and interest in travel/remote work

Other requirements:

- You must be at least 18 years old
- Fluency in written & spoken English
- You must not have any serious medical conditions that would make travel dangerous for you
-You must have valid travel authorization to visit the countries listed in the Digital Marketing RoamX program (Thailand and Indonesia) or have the ability to secure travel authorization to these places

items.title: Barrel Roll: Remote Google Ads Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Remote Google Ads Specialist

We’re seeking a Google Ads Specialist to join our team on a part-time basis. You will participate in strategy, planning, buying, and executing digital media campaigns on Google Ads and other advertising platforms. This is a part-time position with an estimated 20 hours per week to start. As it’s a remote position, you’ll be able to work from home or wherever you’d like!

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
You will be involved in the entire campaign cycle from start to finish, determining budgets, strategy, optimization, and even helping to create and modify the creatives used.

We’re looking for someone with a hands-on work ethic that will edit campaigns manually rather than trusting automated tools to do their work.

You’ll be working on accounts for our clients and our own campaigns. You’ll work directly with clients and as part of our team. We’re looking for people who are fluent in English, both verbally and in writing, and who can expertly communicate solutions to clients.

More About What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Actively participating in digital strategy and media planning meetings
  • Creation of paid search campaigns from ideation to execution
  • Creating detailed reports of campaign performance
  • Performing keyword research and writing ad copy
  • Detailed analysis of account performance, providing advanced recommendations for optimization
  • Work with other team members to implement a cohesive and integrated strategy
  • Analyzing online media buys
  • Compiling daily, weekly, monthly, and lifetime reports to quantify the results and communicate them to management.
  • Staying informed with Paid Search industry best practices, new trends and technologies and platform updates (e.g. Google Ads, Bing, Facebook, etc.)

REQUIREMENTS
  • Google Ads Certified (Certification must be current)
  • A minimum of 3 years experience buying online media for direct response
  • Must be an independent contractor – we’re not interested in outsourcing work to an agency
  • Experience with building and managing a media plan
  • Proven track record of success in previous job (e.g. helped a client achieve X business goal; retained a client for X amount of time)
  • Preferred example(s) of success: Helped a client grow their overall profit with paid search and has the numbers to back it up, helped a client reach a target CPA/ROAS and has the numbers to back it up. ROI examples of 500% or greater strongly preferred.
  • Experience in native channels, Facebook, and/or experience with programmatic display
  • Extensive split testing experience and serving as a primary stakeholder for conversion funnel improvements
  • Experience with copywriting and writing copy for conversions. Provide examples and some of your best-converting copy
  • Digital marketing background is preferred
  • Understands basic marketing concepts (e.g. sales funnel)
  • Familiar with jargon (e.g. PPC, CPC, CPA, ROAS, bounce rate, pages/session, etc.)
  • Reliable, takes initiative and finds ways to solve problems independently
  • Passionate about developing knowledge and personal growth in Media Buying
  • Know the basics of media buying from both the client and media buyer’s perspective
  • Analytical – able to take data and identify trends, improve performance, solve problems, etc
  • Quick at learning; attentive to detail
  • Background and/or experience with design a plus (i.e Photoshop)
  • Working Knowledge of WordPress, HTML and CSS are pluses
  • Experience with CallRail, Slack, and Toggl are all valuable

BENEFITS
  • Competitive Market-based Salary
  • Work remotely with flexible hours
  • Two weeks of paid vacation
  • Flexible work hours

items.title: Social Media Hero at Exciting Dating App Startup
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Take day to day ownership of our social media, both paid and organic whilst experiencing all aspects of startup growth and entrepreneurship! Here at CLiKD We are currently recruiting for an intern with attitude. We are an early stage startup we are enjoying some great traction; you may have seen us featured on/in BBC News, Evening Standard, MTV, GQ, London Live, The Telegraph, Daily Mail plus many more, and we are looking for someone to join the team at this very exciting time. Our app is called CLiKD, you can find more info at www.clikdapp.com – we have been nominated for 4 awards and won best innovation in the dating industry 2017 as well as holding the number 4 spot for the UK’s best dating blog!


What we are looking for: People with a passion for business. Your number one aim will be able to help us to get grow our social media and the business! You will be immersed in social media strategy both unpaid organic content and guerilla growth tactics, as well as running paid advertising campaigns; primarily across Facebook, Instagram and Google but also Snapchat, pinterest, reddit, quora and more.


 


You will be part of fun and competitive team which is seeking innovative ways to stand out from the pack; organising events, collaborate with businesses and promotions etc. You will be managed by our business development manager but also have scope to push your own businesses ideas. If your looking to get experience, well we are a startup which believes in giving you the opportunity to try things. You will be a confident communicator, with strong communication skills and go-get attitude. You’ll need to be passionate about meeting new people and happy to muck in and get involved in a range of commercial initiatives as well as creative projects, content production aas well as having experience of using social media.


Whilst you’ll be working with our Business Development Manager and the CEO, you’ll also have independence to work on many of small projects, hopefully allowing you to build your own portfolio of great work. This role is best aimed at those with some self taught knowledge looking to gain some further experience, or those wishing to put their academic studies to practical use or maybe you have an app idea yourself and would like to see how it’s done, as long as you are passionate about what ever you do then we want you!


You will be required to give us 2-3 days a week though we can be flexible to extent as to the time though this will generally be expected during 9-5:30. The company is growing quickly and we are keen to take people with us on our exciting journey and we are currently fundraising so we hope that post fundraising we will look to hire interns who prove themselves to be asset to the company. Unfortunatly though we can only offer renumeration in expenses (normally £15 a day) and company equity.


 


DUTIES: As well as your focus on growing our paid social media and runing out advertising campaigns you’ll be working in the heart of a startup with plenty of room to learn and try your hand in a variety of roles including, but not limited to: 
– Marketing; traditional, digital and guerrilla/growth hacking! 
– Press, PR and Media Relations 
– Fund raising and investor relations 
– Creative content; images, video and text 
– Technical; web and app development 
– Operations; project management, event organisation and logistics


SKILLS: This opportunity is for someone with the right attitude, but we do need some basics experience with social media promotion and candidates with these basics:


Technically proficient in terms of using office equipment
Excellent communicator 
An enthusiasm for creating business and talking to people. 
Confidence, enthusiasm and the ability to challenge conventional thinking 
-Anything else you can bring the table is a plus! HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL, SEO, PPC, UAC, Web Design, Wordpress, Photoshop, Final Cut, etc. amazing, but by no means essential.


WHAT YOU’LL GET: The opportunity to work for an exciting new start up, learning about the fundamentals of marketing an app and growing a startup. 
The chance to work on some crazy projects: https://www.clikdapp.com/love-at-first-flight 
The chance to work on some great community projects: https://www.clikdapp.com/loveinlondon 
The chance to show off your creative side and work with other creatives: https://www.clikdapp.com/blog https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBE7SuipvhPp4snKJPhhOKQ 
A repository of portfolio work 
The opportunity to work with a wide range of interesting entrepreneurs and awesome brands. 
Weekly seminars from experienced professionals on a range of business topics.
A comprehensive exit interview including CV review and Letter of Recommendation.

items.title: Freelance Search Marketing Strategy Consultant/Analyst (SEO & PPC)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Freelance Search Marketing Strategy Consultant/Analyst (SEO & PPC)

We're looking for a Search super star to craft growth driving strategies for our portfolio of Startup and Scaleup clients. Data-driven. Results focussed. Growth obsessed. You’ll work with an endlessly passionate team on a remote, project basis in a way which suits you. 

 

What you’ll do for us


  • Design innovative, high-performing Search strategies which build long-term Growth engines for our clients 

  • Research and define organic and paid Search keyword universes 

  • Define growth driving keyword strategies which help early stage businesses win at Search

  • Use Search to unearth trends and insights to inform strategic decisions for our clients 

  • Create uncannily accurate and granular PPC and SEO forecasts 

  • Undertake SEO audits and craft recommendations to improve performance across technical, content and link-building aspects of SEO 

  • Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve Search performance

  • Understand the intrinsic link between Search and UX, using Google Analytics and other platforms to analyse website usability and design and recommend strategies to improve performance

  • Demonstrate thought-leadership across all aspects of Search 


 

Key capabilities 


  • Excellent working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, including Word, Powerpoint, and Excel

  • An in-depth, strategic and hands-on knowledge of all things Search 

  • Detail and data obsessed

  • Outstanding analytical, organisational project management and time management skills

  • A top rate communicator who loves working both autonomously and as part of a team 

  • Passionate and positive with a ‘reach for the stars’ outlook on life and a love for Startups 


 

About Us

We’re an East London based Digital Growth Agency who explode growth for ambitious Challenger Brands, Startups & Scaleups through applied Growth Science. Our hybrid Growth Agency model combines user-centric thinking, Digital Marketing Strategy, applied Data Science and Growth Hacking methodologies to give businesses the Marketing Intelligence to know what to do and the flexible resource to do it, fast. 

 

We’re less than a year old but have already worked with some excellent clients such as Vice’s Beer Brand, Old Blue Last Beer, Cyber Security Accelerator Cylon and global beauty giant, Puig and a cohorts of pre-launch startups in fashion, travel and luxury. 

 

How to Apply 

To apply, please attached a copy of your CV and cover letter accompanied by proven examples of how you have driven Search performance for brands along with your location, availability and expected day rate range.

items.title: Senior Product Manager - Madrid
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Senior Product Manager - Madrid

Company: Taxfix - Madrid
Location: Madrid, ES
Salary: 40.000 - 60.000 €
Level: Senior
Language: English
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Product Management
  • Testing
  • UX Design

    • Intro

    As one of the most successful FinTech companies in Europe, Taxfix is an exciting place to work. We’re revolutionizing filing taxes – and saving people money, time and stress by putting a personalized digital tax consultant in the palm of their hands.

    In just 2 years, Taxfix has raised €42 million from some of the best investors in the world.  We achieved this by putting our customers at the core of what we do and helping them save millions of euros every week.

    Our Mission

    Our mission is to help people get their maximum tax refunds in a convenient, transparent and timely manner, hassle-free. Our user-friendly Taxfix App enables people to file within 25 minutes, without any prior tax knowledge or complicated forms.

    Our talented team creates products that help people improve and simplify their lives. Our diverse group of over 80 people come from over 20 nations, with a shared a passion for product development and creating an outstanding user experience. Join a team of smart, ambitious, driven people who value open communication and processes.

    We are looking for a Product Manager to join our multidisciplinary team of product managers, tax experts, designers, and data analysts to create products that people love to use.

    You will

    • Drive product discovery and development with a cross-functional team to provide the best possible experience for our users and to build a scalable infrastructure
    • Own the backlog, road map and vision of our tax filing experience and its underlying technology, including our Back-end infrastructure, API to tax authorities, payment integration, risk assessment and internal tools
    • Make sure we follow an informed decision making process by listing to users and looking into data
    • Manage and communicate with internal stakeholders and external partners around the tax filing experience and infrastructure

    Main requirements

    • User experience thinking and a good understanding of the business needs
    • 4+ years of experience as a product manager working on a tech product
    • Experience of leading a cross-functional team using agile processes.The ability to switch between thinking analytically and creatively
    • Fluent in English
    • An emphatic person that deeply cares for user's needs and problems and likes to collaborate closely with designers, engineers, business people, and other internal stakeholders
    • Able to make informed decisions based on qualitative user insights and quantitative user data by conducting user research, A/B tests, and analyzing data
    • Well organised and know how to separate noise from the important things even in busy times
    • Not afraid of making decisions, take the consequences
    • Comfortable saying no

    Nice to have

    • Experience having worked on a mobile and/or Fin Tech product
    • Experience with payment APIs and Back-end technologies

    Perks

    • Get to make an impact on thousands of people’s lives every day
    • Be paid a competitive salary with stock options
    • Benefit from remote work opportunities and flexible working hours
    • Be supported to grow and take leadership from day one
    • Work with the best and learn from other competent and brilliant people
    • Have the option to bring your best buddy to work. We love dogs!
    • Get relocation and visa support
