items.title: Research Fellow
items.content:
Research Fellow at Catalyst Inc.

Remote | Part-time

Department: Research
Reports to: Senior Director, Research
Location: Virtual

Summary of Responsibilities
Part-time Research Fellows support and/or manage research-driven knowledge products and activities to support Catalyst’s mission. We are seeking Research Fellows with different areas of content expertise, including workplace inclusion at the team and individual level; assessment of organizational programs and practices; gender equity; men and masculinity; the future of work; or intersectionality. Research Fellows will contribute to specific research team activities based on project needs and individual strengths. Here are several examples: conducting in-depth literature reviews; managing, coding, tracking, and analyzing quantitative data; conducing qualitative data analysis (thematic analyses); writing summaries of research findings; or participating in the development of research projects. This is a part-time, temporary position.

Essential Functions:

  • Conducts in-depth literature reviews: annotates and summarizes articles; organizes literature or Practices thematically, drawing out important trends; and presents findings to the Research team and/or others at Catalyst.
  • Participates in discussions regarding the development and implementation of research strategies in key areas.
  • Conducts quantitative or qualitative analyses (depending on project).
  • Manages and cleans databases and tracking systems.
  • May participate in developing, testing, and administering of surveys and/or other instruments.
  • Drafts sections of reports, working papers, or summary outlines as well as presentation materials for internal and external audiences.
  • Assists Research team with project work, as available and applicable.

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Knows how to conduct applied social science research; has considerable experience with conducting literature reviews and academic writing; has used data analysis tools including SPSS (if quantitative) or NVivo (if qualitative).
  • Organizes information effectively; can manage multiple projects, solve problems, and meet firm deadlines.
  • Applies creative problem-solving and analytical skills to research projects.
  • Has the ability to generate new ideas and creative solutions.
  • Has the ability and flexibility to work effectively with colleagues across various departments and job levels.
  • Demonstrates excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Functions effectively in a team-based virtual working environment as well as independently.
  • Has knowledge in a topic area or areas related to Catalyst’s work.

Working Conditions:

  • Virtual teamwork and collaboration
  • Work with confidential issues and data
  • Meet tight deadlines and manage multiple priorities
  • Heavy computer use, including teleconferencing and videoconferencing

Education and/or Experience/Requirements

  • This position is temporary and does not cover tuition. This position requires a M.A. or M.S. (or equivalent), preferably in social science, counseling, career development, social work, psychology, business, or public administration/public policy. Doctoral students and post-doctoral candidates are encouraged to apply. Content expertise in the future of work or gender studies is strongly preferred.

How to Apply
Please email your resume, cover letter, and salary requirements to jobs@catalyst.org with “Research Fellow” in the subject line. Only applications with cover letters will be considered. Due to the large number of applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Apply for job

items.title: High End Ecommerce Marketing Writer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
High End Ecommerce Marketing Writer

Company: Voy Media
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Contract
Description

Do you have a passion for online eCommerce marketing that goes above and beyond? Do you enjoy working with cutting edge online tools and providing in-depth insight into different marketing techniques?

This isn’t just another bland online marketing website talking about the same old topics which have been done to death. This site will be in the trenches testing cutting edge software, reviewing popular strategies and theories and helping people become the masters of online marketing.

The site is overseen by a highly skilled and experienced team of online marketers who truly understand the ins and outs of online marketing. Make no mistake, this is no pet project - we are a fully-fledged, well-established business with a loyal fan base. This means we’re looking for someone to join us for the long run who our readers will feel right at home with. We expect to be pumping out high-quality fresh content for many years into the future and this role will allow you to be part of a long-term, stable project - as a talented writer, we expect you to grow and flourish with us too!

For this, we need an exceptional writer who truly understands the ins and outs of the online marketing world. If you’re a generalist who simply dabbles in online marketing alongside other subjects, I’m afraid this is not the project for you - honestly, don't waste your time, we'll know straight away.

Still here? Read on to find out exactly what we’re looking for from you!  

So what exactly do we expect from you?

As a writer, it will be your job to research and investigate software, provide in-depth analysis and come up with conclusive decision-making commentary. On occasion, we will also expect you to produce high-quality visual content such as screencasts, videos and screenshots to further illustrate your work, all of which will be discussed in detail with the wider team.

We expect you to have an active input on the website and share your ideas with the team on how we can improve certain processes. This is your chance to leave your unique stamp on the site.

Outcomes:

  • Full-fledged and ever-growing content will be produced from the ground up
  • Editorial quality standards are consistently exceeded
  • Accompanying videos are recorded and published where appropriate
  • Writing systems and processes are continually improved
  • Minimal spelling and grammar (AP style based) corrections are required
  • Software is fully tested and conclusive opinions are made based on personal experience

Competencies:

  • A strong understanding of how to create exceptional content
  • Experience using and/or testing day-to-day marketing software
  • An understanding of marketing concepts and familiarity with testing marketing tools
  • Attention to detail
  • Exceptional English language ability with impeccable written English
  • Willingness to go beyond a simple writer role and share thoughts and opinions on the website as a whole
  • Strong research skills
  • A thorough understanding of the world of online marketing
  • A sense of ownership and responsibility
  • Ability to work across virtual teams
  • The ability to continually improve quality and systems

Benefits:

  • Work with an extremely high performing team
  • Access to our training, resources and network
  • Competitive salary
  • A chance to analyse and work with a wide range of  cutting edge software for free, provided by us
  • Be part of a highly regarded marketing team

This is a long-term role and you will be paid promptly per approved word. 

Please send over writing samples and cost per word.

 

Application Instructions
Please send writing samples in the eCommerce space and cost per word.

items.title: Chief Technology Officer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=10, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Chief Technology Officer at Democracy Works

Remote | High-paying

Location: Brooklyn, NY or remote within the US

Salary Range: $150,000 – $210,000 per year (Offers will vary based on experience and location-based cost-of-living calculations. Brooklyn-specific salary range is $180 – $210k.)
Benefits: Vision, dental, & medical insurance; 403(b) retirement savings plan; generous vacation policy; parental leave; long-term disability; employee assistance program
Level: Executive

Organizational overview
At Democracy Works, we believe voting should fit the way we live. To that end, we build technology for both voters and election administrators that simplifies the process and ensures that no voter should ever have to miss an election.

TurboVote helps voters register, stay registered, and cast a ballot in every election, from municipal to national. TurboVote served more than 5 million voters in 2018 by building the largest college, nonprofit, and corporate voter engagement coalition in the country, including more than 300 campuses, companies like Starbucks, Univision, Facebook, Google, Snapchat, and dozens more.

We also manage the The Voting Information Project, which coordinates with state election offices to publish nationally-standardized information about where and how to votedata that powers everything from Googles polling place search to our own text message and email reminders to TurboVote users, and received over 120 million impressions in 2016. Ballot Scout helps election administrators track absentee ballots through the mail, providing transparency in the vote-by-mail process and making it easier to follow up when things go awry. And in 2018, we became the organizational home of the National Association of State Election Directors (NASED).

Software Development at Democracy Works
These products are the work of our 14-developer team. Most of our development involves writing microservices in Clojure running in Docker containers on Kubernetes and hosted on AWS. These services communicate over RabbitMQ and store their data in Datomic. Our users primarily interact with web apps written in ClojureScript and re-frame. We also have projects that use JavaScript, Node, React, Python, and PostgreSQL.

We pair program, collaborate with product managers, and make sure our efforts deliver value to voters. We define specialized roles and projects on each team so that everyone gets a variety of experience and working relationships and can bring their unique strengths to as wide a swath of our work as possible.

Where you fit in
As CTO, you’ll be helping Democracy Works consolidate our recent growth and prepare for even larger-scale work in 2020 and beyond. In 2018, TurboVote scaled from 1 million to 6 million voters served, and did so with the help of some new tools, from Kubernetes to Twilio Studio. In 2019, were considering how our datasets and products can best improve the voting experience in the years to come, and what infrastructure we still need to build to get there. Our technical work will include removing additional bottlenecks to scale, resolving code debts incurred in the election season, and standardizing how our various projects are deployed, documented, and supported. Were grappling with questions of balancing scale and cost, building core infrastructure while also shipping new features, when and where to introduce specialization within our technical teams, and how to unify our many tools to best support our mission.

You will:

  • Join communities of voter engagement experts and election administrators, and work with our leadership team to define how our data and tools can best support better democratic participation
  • Collaborate with our VP Engineering and employee engagement team to ensure that our recruitment, professional development, and people-management all support a diverse and effective developer team
  • Develop and implement policies and best practices to maximize the security of our data and applications
  • Review and approve architectural decisions with an eye toward standardizing practices across programs and products
  • Communicate directly with senior leadership, individual developers, and product leads to understand and support their needs and goals

You are:

  • A skilled communicator who takes pride in distilling complex concepts into simple components
  • A strategic planner capable of translating an ambitious mission into architecture, process, and code
  • Creative, in the way that sees constraints and trade-offs as puzzles to solve rather than obstacles to success
  • Curious, excited to learn about the areas of our work that youre not already familiar with
  • Empathetic, a decision-maker who considers how our choices can affect voters, developers, and stakeholders
  • Someone who enjoys wearing multiple hats and bringing different disciplines together in pursuit of a goal

You have experience:

  • Building, deploying, and scaling complex products
  • Managing others we expect that this role will have only two direct reports, but will be involved in personnel decisions affecting many others
  • Learning and using a wide range of technologies and tools
  • Both in a developer role and (ideally) in other positions, whether product, design, or leadership
  • Working closely with non-engineering colleagues

Physical demands

This position requires regular, daily use of a computer.

Democracy Works is committed to diversity and inclusion in everything we do and aspires to have a team that’s representative of the voters we serve. When hiring, we practice proactive outreach to top talent thats underrepresented in our sector (including Latino, Black, AAPI, and Indigenous candidates). We conduct an anonymized skills evaluation, to reduce implicit bias and resume-dependency in our process. We’re a woman- and gay-founded nonprofit, and promote an inclusive culture that stands against racism, sexism, homophobia, and ableism (to name a few). To be explicit, we strongly encourage applicants of all races, ethnicities, political party associations, religions (or lack thereof), national origins, sexual orientations, genders, sexes, ages, abilities, and branches of military service.

Apply for job

items.content:
We are ZERO CARBON NATION, an initiative that helps people become carbon neutral, tackling the 21st century's crisis: global warming.


ZCN is an early stage startup based in London, founded on 30 years experience in ecology engineering and cleanTech. This is a brilliant opportunity for someone who wants to contribute to an ecology program from it's inception and bring it to a resounding success.


This is initially an internship/volunteer position with an option to become full time/permanent role in the near future. As our company has a "promote from within" very strict policy, you have the opportunity to grow with us, to be part of our success.


 


Based on your experience, qualifications and interests you could contribute in any of the social media marketing aspects, you would have flexible tasks, allowing you to chose your level of involvement.


You will be able to work remotely on flexible hours, result oriented responsibilities, with minimum agreed core hours.


 


This job is for you if:


- you're interested in ecology, and have a basic understanding of climate change, carbon emissions and other energy and environmental related aspects;


- you use main social media platforms on daily basis;


- you have good communication skills;


- you believe in our goals;


- you are positive, curious and opened to suggestions;


 


This job is definitely for you if:


- you truly understand the value of what we are trying to do, you are ready to embrace our goals and appreciate the opportunity of having a significant and personal impact in saving the planet;


- you are already active in ecology groups, meetups and other ecology related activities;


- have a deep understanding/experience of social media campaigns;


- have experience or aptitudes as a researcher and content writer;

items.title: Remote Engineer - Expert
items.content:
Remote Engineer - Expert in San Diego, CA at Volt





# Date Posted: _7/31/2019_

# Job Snapshot

+ **Employee Type:** Contingent





+ **Location:** San Diego, CA





+ **Job Type:** Engineering Disciplines





+ **Duration:** 36 weeks





+ **Date Posted:** 7/31/2019





+ **Job ID:** 189856





+ **Pay Rate** $0.0 - $43.1/Hour





+ **Contact Name** Volt Branch





+ **Phone** 707/890-3172

# Job Description

Volt is hiring for a Technical Support Specialist -Cell Analysis Equipment











The Cell Analysis Technical Support function is responsible for first line phone and e-mail support to cell analysis customers. This function is critical in supporting the use and application of Cell Analysis instruments, assay kits, consumables, software and workflows. As our client continues to grow and expand the cell analysis business, a full-time temporary position role is required to assist in the integration of technical support knowledge base material from newly acquired product lines. The technical support knowledge base is the repository for support case information including accepted and approved solutions for use by technical support staff.











The responsibility of the incumbent is as follows:











+ Work with product line subject matter experts to curate, review and migrate knowledge base material into a central platform.





+ Re-write or revise knowledge base entries in conjunction with subject matter experts to drive consistency in content structure and detail.





+ Migrate knowledge base content from one database platform to a newly created central platform





+ Provide on-going updates on the status and progression of the migration process

# Requirements



**The ideal candidate must have the following:**












+ An undergraduate degree in a life science discipline such as general biology, biochemistry, molecular or cellular biology





+ Ability to grasp and understand cell biology concepts and language





+ Self-motivated with great detail-oriented, and superb organization skills





+ Strong communication skills both written and verbal





+ The ability to follow instruction and work well in a collaborative environment across multiple teams





+ Comfort with working independently





+ Ability to work in complex databases and manipulate data as needed





+ Experience with Microsoft software platforms -- specifically Excel, Outlook













**Preferred qualifications**












+ Hands on laboratory experience with _in vitro_ cell culture





+ Hands on experience with working with cell analysis equipment such as flow cytometers, plate readers or assays.





+ Experience working with Salesforce software and data sets





+ Experience working with Microsoft SharePoint and other cloud based collaborative software













**Volt is an Equal Opportunity Employer**












In order to promote this harmony in the workplace and to obey the laws related to employment, Volt maintains a strong commitment to equal employment opportunity without unlawful regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital or parental status, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status or any other category protected by applicable law.

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) MM/PP - Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP

We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP MM/PP specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong MM/PP experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to.

What You Will Be Doing

- The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Materials Management and Production Planning (MM/PP) modules
- SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the MM and PP modules in the SAP functional area
- Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution
- Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support,
- Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices,
- Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas,
- Supports multiple projects and BAU activities,
- Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration
- Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles

What You Need for this Position

- 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment,
- Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success,
- Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite,
- Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls,
- Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation,
- Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles
- Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape,
- Experience in designing SAP software components,
- Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools,
- Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies,
- Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment,
- College or University (IT /Business) Degree,
- Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of MM/PP
- Expert SAP technical knowledge,
- Expert Integration understanding,
- Strong spoken and written English,
- Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP MM/PP specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

items.content:
Growth Hacker Engineer - Remote

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer, Frontend Developer
Industry: Information Technology, Recruiting, Technology Staffing
Company size: 501–1k people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Toptal | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Warsaw +/- 4 hours

Technologies

frontend
backend
seo
sem

Job description

About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $100+ million in annual revenue and triple-digit growth, Toptal is the largest fully distributed workforce in the world.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun (see this video from The Huffington Post). We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

The Growth Hacking team has the goal of delivering results as quickly and accurately as possible to address the needs of the Growth Team at Toptal. We work on diverse projects related to Traffic, SEO, SEM, front-end development, back-end development, site performance, and anything else that needs immediate attention. We run an extremely agile planning process that is directly tied to the business needs of Toptal. We are looking for developers that enjoy a diversity of projects, rapid development and release, and being more connected to the business needs of the company.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere, with a preferred location in Europe. All communication and resumes must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities:

You will join the Growth Hacking team that consists of front-end and back-end engineers to work on different projects and technologies. You will craft pages on our website to meet the marketing goals quickly, refactor back-end and front-end code to optimize website performance, and be involved in a wide variety of short-term projects covering things like SEO, SEM, conversion optimization, content marketing, website information architecture, etc. You will collaborate with the teams on both edges of the spectrum, the CMS team that is responsible for the website engine and the Public Pages team that builds pages. To thrive and flourish in the Growth Hacking team, you will need an open but critical mind of an experimenter and a get-things-done attitude.

In the first week you will:

  • Go through the Developer Bootcamp to understand and integrate with our systems.

In the first month you will:

  • Be working on technical projects related to growth.

In the first three months you will:

  • Learn and understand growth at Toptal and how our projects relate to our growth objectives.

In the first six months you will:

  • Have a deep understanding of the levers of growth as it relates to the goals of our growth channels at Toptal.

In the first year you will:

  • Help evaluate and prioritize the projects that drive growth.

Requirements:

  • Experience as a front-end developer for 2-3 years with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Experience as a back-end developer for 1-2 years, preferably with Ruby on Rails and PostgreSQL.
  • Knowledge of popular frameworks and libraries such as Bootstrap, Material UI, jQuery, Backbone, and React is a plus.
  • At least a year of experience with foundational developer tools such as git and shell, ssh.
  • An open but critical mind of an experimenter.
  • Appreciation for mostly short term project-based work and its benefits.
  • “Get things done” attitude.
  • Interest in web marketing, particularly in SEO, paid media, analytics.
  • Experience with e-commerce, advertisement, growth hacking, and conversion optimization.
  • Ability and interest in prototyping, exploration, and adopting new technologies.
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
Apply now

About Toptal

At Toptal, we value people for their contributions, not their time spent in a chair. We track goals reached, not hours worked, and we don't waste time in useless meetings. We are a completely remote company and foster a culture of relentless problem solving, direct feedback, and constant collaboration.

We analyze ideas rigorously, foster accountability, and have extremely high standards for everything we do. We are deeply invested in making sure Toptal is a place where everyone is continuously growing and learning.

Benefits

  • Remote
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Unlimited Vacation Days
  • No Mandatory Hours
  • Mentorship
  • Travel Any Time, Anywhere
  • No Office Politics

items.title: Product Design Manager
items.content:
Product Design Manager at Webflow

Remote | High-paying

San Francisco HQ or Remote (US Only)

Webflow is a fast-growing, globally distributed team with a big opportunity and bigger mission — actually, two missions: one for us, one for the world. At Webflow, we’re on a mission to enable everyone to create for the web — and empower our team to lead fulfilling, impactful lives while we do it.

Our missions are ambitious — and we’re looking to hire a Product Design Manager to help support, coach, and grow our Product Design team. One of our core behaviors is to lead by serving others, and we’re looking for a people-focused manager to help define what that looks like. Our team has recently grown from 5 to 10 individual contributors in a few months in order to support our customers and unlock more opportunities.

This is a full-time, salaried position that includes equity, health, dental, and vision benefits. In addition to these benefits, we offer awesome perks that reflect our commitment to the physical and mental well-being of every member of our team. Enjoy a $1,000 bonus for taking your first vacation over 5 days with us, a monthly stipend for health and wellness expenses, flexible parental leave, and more. Compensation will vary based on where you’ll work from — the base range for San Francisco is $170,000 – $190,000.

Note: You’ll need valid U.S. work authorization to join us.

What you’ll do:

  • Build relationships of trust and psychological safety with your reports.
  • Help your reports uncover a growth plan based on their interests and aptitude, identifying the right strategy to help them achieve that plan (whether it’s sponsoring them for an opportunity, or coaching them on specific skills).
  • Create a positive environment where your team feels safe to communicate openly, share constructive criticism and contribute innovative ideas.
  • Help resolve conflicts between your reports and their peers, coaching them on radical candor and stepping in when necessary.
  • Establish strong partnerships with your cross-functional peers in each product area that your reports work on, improving collaboration and trust for your reports.
  • Contribute to and drive initiatives to codify operations and processes that help the design team produce work they’re proud of.
  • Help recruit and retain talented designers, staffing them on teams that leverage their strengths and provide opportunities for growth.

We’d love to hear from you if:

  • You believe in people management through servant leadership, and view the success and fulfillment of your reports as your primary goal. (This is not a Creative Director position where you tell your reports what to do.)
  • You apply a user-oriented design process to managing a team. You ask questions and receive buy-in before making decisions that will impact your reports.
  • You understand when to be supportive, when to be directive, and when to sponsor your reports.
  • You have a strong understanding of a designer’s career levels (from entry-level through senior roles) and how each person has different strengths. You know how to level and an incoming candidate, staffing them on the appropriate team, and have successfully helped individual contributors get promoted.
  • You’ve helped struggling performers get back on track or find a new opportunity.
  • You practice radical candor and know how to coach others situationally.
  • You can navigate a company building a complex tool with many moving parts.
  • You understand management is not a one-size-fits-all solution, that every report needs a different approach at different stages in their career, but also believe that standardized operations can help set consistent expectations.
  • You have managed a team of designers in a full-time role. Bonus: you’ve done so with a remote or distributed team — 3 of our ICs are in Europe, with the rest spread across the US.
Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
What is Stasher?


Currently present in 250 cities, Stasher is the world's first sharing economy solution for luggage storage - think of it as the Airbnb for bags. We are a platform that connects shops, hotels and businesses (we call these StashPoints) looking to monetise their excess storage space with travellers seeking to store their bags cheaply and securely. Bring those two together via an intuitive, simple, mobile-optimised web app and you have Stasher.


What will I be doing?


As the first Product Designer at Stasher, you'll be:


- working across all of our product areas (including apps, dashboards and mobile experiences across web, iOS, and Android) 
- working through design problems from beginning to end: conducting user research and translating that into ideas, workflows and detailed interactions 
- collaborating heavily with engineers and product managers to bring your ideas to fruition


What skills do I need?


- Multiple years experience in Product design role, ideally in a start-up environment 
- Self-starter who can collaborate deeply with product and engineering 
- The ability to switch between wireframing and creating high-fidelity mockups of your designs using Sketch, Figma, etc 
- An appreciation of the entire product development process, from problem solving through to visual design 
- Excellent communicator of design work and your rationale behind proposal


On offer...


- A competitive base salary
- A meaningful equity package so that you share in the business's success
- Flexible WFH/Remote working scheme
- Comfortable equipment budget to kit out your desk
- Free fruit everyday in our Old Street office + Friday breakfast/coffee morning
- Regular team socials and team summits (when we get together with our remote workers)
- 25 days holiday + 1 day for each year you're with us
- Learning budget
- Cycle-to-work and Tech-at-work schemes

items.title: Enhancv: Senior Product Manager & Researcher
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Senior Product Manager & Researcher

At Enhancv, we build the world’s best resume-editing platform. Each month we help thousands of customers worldwide get the job they love. We are a small 10-person team spread across Europe , Asia and North America whose goal is to put an Enhancv resume on every recruiter’s desk!

We’re looking for a passionate and experienced product person who will help us build and shape a solution that touches thousands of job seekers every single day. Your job will be to help people land the job they want, all while making their experience more personal and enjoyable. 

The market is huge and the question is – are you up for the challenge and ready to roll-up your sleeves?

Well, here’s what you’ll be doing

You’ll seek out open questions and non-obvious problems. You’ll turn the unknowns into formal research ideas that will lead to meaningful customer and market insights
♀️You’ll feed and manage the product roadmap yourself. You’ll drive tactical and strategic product decisions, addressing both user behavior and market perceptions 
You will design, build and analyze data pipelines, funnels, and customer journey maps. You’ll constantly assess if we satisfied the user needs through quantitative and qualitative measures
You’ll help us shape the future vision of Enhancv and the strategy to make it happen

Ideally, you’re no stranger to these

This isn't your first product research rodeo - you have been in a product role in a company with thousands of users. Bonus points for experiences with commercial B2B, B2C or SaaS products
You have worked with both qualitative customer insights and quantitative customer data to inform decisions – contextual inquiry, clickstream analysis, A/B tests, and flow models are not just bookmarked terms in your browser.
You’re tech-savvy - you’ve dabbed into HTML/CSS, SQL, Python or Javascript. You’re eager to set up your own analytics dashboard, A/B/C and D tests or a complex logic of a survey. It’s ok if you’re not coding anymore, but you should still be looking for a solution of the boolean satisfiability problem
As an experienced researcher you know how to ask “why”, but you also know when to ask “why not”. You’re also comfortable with saying “no” and ruthless on prioritization and ROI
You read between the lines – you don’t always trust the data, our customers or successful competitors (speaking of this - mention your favorite ice-cream flavor in the typical day question of the application to let us know you saw this)

Where you'll work

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it's a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly ✈️ and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that's why we are expanding. Our engineering team is based in Sofia and so we’re looking for a person in Europe or someone who is willing to relocate.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way -- we believe that's how we'll win. And while the sky's the limit, remember you'll also positively change people's lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, Glassdoor, BuzzFeed and other media.

Salary, Benefits & Perks

Work remotely.
Market salary based on location and results you produce.
♂️ 22 days of paid leave.
⚕️ Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.
️♂️ Sports allowance.
Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.
Transport allowance.
✈️ Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.
Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.

How to join us

1️⃣  Apply and fill out the short form.  2️⃣  We'll review your application and invite you for an online interview to get to know you better.  3️⃣  If we like each other an assignment follows.  4️⃣  Finally, we'll make an offer if we feel you are the best fit for the position.

(view the full job posting and apply here https://enhancv.com/product-manager/)

--------
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Product Manager // Cara Care

Company: Cara Care

Tags:
  • Mobile
  • SCRUM
  • Apps
  • product management

    • Product Manager at Cara Care

    At Cara Care we are working towards our vision to empower individuals to live a healthier and happier life. To support every person in the world with a gastrointestinal disease, we are developing the first digital companion therapeutic for digestive health – Cara Care.

    Our cross functional product team is responsible for shaping the user experience and bringing our products to life bringing together the power of UX, UI, Data Science, Tech, Medicine, Business and Psychology.

    Starting immediately, we are looking for a Product Manager to support us in our mission.

    What’s like to work with us

    We are an interdisciplinary team of doctors, designers and software engineers who all truly care about what we’re building and how it can help people. Our work is inspired by our patient’s journey and our actions are focused on impact and results. We thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment, while appreciating what it means to be healthy and well.

    To learn a bit more about our motivation, our team and company, you can visit our career page: https://cara.care/careers

    What we’re looking for

    A group of your future teammates and stakeholders met to outline the key skills and behaviors we think will lead to success in this role:

    We are looking for an experienced product manager to join our top-notch mission-driven team. You will be responsible for defining, planning, and driving forward the execution of new functionality within our product roadmap. You’re a good facilitator and communicator who works closely with users and data to inform product plans and iteratively achieve our goals. You’re a proven team-player and problem solver who understands how to shape world-class products at a fast growing startup.You will partner closely with our operations team including health coaches and physicians to help shaping experiences for patients that seamlessly blend human input with software.

    You…

    • Know and enable our users
    • Build teamwork through trusted relationships
    • Prioritize efficiently across a complex set of inputs
    • Know the drivers of our business and our unit economics
    • Security and Privacy aware! You understand risks and best practice

    Responsibilities

    • Play a key role in shaping the product roadmap that balances consumer, medical, business, and technical priorities.
    • Execute the PM fundamentals before, during, and after each sprint
    • Clearly define and communicate what a winning consumer product looks like, rally teams to build it and iterate until we get it right.
    • Obsessively map the user journey and find creative ways to improve it; making it more delightful and responsive to the user’s needs.
    • Find and use data to drive informed decisions, even with imperfect information.
    • Build consensus across our team, with external partners and our patients.
    • Demonstrate expert understanding of agile development practices, understanding how to train and optimize team members’ techniques.
    • Track and (re-) evaluate the right OKRs/KPIs for our business to ensure efficient sustainable growth, engagement, satisfaction, and retention.
    • Help build an aspirational consumer-facing healthcare brand that puts the patient first, and that redefines the standard digestive health treatments.

    Qualifications

    • 5+ years of Product Management experience – a mix of early and mature stage company experience is a plus. Experience in digital health is a big plus
    • Strong people/relationship skills, experience understanding team dynamics and concerns
    • Worked closely with UX Designers and engineers on defining, building, and testing features and enhancements using agile product development methods
    • Passion for creating an exceptional user experience
    • Expertise in using both qualitative insights and quantitative findings to inform the development process
    • Deep experience defining, reporting and executing against team level, user-based KPIs
    • Excellent written and oral communication skills
    • Excellent organizational and analytical skills with strong technical abilities
    • Experience executing data-driven product strategies and roadmaps
    • Track record of working on consumer-facing products from 0 to 1 that both delight the user and exceed their business objectives
    • Passion for your personal health and wellness and that of others
    • Languages: English is required

    In return, we will ensure you have:

    • Meaningful work – help people improve their lives
    • A vibrant team and a friendly working atmosphere
    • Ability to significantly influence the direction of our startup
    • Competitive salary with regularly salary reviews
    • Participate in our success: Equity options
    • 26 days holiday a year (plus public holidays)
    • The best equipment and setup to be productive
    • Flexible working hours. If you prefer early starts, late finishes or from time to time remote
    • Team events, weekly breakfasts and team drinks
    • A well-equipped office in the heart of Berlin with plenty of snacks, drinks, fresh fruit and a great espresso machine

    Next Steps

    • We will review your application as quickly as possible and reply to you with next steps. If we haven’t selected your CV/LinkedIn profile please don’t let that put you off applying again. We get a lot of applications and sometimes it’s just not the right match. We always try, but often can’t provide you with individual feedback if we get many applications.
    • If we move on to the next stage we will arrange a brief intro call where we can tell you more about us and chat through what you are looking for. We are also open to answer your questions about Cara Care. (Tip: Calls are better done in a quiet place, so please pick a time where you know you are going to be free.)
    • After an interactive interview you will meet the team in person. If we both think that we should work together, we will make you an offer. We value your time and try to be as fast as possible to go through the process and will always provide you with feedback from any of our interview stages.

    At Cara Care we care about equal opportunities.

    Diversity is important to us. We need a team with all kinds of different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds. That’s why we’re committed to hiring people regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age or disability.

    We understand that applying for a new job takes a lot of work and we really value your time. Our team is looking forward to reading your application!

    Please visit fill out this form to start the application process:  https://cara-app.typeform.com/to/bYXC7X

    Apply for this position

hiringOrganization.name: Security Scorecard - We are revolutionizing the cybersecurity industry

items.content:
Security Scorecard - We are revolutionizing the cybersecurity industry

Senior Data Analytics Engineer

Why SecurityScorecard SecurityScorecard is revolutionizing the cybersecurity industry with our platform, data, and insights. We’ve built a new category of enterprise software, which enables companies to rate and understand the security risk of any company. Our customers span a variety of sectors and use cases, including compliance, cyber insurance, and vendor risk management. We are proud to be backed by Sequoia, Google Ventures, and Moody's. SecurityScorecard is growing tremendously and targeting talent who can contribute to the next phase in our company's development. A successful Scorecarder exemplifies our S(CORE) values: Solutions Focused, Customer Centric, operate as One Team, Resilience and Embody #SecurityDNA. Your interest in making an impact in our organization and alignment with these values are as important as your skills. Opportunity The Senior Data Analytics Engineer will build meaningful analytics that inform companies of security risk. You will be working closely with our Data Science team, implementing algorithms and managing the analytic pipeline. We have over 1 PB of data, so the ideal candidate will have experience processing and querying large amounts of data. We prefer this person to work from our NYC headquarters, but will consider remote applicants in other geographic areas. Responsibilities: * Manage the analytic pipeline using Spark, Hadoop, etc. * Leverage cutting-edge technologies to support new and existing and services and processes. * Quickly and efficiently design and implement in an agile environment * Work with other team members to implement consistent architecture * Drive projects through all stages of development * Actively share knowledge and responsibility with other team members and teams * Improve the effective output of the engineering team by managing quality, and identifying inconsistencies. Requirements: * Bachelor's degree (CS, EE or Math preferred) or equivalent work experience as well as interest in a fast paced, complex environment. * 5+ years of experience Scala or another functional language experience in a commercial environment (highly preferred) * 3+ Experience with Spark, and the Hadoop ecosystem and similar frameworks * Familiarity with various tools such as AWS and Docker and an instinct for automation * Expert in SQL * Strong understanding of Software Architecture principles and patterns. * Experience working with 3rd party software and libraries, including open source * Experience with Postgres

items.content:
*This position requires advanced knowledge in SEO or PPC.

At Directive, we make sure that every account we work with is treated with the highest level of attention and expertise. If you are looking for a competitive, challenging, fast-paced environment based on constant growth we're the agency for you!

Beyond results, you'll get to work with an enthusiastic team in an environment that values a work/life balance. Team building parties, competitions, and paid for conferences all add to our ethos of Teamwork and Unity.

You will manage no more than 8 client projects and will be responsible for communicating results and strategy to clients as their main point of contact in the agency. We believe that SEO, PPC, and Content all drive results, so you'll need to be able to communicate this in a way that excites your clients.

We recognize that great work takes time and do not want you to manage more than 8 accounts at any given time.

You will collaborate with your own dedicated team of an SEO and a PPC specialist to ensure that the deliverables are implemented and the accounts are achieving their objectives. When necessary, you can roll up the sleeves and deliver exceptional work.

You will communicate regularly with executives and must be able to clearly articulate strategic vision. You must be creative as well as data-driven, but ultimately you are responsible for managing client expectations and communicating success.

Requirements
  • 2+ years experience in SEO or PPC
  • Extremely organized + great at managing deadlines
  • Exceptional critical + strategic thinking skills
  • Polished communication skills; ability to drive a conversation with executives
  • Ability to measure the effectiveness of strategy (rankings, traffic, conversions) + make decisions based on data
  • Exceptional project + time management skills
  • Ability to lead and manage a team
  • LinkedIn Profile
Benefits:
  • Exceptional Health, Dental, and Vision
  • Work Remote At Six Months
  • Customizable 401k Plan + 3% Match
  • Unlimited Vacation & Paid Time Off
  • Donation Matching to Charitable Causes
  • Employee Care Services for Mental Health

  • Company-Stocked Kitchen + Fridge + Cold Brew + Kombucha
  • Check out our culture on social:

items.title: Sr. SEO Manager (Remote Available)
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
At Directive, we take great pride in knowing that every account we work with is treated with the highest levels of attention and expertise. We love contributing content to the industry and sending team members to top conferences to polish their skill-sets.

As a Google, Bing, MozLocal, and Unbounce partner, we like to think of ourselves as a launchpad for our clients and team member's careers. Building a proud alumni is just a slice of our core values.

If you are looking for the next step in your SEO career, please read on!

Here are some key things that you will be accomplishing:
  • You'll interface directly with senior in-house marketers
  • You'll drive traffic and increase ROI for our accounts via competitive analysis, keyword research, technical SEO, link building, and CRO
  • You'll do the creative side of SEO from outreach to content to link building
  • You'll measure success by reporting from a variety of resources including Data Studio, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Google Analytics, Ahrefs, Majestic, and Moz
  • You'll report your clients' online presence by tracking + reporting changes in traffic, rankings, trends, conversions, opportunities, deals, and revenue
  • You'll share your insights with our team and clients to keep all of us in the loop
  • You'll tie everything back to business objectives and focus on the initial reason the client hired us
The Skills:
  • 2+ years of hands-on SEO experience with mid-enterprise accounts
  • You're passionate about SEO, but you treat business and marketing from a holistic perspective
  • You're able to use SEO skills, such as keyword research, to understand your client's target market
  • You have technical SEO skills: comprehending crawl rate, architecture, content, etc.
  • When it comes to SEO trends, you know what's coming before it happens. Blogs are your thing, you might even contribute or want to
  • You know that SEO is not an isolated channel and you're willing to dive into other channels to provide insight
  • Deadlines? You never even get close to them because you are so ahead with your personal time management and communication
  • Solutions are your thing. Can't is not a word
  • The faster the work environment the better for you. You can't help but ask: "What's Next?
Bonus Points:
  • Run your own website or blog? Show it off
  • Experience at a top search agency (we love our agency friends who do it right)
  • Expertise in PPC and Analytics
  • Program a little? ...yes please
  • Desire to publish and speak for industry leaders
Benefits:
  • Exceptional Health, Dental, and Vision
  • Work Remote At Six Months
  • Customizable 401k Plan + 3% Match
  • Unlimited Vacation & Paid Time Off
  • Donation Matching to Charitable Causes
  • Employee Care Services for Mental Health
  • Opportunity to be Published on Industry Leading Blogs
  • Gym Membership
  • Company Provided Macbook
  • Team Building Events (ping-pong, pool table, beach days, food trucks, and more)
  • State of the Art Office
  • Company-Stocked Kitchen + Fridge + Cold Brew + Kombucha

items.title: Content Marketing Editor
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Content Marketing Editor at Animalz

Remote | International

Category: Marketing
Job Type: Full-Time

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies grow by producing high-quality, strategic content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (executives, managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the B2B SaaS/tech field.

We are looking for an editor who specializes in online content and who can help our writers improve over time and across clients in structure, tone, style, and on-page SEO. As much teacher as teammate, this person will review every piece of content at least twice from the outlining phase to the nearly final draft and use each review as an opportunity to encourage the writer and drive their continued growth in the craft.

“A real editor isn’t just someone you work with; they are your guide. They see your brain doing its thing and learn its weaknesses and abilities, and if they’re really good, they figure out what you need to hear to compensate for the former and accentuate the latter. – Ariel Levy

An ideal B2B tech/SaaS content editor at Animalz:

  • has a proven track record of successful writing and editing for the web, particularly in B2B/tech/SaaS
  • can communicate why changes should be made, not simply fix errors or improve writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves coaching writers
  • understands the business side of writing & editing
  • is deeply passionate about good content and approaches editing with a creatively curious mindset
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future

Requirements:

  • Proven writing and editing ability
  • Mastery of on-page SEO and how to apply it to each piece of content to provide guidance for writers
  • Ability to understand content strategy and edit content to align with it
  • Desire to help writers improve their craft and elevate their content to the highest quality
  • Experience successfully working with writing/editing customers
  • Basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social media function, how they can work together to get results, and the different writing/stylistic requirements of each
  • Strong interest in the tech/SaaS field and a thorough knowledge of the top content and thought leadership in the field
  • Work in North America’s Eastern time zone to support our writers there and in Europe

Responsibilities:

  • Edit ~15 B2B articles and outlines per week (~1,500 words each), ensuring they comply with the customer strategy and optimizing them for performance
  • Educate our writers around good content in both form/structure and technical aspects (like SEO)
  • Provide support and constructive feedback to writers to help them improve their craft

About Animalz

We’re a remote, eclectic team of current and former scientists, journalists, operations folks with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the position

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote job. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is not a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional endeavors.

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere you like (during EST business hours)
  • Company-sponsored health insurance covering 80% of premium for medical and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year (including holidays)
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy a lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and conferences
Apply for job

items.title: Performance Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
What is Stasher?


Currently present in 250 cities, Stasher is the world's first sharing economy solution for luggage storage - think of it as the Airbnb for bags. We are a platform that connects shops, hotels and businesses (we call these StashPoints) looking to monetise their excess storage space with travellers seeking to store their bags cheaply and securely. Bring those two together via an intuitive, simple, mobile-optimised web app and you have Stasher.


As our Performance Marketing Manager you'll be...


- Working closely with our PPC agency to expand and optimise our AdWords strategy
- Providing our content and brand marketing team analytical and technical seo insight to continue to grow our organic search traffic
- Collaborating with the product team to implement setup all necessary analytical tools and analyse performance of our web/mobile apps
- Segmenting and analysing our audience data to produce insights that can further improve our marketing/remarketing efforts across the funnel (using SQL, google analytics and any other tools you are comfortable with)
- Experimenting with new paid and organic channels to continue to drive overall growth


The right candidate will...


- Have multiple years experience in relevant roles
- Fit the description of a 'T-shaped marketer' with an expertise in SEO/SEM
- Have an understanding of how to use google analytics and google tag manager or similar platforms
- Be open to learning new skills - we are happy to allow time for this!
- Be competent in SQL and Excel for analysis purposes - python is a plus.


On offer...


- A competitive base salary
- A meaningful equity package so that you share in the business's success
- Flexible WFH/Remote working scheme
- Comfortable equipment budget to kit out your desk
- Free fruit everyday in our Old Street office + Friday breakfast/coffee morning
- Regular team socials and team summits (when we get together with our remote workers)
- 25 days holiday + 1 day for each year you're with us
- Learning budget
- Cycle-to-work and Tech-at-work schemes

items.title: Chinese Speaking Digital Marketing Intern (Part-Time)
items.content:
We are looking for a digital marketing intern to assist a start-up business in property sourcing and service accommodations tailored to Chinese investors, professionals, and students.

An ideal candidate would be a responsible and organized person who works well both with and without supervision. You need to be IT savvy, able to take initiative and use plenty of common sense with a genuine interest in properties and people.

Job Main Responsibilities and Duties:


  1. Delivery and support of social media strategy and plans in line with wider business and marketing objectives;

  2. Own and keep company’s digital content production, campaigns calendar and online customer relation management, including writing social content to drive customer interaction and education, ensuring content is published at the right times to the right audiences by the right channels, and is always-on;

  3. Assisting with business projects, including aligning with product launches, advertising campaigns, and business report, scheduling of real-time publication of content according to all business promotion and events arrangement;


 

Work Location: Remote.

Work hours – Part-time; minimum 20 hours per week and 3 months commitment is required.

Allowance: £10/Hr

items.title: User Researcher
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
User Researcher


 


Do you want to join an exciting start-up in the IoT health space? Do you like supporting devices, software, and apps? Do you dream about real-world experience supporting large-scale applications connecting people and devices together using a variety of technologies? Are you motivated by working in a fast-paced dynamic environment? We’re looking for a User Research to join our rapidly growing team.


 


Salary £30-40K subject to experience





Role:


Overseeing all aspects of user research, to understand user behaviours, needs, motivations through observation techniques, task analysis, and other feedback methodologies. Advocating the value of their research to the rest of the company. Working in collaboration with others to foster a strong culture of user-centred design and to act as the voice of the end customer.





Responsibilities:



  • Immerse yourself in the health and care IoT and data science market, and uncover customer needs

  • Run an in-house user research lab

  • Advocate for an evidence-based culture, helping the wider organisation identify and unpick their assumptions

  • Show how user research works with agile delivery

  • Establish a user research practice, involving the whole team, UX, research and product

  • Work with the wider organisation to help set the strategic direction for the user research strategy, objectives and activities

  • Coach and mentor other members of the UX team to further develop their skills





Experience:



  • 2 to 5 years of relevant experience

  • Facilitating workshops with senior stakeholders i.e. findings, analysis and decision making

  • Balancing user needs against business objectives and constraints

  • Prioritising requests for research, and writing research project timelines

  • Cataloguing and maintenance an "insights library" of research findings

  • Running a research lab

  • Sourcing research participants using external recruitment agencies

  • Promoting evidence-based decision making, and the value of analytics and statistics

  • Understanding the value of analytics, AB testing, quantitative data analysis and statistics





Culture and Personality:



  • Willing to work hard but also have fun

  • Good sense of humour

  • Entrepreneurial spirit

  • An appetite to achieve great things and to help many vulnerable people remain independent in their own homes

  • An appetite for learning

  • A passion for technology of all types

  • An interest in health and wellbeing

  • Enjoys a social office atmosphere





Benefits:



  • 30 days holiday + your birthday + Public Holidays

  • Fruits, Coffee, Tea and breakfast all are in office

  • Remote working possible

  • Private Health Insurance

  • Pension scheme

  • Office dog (hypoallergenic)

  • Relaxed start-up environment - your input matters

  • Company laptop





About MySense


MySense is a wellbeing analytics platform built on compassion, by people who understand what it’s like to care for a loved one. But we’re also a team of dedicated (self-proclaimed) nerds, tech is what we know and love. So, we have combined these two drives and created a product we can be proud of.


The idea is that peace of mind about a loved one’s wellbeing should be at people’s fingertips no matter who or where they are. To do this, we created a wearable device and 11 sensors that can be placed around someone’s home. Each sensor picks up information about a key activity. This means looking at drinking and eating habits, toilet usage, sleep patterns and heart rate (approximately 5,000 data points). These sensors collect data that our AI then analyses for any patterns of decline in wellbeing. When we start to notice that something isn’t looking ideal, we send caregivers notifications so they can address problems before they escalate.


 


Check us out:


https://www.mysense.ai


https://www.linkedin.com/company/mysense


 


We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

items.title: Mobile Engineer (Data Collection) for growing startup at Snowplow Analytics
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=6, mobile=39, go=8, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=15, java=22, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Mobile Engineer (Data Collection) for growing startup

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Customer Data Platform, Data & Analytics, Mobile Analytics
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Snowplow Analytics | No office location

Technologies

ios
objective-c
java
android
javascript

Job description

Mobile Engineer (Data Collection)

London or remote (happy to work in UTC +/- 3)

Build the mobile data analytics platform you’ve always dreamed of using. Snowplow want to provide best in class mobile tracking libraries, enrichments, models and solutions, so that mobile engineers can see the difference they’re making to their customers.

At Snowplow, we are on a mission to empower people to differentiate with data. We provide the technology to enable our customers to not only take control of their data, but empower them to do amazing things with that control.

There are tens of thousands of pipelines using our open source pipeline worldwide, handling data emitted from over half a million sites, apps and IOT devices. We also collect, validate, enrich and load up to 5 billion events for our own customers each day. We help our users to securely and responsibly track comprehensive data sets to drive their key business decisions.

The Opportunity

We’re looking for an experienced iOS and/or Android engineer to join our team and progress our data collection capabilities. If you know one, we’d like you to learn the other too, but most importantly we’d like to find someone who fully understands and is enthusiastic about solving the mobile analytics problem. It would be a real bonus if you also have a working knowledge of JavaScript and some server side languages (Java, Python, Golang, the list goes on!) to contribute to our wide range of trackers.

Snowplow has seen significant growth over the last 12 months and we’re set to grow further in 2019. You will be joining a team of 12 engineers who work closely with our tech ops, support, product and customer teams. There is huge opportunity to learn more about all aspects of engineering and data, from code to customers. We love working with people who jump at the opportunity to own new challenges and are dedicated to building a great team and product!

What you’ll be doing

  • Contributing to our many open source projects and adding to the capability of our tracking solutions.
  • Providing your expertise in iOS (Objective-C) and Android (Java) engineering to enable the team to extend the trackers.
  • Owning the engineering experience of adopting the trackers and engaging the community on further improvements.
  • Continuing to improve our testing and deployment processes so that we can ship features quickly and with confidence.
  • Working closely with our Product Office and the wider team on building the best solutions for our customers.
  • Being an active part in decision making on what we build and how we deliver it. You’ll bring a different perspective and we’ll want your input!

We’d love to hear from you if

  • The idea of working for a growing startup excites you.
  • You have experience working collaboratively on complex engineering projects.
  • You’ll be technically excellent in at least one of Objective-C or Java development, and willing and able to pick up the other if required.
  • Our data security and integrity are fundamental to what we do. You’ll need a solid understanding of security threats and how to overcome them.
  • Previous experience in data is a plus, but most importantly you’re enthusiastic about data and how it can empower our customers to make good decisions.
  • You don’t wait to be told what to do. You can accept a mission, drive toward it and recognise when you need support or more direction.
  • We can’t do everything today. You’ll be pragmatic in your approach to software delivery and balance our speed of learning with our commitment to providing a reliable and trusted service to customers
  • Our remote team depends on expert collaborators to work effectively. You’ll be a great communicator and enjoy working closely with the team.

What you’ll get in return

  • A competitive package based on experience, including share options
  • 25 days of holiday a year (plus public holidays wherever you’re located)
  • Freedom to work from wherever suits you best. We trust our team to find the right environment for them to do their best work
  • Two fantastic company Away-Weeks in different European cities each year (last one was in Lisbon in May 2019)
  • Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee 
  • Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation full of supportive and talented people. 
  • Convenient location in central London (specifically Shoreditch) for frequent collaboration or occasional visits, depending on where you’re based
  • Continuous supply of Pact coffee and healthy snacks in the office
  • A high spec MacBook or Dell XPS 13/15
Apply now

About Snowplow Analytics

We have an office located in London but believe in letting our team members choose where they work best so nearly half of the company currently works remotely. We offer flexibility, trust and freedom.

We're looking for a Mobile Engineer to join our fully remote Engineering team.

Benefits

  • A competitive package, including share options
  • MacBook Pro
  • 25 days holiday plus bank holidays
  • Freedom to work wherever suits you best
  • Flexible working hours
  • Two fantastic company Away Weeks a year (last one was in Madrid)
  • Convenient Shoreditch office location
  • Regular fun events organised by our Cultural Works Committee
  • Improve coding skills with our Software Development Guild
  • Regular meetups/team offsites

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) QM -Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP

We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP QM specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong QM experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to.

What You Will Be Doing

- The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Quality Management (QM) modul
- SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the QM modules in the SAP functional area
- Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution
- Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support,
- Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices,
- Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas,
- Supports multiple projects and BAU activities,
- Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration
- Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles

What You Need for this Position

- 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment, several S/4 HANA implementations under your belt.
- Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success,
- Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite,
- Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls,
- Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation,
- Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles
- Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape,
- Experience in designing SAP software components,
- Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools,
- Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies,
- Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment,
- College or University (IT /Business) Degree,
- Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of QM and experience with S4/HANA
- Expert SAP technical knowledge,
- Expert Integration understanding,
- Strong spoken and written English,
- Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP QM specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
