items.title: Events and Field Marketing Manager
items.content:
Events and Field Marketing Manager at Chili Piper

Remote | International

Location: Brooklyn New York United States
Employment Type: Full-time

Company Description
Chili Piper helps businesses help their buyers.

People interested in your business typically have to wait hours or days after filling out a form. Not anymore. Our intelligent assistant offers them a simple way to book a meeting or start a phone call immediately upon form submission.

Unlike the traditional method of inbound lead management, Chili Piper uses smart rules to qualify and distribute leads to the right reps in real time. Our software also allows companies to automate opportunity distribution from their SDRs to their AEs, and book meetings from their marketing campaigns and live events.

Companies like Square, Twilio, DiscoverOrg, SalesLoft, and SiriusDecisions use Chili Piper to create an amazing experience for their leads, and in return experience higher conversions for their business.

Chili Piper is focused on helping Businesses help their Buyers – building a new category we call Buyer Enablement

Job Description
ALL ROLES AT CHILI PIPER ARE REMOTE SO YOU CAN WORK FROM ANYWHERE

The Events and Field Marketing Manager will be responsible for shaping the annual event strategy, creating and executing demand campaigns and managing online and in-person events based marketing initiatives. You should be a strategic, motivating and scrappy thinker and you will generate demand for Chili Piper as we build the category of Buyer Enablement.

What You’ll Do:

  • Drive Chili Pipers Events Strategy and manage all aspects of event coordination including: strategy, objectives materials creation, event messaging/marketing, signage, giveaways, contract negotiation, vendor relations, site selection, registration, agenda scheduling, staffing, etc….
  • Manage events ABM activities, in partnership with sales, including: identifying target accounts, developing strategy, executing campaigns with the support of cross-functional teams.
  • Conduct post-event/campaign evaluations and ROI analysis; report and share results and recommendations with sales team and marketing teams.
  • Strategize, order and deliver promotional items to support sales & events.
  • Research industry events and marketing/campaign opportunities and evaluate sponsorship based on Chili Pipers objectives and target market.
  • Maintain event and campaign documents – budgets, calendars, checklists, run-of-shows, etc.
  • Complete budget reviews and ROI analysis; pivot strategy to align with findings.
  • Achieve benchmarked ROI metrics by working with the sales and demand generation teams, managing and analyzing campaign data in Salesforce.

Qualifications:
What We’re Looking For:

  • 5+ years experience in events and field marketing leadership, ideally in B2B SaaS
  • Demonstrated success in identifying, coordinating, and analyzing the best events for sales to attend based on event ROI
  • Experience handling and managing events budgets
  • BA/BS Degree in marketing, communications, journalism or a related field
  • Experience working with cross functional teams to support a joint outcome
  • Motivated, driven, scrappy, and enjoys a fast paced startup environment
  • Strong proficiency and experience using Salesforce 1-2+ Years Minimum
  • Strong proficiency and experience using Marketing Automation software 1-2+ Years Minimum (Marketo, Pardot, Hubspot, etc…..

Additional Information
How We Work:

  • Freedom and flexibility.Were a 100% distributed team working from around the world. Our team members can work from wherever they want in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all-hands meeting on Zoom.
  • Solve interesting problems.The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.
  • Autonomy and ownership. Working on a distributed team means you don’t have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure you’re getting things done. Were a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.
  • Be helpful. Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

The Perks:

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • Generous Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • WeWork membership so you can work from anywhere
  • Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job
Apply for job

items.content:
WeGift is on a mission to completely reinvent rewards. Rewards are everywhere, from employee compensation to customer acquisition, from gift cards to crypto pay-outs. It’s a $600bn global market. Yet this massive industry is stuck in the middle ages. Just like Stripe did for payments or Twilio did for telephony, we are on a mission to completely transform our industry with a radical new approach that is product-led, API-led, and helps our clients enter a world of real-time optimisation with immediate revenue generating and operational benefits.


We are a young company, yet we have already signed a world-class portfolio of clients (Sky, Vodafone, Coinbase), and over 400 retail brands on our platform from Amazon to Nike and many more. With a global roll out, we’re growing fast, like really fast. We are looking to assemble a fabulous, diverse and driven group of people who take pride in their work and are not afraid to take on industry giants.


We pride ourselves on an inclusive, fun and results driven culture predicated on fast decision making, zero-politics and collaborative no BS attitude. We’re transforming how we send and spend money with a commitment to unlocking value for billions around the world and would love you to join us on the journey.


We are looking for an entrepreneurial Product Manager to work with our marketing, finance, design and engineering teams to plan, define and deliver new applications and features. You will also be a critical player in shaping new products and tracking their performance.


Responsibilities



  • Own the development of world-class products from conception to launch

  • As the mini CEO of your team, you will help define the vision and goals with your team and determine the best way to measure success (using KPIs).

  • Collaborate with engineering, design, marketing, finance and other cross-functional teams to plan, define and deliver new consumer products and features

  • Define and analyze metrics to guide product development towards an optimal customer experience

  • Have ideas, communicate them effectively to the rest of the company and inspire your team to execute on them.

  • Be a critical player in shaping new products and tracking their performance.

  • 6+ years of product management experience


Requirements



  • 2+ years of experience building products related to giftcards or fintech startups

  • Exceptional interpersonal communication and organizational skills

  • Deep analytical, prioritization and problem solving skills

  • Demonstrated passion for the WeGift mission

  • An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to succeed in a fast-paced environment


Benefits



  • Pay reviews every 6 months to make sure we’re paying market rate.

  • Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.

  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new WeWork office based in Monument, London.

  • A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.

  • Catered lunch once a week.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike


 


We are an equal opportunity employer value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


 


Successful candidates will be contacted within two weeks.

Fintech Product(Digital) marketer

items.content:
About Us


WeGift is on a mission to revolutionise a multi-billion-dollar industry that is stuck in the middle ages. We’re here to make an impact and build something unique and trusted. Building a world class business requires a world class effort, so we make sure that each team member is appreciated for the unique value and skills they bring. Our team will recognise every single one of your accomplishments as well as your drive to succeed. If you’re looking for an environment that will inspire you to dream bigger, work harder and make a difference every day, you’re in the right place.


The Role


We are looking for a commercially minded wordsmith to deliver the cut through content to elevate WeGift as a leader and help craft a remarkable content strategy. On a day to day basis you will:



  • Work closely with the marketing team on briefs, and act on the agreed content strategy.

  • You’ll own building an editorial calendar, going deep into crafting the best content in the digital reward space.

  • Review content produced, proofreading, re-engineering and setting the bar for excellence.

  • You’ll strive to understand the customer’s point of view, learning the industry at large and hit the main pain points based on the personas defined.

  • Work to the brand guidelines, shaping them and making sure we’re consistent and communicating the immense value of our offering in the market-at-large.


What we are looking for:



  • Impeccable English and writing skills with a touch of eloquence

  • Ideally a background in B2B, SaaS

  • An ability to translate complex terms (we’re a tech platform) into business language

  • Able to articulate messages to an SME audience as well as Enterprise

  • A creative thinker

  • An interest in disruptive tech culture

  • A desire to work in a small collaborative team

  • Great organisational and time-management skills

  • Conduct qualitative interviews as the foundation of producing brilliant content


Compensation



  • £40-50k



  • Pay reviews every 6 months to make sure we’re paying market rate.

  • Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.

  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new WeWork office based in Monument, London.

  • A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.

  • Catered lunch once a week.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Product Designer at Customer.io

Remote | High-paying | International

at Customer.io

Remote

At Customer.io our design team is working hard to build a product that nudges companies toward empathetic communication with their customers. We help them send automated messaging that their customers actually like to receive. If that’s exciting to you, we should talk.

Our current team includes designers who are passionate about developing our design system and improving our visual design. We would love to add a Product Designer with a specific interest in solving the complex user experience problems in our product.

About Customer.io

We believe that businesses who create strong relationships with their customers will outperform the ones who don’t.

Were working to make Customer.io the default choice for any internet business to deliver great, automated customer experiences at scale. Customer.io is used by over 1200 businesses to create continuity after a person leaves a website or mobile app. Every message (receipts, win-backs, and onboarding) across every channel (email, push, sms and more) can be managed and measured in Customer.io.

What will you be doing as Product Designer?

  • Sketching exploratory designs and customer journeys for new features.
  • Building high fidelity mockups and sharing opinionated design proposals in Slack and Notion.
  • Collecting and acting on feedback from your peers and our customers.
  • Pairing with developers to bring ideas to life in interactive prototypes.
  • Iterating on our design system by making improvements to foundational styles, components, and processes.

Examples of some recent projects we’ve worked on:

  1. Transitioning all of our page layouts to card-based layouts to help users focus on content.
  2. Designing a drag-and-drop workflow builder so people can visualize complex automated messaging workflows.
  3. Discussing and writing guidelines for our take on accessibility (check it out in our WIP design system documentation)

What will you bring to the table?

  • If you identify as a UX or UI designer, that’s okay. We don’t care much about labels.
  • The most important thing: You have a deep interest in finding ways to improve UX in complex flows and features.
  • You have a solid understanding of interaction design methods and best practices (including journey mapping, human computer interaction, and animations).
  • You have a growth mindset and are willing to challenge our team and propose changes to how we do things.
  • You genuinely care about understanding the outcomes of products you work on and will make design decisions that protect our customers and their end-users.
  • You can present your work clearly to an asynchronous team.
  • You have experience in user research and usability testing practices.

And bonus if you have these skills too:

  • Ability to level-up our copy strategy.
  • Experience working with SVGs and creating illustrations.
  • Visual design acumen (color, typography, iconography).
  • Understanding of HTML, CSS, and git.

Why should you work with Customer.io?

We’re in a special moment as a company: small enough where you’ll have a big impact as an individual, big enough to have resources to conquer ambitious goals as a team, yet calm about how we set growth goals.

We are a remote-first company – we have employees in Australia, the United States, India, and beyond. We meet up twice a year to get to know each other, but prioritize asynchronous communication strategies that help us build strong relationships from wherever we choose to work.

We do a lot of research to ensure everyone is paid well and think our new Product Designer will be paid around $90,000-$110,000, but will adjust for experience. Check out our career’s page for more information on our great benefits and why you should come work with us!

Diversity statement

We want to build and maintain a diverse, inclusive, and equitable environment where everyone has the opportunity to learn, mentor, and grow. We know that diverse teams make better products, and especially encourage applicants from underrepresented groups to apply if you have any questions, please let us know. We want people with different backgrounds from the team we have today to bring their perspective and thoughtfulness to the work that we do and the culture were always working to build.

Apply for job

items.content:
Product Manager at Sideways 6  


An opportunity to build products at a company helping change the way large companies work 


 


In a Nutshell  


Reporting to the Head of Product, this is a hands-on position working alongside a team of ~15 product executives, engineers and designers spread across 2 offices. As a Product Manager at Sideways6, you will be doing end-to-end product management. You will be responsible for product planning, delivery and marketing throughout the product lifecycle. 


 


About Sideways 6 


Sideways 6 exists to build better businesses through employee ideas. We believe that great ideas can come from anywhere and that giving employees a voice is the secret to business success. 


 Over 4 million employees from the likes of Virgin, AstraZeneca, Sainsbury’s, Nestle and International Airlines Group trust the Sideways 6 approach, and we’re on a mission to give 50 million people a voice. 


 We're a fast-growing Enterprise Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) scale-up with significant traction, great clients and stories, and some incredible investors. We have huge ambitions that rely on growing a profitable base of long-term enterprise clients. That’s where you come in. 


 We’re really proud of our 5-star reviews on Glassdoor,and it’s a testament to the way we treat our employees. You will be given lots of responsibility, plenty of room to grow and develop, and the chance to be part of something pretty special. The‘Idea Beer’probably helps too.  


 


Responsibilities 



  • Define the strategy and roadmap for your product areas 

  • Run feedback sessions and manage all customer feedback from internal and external stakeholders 

  • Monitor, report and improve product KPIs including usage, performance and satisfaction 

  • Be the go-to person in the business on our product, the market, technology and our competition 



  • Drive agile best practices and processes across the whole development lifecycle  

  • Work with our Lead Designer in the research and design of features and create requirements that will be used during development  

  • Manage and prioritise a functionality and bug backlog in Azure DevOps and prepare commitments towards fortnightly sprints 

  • Lead and support a remote engineering team to ensure delivery of agreed objectives 

  • Lead daily scrum meetings, planning, reviews and retrospectives 



  • Work with Product Marketing on product positioning and messaging 

  • Help build Go-to-Market plans and deliver against them 

  • Develop and deliver training to Support, Sales and Customer Success 


 


 Role Requirements 



  • We’re looking for an ambitious product manager on an upward trajectory who’s hungry for a career-defining position where they can put a lot in and get a lot out 

  • Excited by the idea of working in a fast-growing start up 

  • Able to lead a team and maintain a strong working relationship with colleagues across offices 

  • A passion and connoisseur’s eye for beautiful, effective design and the art of a great product 



  • 1+ years of product-related experience, ideally within a fast-growing B2B or SaaS business 


 


What’s on Offer 



  • An awesome, open, fast-paced and vibrant start-up environment 

  • A product to take care of that’s being used at companies you know and love to solve big, big challenges 

  • Generous educational budget to use at your discretion 

  • Dog-friendly workplace (you’ll love Millie!) 

  • Regular social company gatherings and weekly happy hours 

  • Great colleagues (personally and professionally) 

  • Free tea, coffee, fruit and snacks

items.title: Mito HQ Pty Ltd: Social/Community Manager to Help 100M People

items.content:
Social/Community Manager to Help 100M People

About You

You have a knack for understanding people. You ask a lot of questions. You’re decisive.

As Community Manager at MitoHQ, your primary job is to understand our customer— what motivates them, what makes their job difficult, and what simply delights them. You will take these constant and ongoing learnings and deftly apply them to the way we position our brand and movement to the world. After all, social business is at its very core, all about people. 

Your previous experience growing a highly engaged community will enable you to oversee the customer engagement through all social channels.

Sometimes you’ll be looking at our community management from a high level view—say, determining our key objectives for the quarter or the year. Other days, you may be down in the weeds yourself, slicing content to suit each channel or working with others on the marketing team to run A/B conversion tests on site. You’re comfortable—and happy—doing both.

What you don’t know, you’ll openly admit, but then you’ll get to work figuring it out (asking others for help and/or digging deep on your own). Your self-motivation and a relentless drive to learn/do more are appreciated by all. You pride yourself on being a “clever thinker”.  

You’re comfortable talking with and working alongside our operations, marketing and leadership teams. You understand your critical part in the overall machine, graciously accepting thoughts and feedback from others while offering your own expertise where you can. You pride yourself on being “overly communicative” -- keeping everyone up to date with the latest social marketing wins, losses, and initiatives.

You are comfortable working remotely as part of a small team, with a high level of autonomy. You can devise your own schedule and effectively manage your workload based on the biggest opportunities and company objectives.

When you’re in the wrong or make a mistake you can admit it. You can articulate why it happened and how you’ve learned from the experience. 

Your timezone location is not important as long as you are available for calls with leadership during business hours in Sydney Australia.

Above all, you understand that your success—and our success—hinges on the satisfaction and loyalty of our customers. 

Corner the market[ing]

MitoHQ is a social enterprise and is driven by community. One of the most important aspects to marketing is the effective use of social channels to build brand awareness, educate consumers and health practitioners, drive engagement and ultimately help reverse chronic disease.

We are looking for someone with a proven track record with Managing Social media channels including: Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn. In order for us to help 100 million people over the next 11 years we really need to build a strong community.

Key objectives and responsibilities for this will be to:

  • Create social content (Blog posts will be written by our team inhouse who are quantum biologists). So you will need to slice and dice this content to be more social friendly, including headlines, and image creation.
  • Identify target customers on social channels
  • Promote content to the right audiences
  • Build brand awareness
  • Schedule content daily
  • Fine tune the social content strategy
  • Develop and implement an effective engagement strategy
  • Develop and implement an effective conversion strategy 
  • Measure, and analyze ROI
  • Design campaigns that attract, engage and convert
  • Monitor, listen and respond to users in a “Social” way while cultivating leads and sales.
  • Conduct online advocacy and open a stream for cross-promotions.
  • Develop and expand community
  • Oversee design (ie: Facebook Timeline cover, profile pic, thumbnails, ads, etc)
  • Monitor online reviews and respond to each review.
  • Analyze key metrics and tweak strategy as needed.
  • Become an advocate for the company in social media spaces, engaging in dialogues and answering questions where appropriate on Facebook, Reddit, Quora etc.
  • Monitor trends in social media tools, applications, channels, design and strategy.
  • Identify threats and opportunities in user-generated content surrounding the company. Report notable threats.
  • Analyze campaigns and translate anecdotal or qualitative data into recommendations and plans for revising social media, content marketing, SEO and social advertising campaigns.
  • Monitor effective benchmarks (Best Practices) for measuring the impact of social media campaigns. Analyze, review, and report on effectiveness of campaigns in an effort to maximize results.

items.title: Wild West Media: Advertising Data Entry Assistant
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Advertising Data Entry Assistant

Who We Are

Wild West Media provides competitive advertising strategies to the top 1% of Amazon Sellers. We create, manage, and optimize high performing pay-per-click campaigns driven by advanced market intelligence. We are a service business, partnering with our clients to scale their businesses and achieve their desired outcomes. We immerse ourselves in advanced advertising strategy to provide our clients with a competitive advantage.

Who You Are

Our agency is looking for an experienced Data Entry Professional to do keyword research, competitive analysis, and performance reporting for our rapidly growing client accounts. You have extensive experience with data mining and organization and are familiar with advanced filters, formulas, and formatting techniques. 

You’re someone with confidence in your ability to solve problems. You have the attitude that if you don’t know the answer, you’ll find the answer. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and pride yourself on both time-efficiency and meticulous attention to detail. 

The Amazon Advertising platform is relatively new and constantly evolving and changing. Even though we offer a remote opportunity, we work in a highly collaborative environment. You will be accountable for the client's campaign performance, execution of regular optimization and strategy, and communicating with the team.

Data Entry Assistant Responsibilities:

  • Download and compile reports from the Amazon Advertising platform
  • Research and compile competitive analysis data from Amazon.com
  • Organize and structure keyword research lists from multiple paid data sources
  • Filter and group large data files in Google Sheets
  • Import and format final data views into AirTable (AirTable training provided)
  • Update advertising reports and dashboards for client review
  • Upload bulk campaign data to the Amazon Advertising platform
  • Track and report product ranking from Amazon and Google search results

Data Entry Assistant Requirements:

  • 5+ years data entry experience
  • Proficient in Google Sheets and Excel
  • High degree of competence in organizing large data sets
  • Detail-oriented to ensure numbers and formulas are accurate and error-free
  • Understand how to apply and revise mathematical formulas in spreadsheets
  • Ability to complete repetitive tasks consistently and on deadline
  • Habitually check, and double-check work
  • Skilled at spotting outliers and discrepancies in the data and correcting them
  • Interested in applying your skills to Amazon, Ecommerce, and digital advertising projects
  • Airtable experience a plus, but not required

Wild West Media values and rewards loyalty and hard work. We’re committed to creating great work experiences for our team with opportunities for advancement. 

____________
Wild West Media has been scaling search and display campaigns in competitive markets for 15+ years. We've spent the last three years focused solely on Amazon Advertising, developing and executing winning pay-per-click campaigns for the top private label brands.  If you’re interested in learning more about Wild West Media’s advertising philosophy and strategy, here’s a link to our CEO, Cherie Yvette, presenting on Amazon Advertising:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SyD0JjNbVic&t=58s

If you are interested in this opportunity, please e-mail a resumé and cover letter, including details about yourself and your data entry experience, to cherie@theurbancowgirl.com.

Amazon Advertising Lead

Who We Are

Wild West Media provides competitive advertising strategies to the top 1% of Amazon Sellers. We create, manage, and optimize high performing pay-per-click campaigns driven by advanced market intelligence. We are a service business, partnering with our clients to scale their businesses and achieve their desired outcomes. We immerse ourselves in advanced advertising strategy to provide our clients with a competitive advantage.

Who You Are

Our agency is looking for an experienced Amazon Advertising strategist to manage our rapidly growing client accounts. You have experience managing Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, and DSP display media at scale.

You’re someone with confidence in your ability to solve problems. You have the attitude that if you don’t know the answer, you’ll find the answer. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy the challenges of converting paid traffic to sales.

The Amazon Advertising platform is relatively new and constantly evolving and changing. Even though we offer a remote opportunity, we work in a highly collaborative environment. You will be accountable for the client's campaign performance, execution of regular optimization and strategy, and communicating with the team.

Amazon Advertising Lead Responsibilities:

  • Create structured and organized pay-per-click campaigns
  • Understand search algorithms, keyword queries, and shopper behavior
  • Leverage advanced bidding strategies to secure top ad positions
  • Develop and test new strategies to improve campaign performance

  • Optimize clients’ advertising performance across all Amazon Advertising platforms - Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, AMS Product Display, and DSP Programmatic
  • Consistently add new search terms, keywords, and targeting for scale
  • Develop a deep understanding of clients’ brands, products, and competitors

Amazon Advertising Lead Requirements:

Wild West Media values loyalty and hard work. We’re committed to creating great work experiences for our team with opportunities for advancement.
____________

Wild West Media has been scaling search and display campaigns in competitive markets for 15+ years. We've spent the last three years focused solely on Amazon Advertising, developing and executing winning pay-per-click campaigns for the top private label brands.  If you’re interested in learning more about Wild West Media’s advertising philosophy and strategy, here’s a link to our CEO, Cherie Yvette, presenting on Amazon Advertising:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SyD0JjNbVic&t=58s

If you are interested in this opportunity, please e-mail a resumé and cover letter, including details about yourself and your pay-per-click advertising experience, to cherie@theurbancowgirl.com. Please include details of advertising campaigns you’ve scaled successfully on Amazon.

items.title: The Otaku Box: E-commerce Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
E-commerce Marketing Manager

We’re hiring an E-commerce marketing manager to head the E-commerce team for a company that specializes in anime products and Asian snacks! You’ll be managing a digital marketing team of about ten people, and be expected to drive sales and prove your ROI. This is a great role for someone who wants to get stuff done with minimal input and is confident about driving sales. This isn’t a good role if you want to be told what to do or don’t want to have to perform.

First, here’s what we’re NOT looking for:
We're not looking for someone who needs to be told what to do or what to create. We're not looking for someone who needs to be managed. We're looking for someone who can set, measure, and meet KPIs, with a very high attention to detail and manage a team to get it all done. You should be able to conceptualize, create, measure, report, and optimize entire journeys / funnels without being told what, when, or how - we will not hold your hand or micromanage you. You'll be required to perform (and prove it), and you'll be well compensated for great performance. Making stuff happen and increasing sales will be 100% your responsibility. If this doesn't sound like your cup of tea, stop reading now.

Here’s what we ARE looking for:
Someone who knows how to produce sales in E-commerce! You’ll be managing products on Shopify and creating/optimizing a wide variety of marketing using ManyChat, OctaneAI, Drip, Shopify apps, and more, connected by zapier, webhooks, and whatever else it takes to get the job done. You’ll be managing and working closely with a digital marketing team and outside agencies that includes PPC marketers, graphics designers, SEO specialists, and ambassadors.

Bottom line: you’ll be doing what it takes to produce sales, as well as reporting on it so you can optimize further. When you apply, make sure to link to your portfolio and/or summary of your past experience (make sure it includes your ROI and how you measured it). Don’t send a LinkedIn link or similar BS. 

Job Details:
This is a fully remote, contract position with a potential for regular bumps in salary based on performance, paid via bank transfer monthly. We don’t require you to be anywhere in particular or care where you're from or where you live.

Here are some of the things you'll be doing:

  • Assisting with branding: look/feel, target audience personas, copy, etc

  • Lots of marketing automation buildout, ongoing optimization, and reporting: Email/Messenger/SMS using Drip and OctaneAI

  • Leading a digital marketing team to successfully execute and report on your marketing strategies

  • Performing CRO (and everything that entails) using Google Optimize and HotJar

  • Creating polls/surveys and more to find out as much as possible about our current target audience, as well as experimenting with new audiences / personas

  • Creating entire lead generation sequences (Content > Optin > Extra Data Collection > Lead Magnet Deliverable > Targeted Followup Lead Nurture, and then ongoing optimization and reporting on this)

  • E-commerce website product management and optimization

Here are some of the tools you'll be using and should be familiar with already or learn really fast:

  • HotJar

  • Drip

  • OctaneAI and ManyChat (we’d really love it if you have experience with one of these )

  • Typeform or similar

  • Airtable

  • Asana

  • Shopify (Shopify experience is required) /ReCharge

  • Zapier (zapier experience is required)

  • Google Optimize

Here are some of the KPI's and reporting you'll be expected to provide:

  • E-commerce sales and subscriptions

  • Leads generated

  • Ongoing measurement, reporting, and optimization of sales funnels

  • Product performance and ROI

What we require from a successful applicant:

  • At least a few years of experience generating a provable ROI in E-commerce

  • Experience working remotely with Asana

  • Experience with Zapier

  • Incredible attention to detail

What would earn you bonus points during the hiring process:

  • Experience in the Gaming, Anime or Asian snack niche

  • Solid experience with OctaneAI

  • Solid experience with Google Optimize

What we don't do:

  • We don't micromanage

  • We don't waste your or our time with “company culture”

  • We don't use slack, much less waste time in it. How awesome is that?! Really freaking awesome.

  • We don't make you physically show up anywhere or to anything, ever.

  • We don’t really do meetings, so you’re going to need to be very good at taking the initiative and getting stuff done with minimal input.

That means that you:

  • Must be incredibly self-motivated and really eager to create (and prove) your ROI

  • Must be very communicative in Asana

  • Will work closely with the owners

  • Have to be stoked about working in a position that requires you to perform and rewards you for it

  • Shouldn't care about fluff (think: anything done by a Silicon Valley startup...) and should care about ROI

Perks:

  • Hardware & software if/as needed

  • Free Asian stuff if you want it

  • 100% remote.

  • No BS, just performance. Good performance? Earn more cash. We’re big on providing frequent and permanent raises for killer performance.

  • Everything listed in “What we don't do” (see above)

Apply here:https://rhinodigital.typeform.com/to/C6xnyC

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Paid Media/SEO Manager at Fertility Bridge

Remote

Location: Remote US or Canada

About the Position

Using Your Passion For Data to Help Build Families

You will work directly with the entire Fertility Bridge team, as we continue to build Fertility Bridge into the team of marketers who are better than anyone on the planet at listening to people dealing with infertility. Your role is very multi-faceted, and will continually evolve. You will be responsible for digital advertising, Search Engine Optimization, marketing automation, and reporting of every kind. Your job is to help both us and our clients reach our clients and patients more quickly, effectively, and efficiently. You have to make our reporting easier to understand. You have to find the best stories from our data and you have to find more and better data to make our work more effective. The role requires more flexibility than a rubber stretch-arm strong doll, because Fertility Bridge is constantly growing! In fact, you will very likely be creating many of the process that you and others follow.

Who are you?

You are extremely creative, even-tempered, respectful, and have solid experience in social media marketing, content writing, video, and design. You are also flexible and eager to play a creative role in the growth of Fertility Bridge as a company.

Core Responsibilities
  • Analytics
  • Marketing Automation
  • Reporting
  • Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
  • Search Engine Marketing (SEM)/Paid Search
  • Paid Social Media
The tasks at hand for this role:
  • Assist in creation of detailed SEO recommendations
    • Develop keyword strategies for optimal on-site performance
    • Provide detailed site analysis
    • Provide actionable competitive analysis
    • Develop detailed recommendations for site changes
    • Develop a comprehensive backlink strategy
    • Execute recommended SEO optimizations
    • Prioritize initiatives by difficulty and impact
  • Monitor progress and adjusting the optimization strategy accordingly
    • Establish SEO audit baselines
    • Establish SEO performance baselines
    • QA all SEO recommendations, before and after launch
    • Monitor client site and competitor site changes
    • Analyze monthly search engine performance reports to determine impact of previous optimization and if new optimizations are needed
  • Manage multiple clients’ PPC accounts on Google AdWords across various industries and geographies
  • Develop accounts and campaigns from scratch using the SKAG and SPAG methodology
  • Perform daily, weekly and monthly optimizations based on the performance of the account and the client’s goals
  • Provide recommendations on opportunities identified based on the client’s goals and performance
  • Conduct comprehensive AdWord audit to identify areas of strength weakness and opportunities
  • Collaborate with other team members to continue to meet and exceed the client’s goals
  • You are expected to be able to provide counsel, digital marketing ideas, or solutions to any challenges that may arise.
  • You don’t need to be a coder, but you do need to know your way around WordPress
  • We will teach you what we know. It is your job to stay abreast of the rapidly changing marketing landscape, and help us update our processes.
  • You may perform any of these tasks for Fertility Bridges’ content properties, as the phrase “the shoemaker’s kids walk barefoot” is sometimes a fair jab.
  • We’re a teensy tiny company and probably will be for a while. You will likely be asked to fill other roles.
  • Anything else the founder dreams up
Key Questions 
  • Do you have:
    • a minimum of 3 years of experience running and managing AdWords campaigns
    • Google AdWords certification
    • Excellent client service & communication skills
    • Quantitative and analytics skills, with the ability to draw conclusions based on data
    • Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and deliver to expected deadlines
    • Fundamental knowledge of ad targeting methodologies
  • Are you self–motivated and able to take initiative to get the job done?
  • Can you communicate easily, credibly, and pleasantly with anyone under the sun?
  • Do you have high emotional intelligence and are capable of delicately communicating with people struggling with infertility?
  • Are you at ease interfacing with other experts such as designers, coders, writers, and managers?
  • Are you at ease interfacing with clients?
  • Can you observe, analyze, and understand the data from Google Analytics, Facebook, and other digital advertising reports?
  • Are you comfortable thinking through greater marketing and business objectives while still managing the day to day project management aspects of accounts?
  • Can you manage your own time effectively and work well with a team to make sure projects stay on schedule and budget?
  • Are you comfortable having brave conversations with your boss to express your own concerns and feedback as well as receive them?
  • If you’re not sure about your answer to any of these questions, are you excited by the challenge of learning how to develop these new skills?

If you answered “yes” to these questions, we want to meet you!

If you’re not sure about your answer to any of these questions, are you excited by the challenge of learning how to develop these new skills? If you answered “yes” to these questions, I want to meet you!

At Fertility Bridge, we are committed to deeply understanding the needs of people dealing with infertility, and knowing what clinics need to do to meet those needs. We live by our values. We maintain our Learning Culture by continuing to explore the needs of fertility clinics, people coping with infertility, and invest in training and education.

Our Hiring Process

We’re excited to have the right people be a part of Fertility Bridge. We like to work first with independent contractors so that we don’t have to be your only client and vise-versa. This way, you exchange your time in hours and we exchange an hourly rate while we see if the relationship is a good fit for both of us.

If both of us decide that we would like to pursue the prospect of full time employment, our process consists of several interviews, an analysis of your career history, and in-depth reference checks.  We respect your time and appreciate your participation in our process.  We want you to find the ideal position for your skillset and strengths.

How to Apply

If you feel you can contribute to a dynamic, growing company, please begin your application process by sending an email to Griffin Jones at careers@fertilitybridge.com with your resume, a brief cover letter, and which of our core values resonated the most with you.

Thank you for your interest in serving the infertility community through a creative, business-centered approach!

Location: US or Canada Only

Apply for job

items.content:
Marketing Manager – DACH

United Kingdom, Birmingham
Company: Wallace Hind Selection

Overview

Do you want to join an award winning business? Be part of a small, close knit team working on international marketing projects? Join us as our Marketing Manager and earn a great salary creating and managing campaigns across the DACH region at the forefront of our industry.

SALARY: Up to £55,000

BENEFITS:
· Company Bonus
· Personal Bonus – Linked to performance / KPI
· 25 Days Holiday + Bank Holidays
· Access to company pension scheme

LOCATION: Ideally, you will be based within a commutable distance to our Manchester Office. That said, for a superstar, we are open to someone based remotely.

COMMUTABLE LOCATIONS: Manchester, London, UK Wide

JOB DESCRIPTION: Marketing Manager – DACH : SaaS Software / Supply Chain and Logistics

We are a global business who are a ‘challenger’ within the Supply Chain and Logistics Technology space. We pride ourselves on our ability to be agile, challenge the status quo and be relentless in the pursuit of innovation. Within this role, we would love to find someone who shares the same values as us.

You will be responsible for the planning and execution for our field marketing, events and campaigns across the DACH region (Germany, Austria, Switzerland).

You will be working closely with our global marketing, account development and sales teams. Reporting to the Director of Field Marketing, you will be responsible for writing and translating campaigns into German so it is imperative that your German language skills are excellent – minimum ‘Proficient User C1/C2’.

As a team, we welcome fresh and innovative ideas to improve our service offering. That being said, this is not a purely ‘fluffy’ marketing role – you will need to be analytical; process orientated and have a strong commercial mindset / focus on ROI delivery.

We are genuinely open as to the background of this individual. As long as you can demonstrate your B2B Field Marketing, Campaigns and Events experience you could come from a huge array of industries.

Any experience of the following sectors would be an obvious advantage: Software, SaaS, Logistics, Supply Chain, Transport, 3PL, 4PL, Automotive, Industrial, Manufacturing, Industry 4.0, IoT, retail.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Marketing Manager – DACH : SaaS Software / Supply Chain and Logistics

Your day to day responsibilities will include:
· Design and implementation of our ‘Go To Market’ Strategy for the DACH region
· Event Campaign Management – which will include up to 20% travel
· Lead generation for our Sales Team

PERSON SPECIFICATION: Marketing Manager – DACH : SaaS Software / Supply Chain and Logistics

· You MUST be fluent in German as you will be writing and translating technical documentation
· Strong experience of B2B Field Marketing including campaigns, events and ‘Go to Market’ strategies.
· You must be willing to travel up to 20% across the DACH region, which will vary depending on event season (roughly once or twice a month)

THE COMPANY:

We are a multi award winning global business, employing over 1,100 people worldwide. We offer a wide range of cloud-based solutions for the Logistics, Transportation and Supply Chain Software Space. We support more than 7,500 global customers each year by optimising their supply chains with our solutions.

We pride ourselves on giving best-in-class customer experience as well as making our own workplace an exciting and fun place to work. Our culture within the Marketing Team can be best described as: Conscientious, Collaborative, Process Driven, Fun and Results Orientated.

It is highly likely you will have worked in any of the following roles and/or markets, and worked with the following products and/or services: Marketing Manager, Events Manager, B2B Marketing, Go to market, Market Strategy, Account Management, Marketing Consultant, Product Marketing Manager, Program Marketing Manager, SaaS, Software, LaaS, Logistics, Supply Chain, Lead Generation, Marketing Manager, DACH region, Campaign Manager, Marketing Executive, Distribution, 3PL, 4PL, Freight Forwarder, Transport, Freight Transport, Freight Management, Industrial, Manufacturing, Automotive, IoT, Internet of Things, Industry 4.0, Road Transport, Road Logistics, Sea Transport, Air Transport, Air Logistics, Shipping, NVOCC, Carrier Forwarding, Shipping Liners,

INTERESTED? Please click apply. You will receive an acknowledgement of your application.

Please Note: Wallace Hind Selection have been chosen as the retained recruitment partner of our client and therefore any direct applications to our client from candidates or agencies will be forwarded on to us direct.

RE: AD

Apply for job

items.content:
Bioinformatics Analyst II, III at Jackson Laboratory

Remote

Job Locations: US-ME-Bar Harbor | US-Remote

Job ID: 2019-26937

Category: Biostatistician, Computational Scientist, Scientific Software Engineer

Summary

The Carter Lab is seeking a Bioinformatics Analyst to join our research in the genetics and genomics of Alzheimer’s disease. This position will focus on using bioinformatics and computational biology analyses to formulate therapeutic hypotheses to be tested in animal models. This analysis is a critical component of our goal to integrate diverse data resources, screen candidate compounds, and translate findings into preclinical tests using custom mouse models of disease.

Responsibilities:

  • Mining genome-scale data and interpreting results.
  • Performing statistical analysis, algorithm implementation, data visualization, and bioinformatics programming; packaging and interpreting results.
  • Coordinating data analysis across multiple collaborating institutions.
  • Mentoring junior level colleagues.
  • Presenting at seminars and assisting in research planning.

Qualifications:

  • Bioinformatics Analyst II requires a MS degree in bioinformatics or relevent biological sciences field and at least five years of professional work experience in bioinformatics.
  • Bioinformatics Analyst III requires a MS degree in bioinformatics or relevent biological sciences field and at least seven years professional work experience in bioinformatics OR a PhD in bioinformatics or relevent biological sciences field and bioinformatics postdoctoral fellowship and/or a minimum of two years of professional work experience in bioinformatics.
  • The ideal candidate will have experience in genetics and genomic analyses, with particular expertise in integrative analysis of transcriptomic, proteomic, metabolomic, and curated data.
  • Experience in Alzheimer’s disease research is preferred but not required.

We are open to considering partial or full remote work for the right candidate.

About Us

The Jackson Laboratory is a nonprofit biomedical research institute with over 2,000 employees whose mission is to discover precise genomic solutions for human disease and empower the global biomedical community in the shared quest to improve human health. A National Cancer Institute-designated Cancer Center, JAX has a mammalian genetics headquarters in Bar Harbor, Maine, a facility in Sacramento, California, and a genomic medicine facility, The Jackson Laboratory for Genomic Medicine (JAX-GM), in Farmington, Connecticut.

The Jackson Laboratory’s 43-acre scenic Bar Harbor campus is nestled between the Gulf of Maine and the mountains of Acadia National Park. Some of the best hiking and biking in the world (over 50 square miles of mountains, lakes, views, and dramatic coastline) is accessible from our campus. We are one mile from downtown Bar Harbor, which offers a vibrant downtown district with a plethora of restaurants, shops, museums, and galleries.

JAX employees work in a collaborative, value-driven, and team-based environment where the focus is on advancing science and improving patients’ lives. Researchers apply genetics to increase the understanding of human disease and advance treatments and cures for cancer, neurological and immune disorders, diabetes, aging, and heart disease. JAX was voted among the top 15 “Best Places to Work in Academia” in the United States in a poll conducted by The Scientist magazine!

Our Values:

INTEGRITY – Courage and commitment to do what is right

PEOPLE – Inspiring our people to enhance the health of all

ONE TEAM – Unified by our promise to transform medicine and science

EXCELLENCE – Achieving world-class results

INNOVATION – Leading with discovery and creative solutions

STEWARDSHIP – Caring for and enhancing the resources entrusted to us

What do we have to offer?

JAX offers a dynamic and supportive work environment, competitive salaries, and a comprehensive benefits package, including a medical plan, outstanding retirement plan, generous paid time off, and tuition reimbursement including an MBA program. Our campus offers a fitness center with an award-winning wellness program, an onsite full service cafeteria, and a fully operational primary care facility available to employees and their families.

Most importantly, every position contributes to JAX’s mission of discovering precise genomic solutions for human disease and empowering the global biomedical community in our shared quest to improve human health.

The Jackson Laboratory provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, age, mental disability, physical disability, medical condition, gender, sexual orientation, genetic information, ancestry, marital status, national origin, veteran status, and other classifications protected by applicable state and local non-discrimination laws.

Apply for job

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER | REMOTE | MONETIZE AND RUN MY EMAIL LIST Howdy, I have a nicely running ...
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER | REMOTE | MONETIZE AND RUN MY EMAIL LIST

Howdy, I have a nicely running content site which sells PDF plans. I have done ZERO to develop or monetize the emails of customers and prospective customers. I have emails from thousands of paying customers, and could easily generate emails from offering samples etc.

The site generates money but not enough for me to focus on it. But I'd gladly give someone 100% of the first year revenue with a reasonable tail to create some sort of monetization strategy off of my emails. Basically be the CEO of the email business. First year you keep 100% of what you make, 2nd year some tail to be negotiated. (Also same deal for any other incremental business you figure out how to run off the back of the site.)

This is not about technical know how (easily could hook it up to mailchimp or whatever.) This is about developing the strategy and revenue stream to make any email strategy worthwhile.

email service at spidercarts.com if you're interested!

items.title: Social Media and Content Marketing Intern/Volunteer
items.content:
BE PART OF THE GAME

Ambitious nut wanted with a knowledge and passion for startups to help running Tryatec's Social Media and Content Marketing, and to grow our community.

The successful applicant will benefit from flexibility between working remotely and a great office in the heart of London’s Tech City, between Angel and Old Street, as well as:

• Stock options
• Commission-based bonuses
• Free breakfast
• Free snacks
• Free drinks
• Regular team lunches
• Flexible working hours
• Tryatec’s love

ABOUT US
Tryatec is revolutionising the electronics industry. It is the B2C, C2C online marketplace for renting the latest tech gadgets, such as drones, VR/AR gear and professional cameras. Gadget owners can safely lend out their gadgets and earn money, while borrowers can rent these gadgets for a small rental fee.

Tryatec is awarded multiple times and supported by companies and institutions, such as Santander, SUEZ UK, and Advance London. It’s an exciting time to join us: We’ve launched Tryatec.com in 2018 and now grow our community. The team that you will be working with consists of 3 team members, with background and experience in business, law and IT Engineering.


ABOUT THE ROLE
Own ideas and creativity always wanted!

Typically you will:
 • Work strategically alongside our team’s CEO and COO making key decision to market and grow Tryatec
• Take care of content planning, creation, and social media  
• Develop strategies to grow the platform’s user base, and improve the CRM system
• Keep knowledge of products & industry up-to-date  
• You’ll also need to have the necessary permissions to work in the UK.

THE PERFECT CANDIDATE We want bright, passionate individuals of all creeds and colours for our roles! Ideally you:
• Have a passion for technology
• Experience in social media marketing
• Experience in blogging and/or video content creation
• Strong communication and networking skills
• An entrepreneurial attitude
• Strong time management and organisational skills

items.content:
Location:


Desana is based in London, Edinburgh, and Stockholm but the role can be location independent for the right person.


Contract:


Part-time / freelance. Could be full-time for the right person.


Description:


We want to give people the freedom to access the world’s best work spaces, anywhere, any time, at the touch of a button. Communicating to the world is at the heart of delivering that. 


We’re a growing startup so we’re looking for a well rounded Marketing Manager capable of growing our brand with us from the ground up.


About us:


Desana gives people access to a network of great work space when they want it, where they want it, through a single monthly subscription.


We’re a growing startup based between London, Edinburgh, and Stockholm. We aim to become a globally relevant company by disrupting the way people think about, and access, the places they work. We're looking for the best people to join us on our journey.


The Role:


Marketing done well isn’t always marketing done by the book. It’s out-of-the-box, inherently unique thinking that makes the biggest impact. You’ll be involved in everything from ideation, design, delivery, testing, and monitoring of our multi-channel campaigns.


Marketing


Flex your creativity. We want to build a brand that’s memorable and impactful. To do that, we need someone that has a diverse background in marketing and is motivated to:



  • Develop a detailed understanding of the business and consumer groups to design and execute data driven go-to-market strategies specific to our core market segments.

  • Run and monitor paid search, paid social, email marketing and multi-channel based onboarding based on the above.

  • Work with the team to generate creative ideas to identify new, high impact ways (and channels) to grow the business and engage potential customers.

  • Develop strong brand identity that can effectively be communicated to key market segments  in the medium and long-term.

  • Identify, evaluate, and optimise opportunities for partnerships and marketing channels. 

  • Develop public image through strategically implemented press, media, website, and social content. 

  • Work with photographers and videographers to create high-quality, engaging media. 

  • Create and manage a content calendar for analytically focussed, multi-channel marketing campaigns.

  • Cultivate new media relationships and contacts within business and industry media.

  • Support the management team in advance of interviews, co-creating material and assisting with preparation. 

  • Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly meetings that effectively communicate data informed outcomes from marketing strategies.


Communication



  • Working directly with team to consistently improve brand and customer experience / interaction. 

  • Regular monitoring and updating of our task management system.

  • Participate daily in a 10 minute whole team “stand up” call, wherever you are.


Industry Awareness



  • Consistently develop wider awareness of customer segment trends; meticulous attention to specific triggers for customer types. 

  • Be able to identify and respond to micro-indicators of change.


About You:



  • You have demonstrable marketing experience: 2-3 years in driving growth, preferably for startup and scaleup businesses.

  • You know what’s effective: you have prior experience with marketing automation platforms, CDPs, and attribution tools and are able to make good recommendations on different platforms.

  • You’re data-driven: you understand growth metrics, A/B testing, and statistics and you’ve delivered effective data-driven strategies and marketing campaigns across multiple media channels for for the companies you’ve worked with.

  • You can design: not essential for the role but it would be extremely advantageous if you have design experience that can be applied directly to content creation.

  • You have CRM experience / awareness: particularly Hubspot. Not essential but would be really useful.

  • You’re personable: a fun, enthusiastic people-person.

  • You’re self-starting & self-motivated: you’re confident in your abilities, willing to lead, to take on responsibilities, and manage your own agendas and work scopes. Actively seek and respond to feedback.

  • You can communicate diligently: you’re able to understand the importance of maintaining regular communication with our team, our partners, affiliates, and our customers.

  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

  • You’re never complacent: you strive to recognise that things can always be better than they currently are and have the confidence to present solutions to any weaknesses or inefficiencies that you see.

  • You have a growth mindset: a desire to grow both personally and professionally.


Desana Benefits:



  • Share options in the business.

  • Flexible and remote work hours with a strong focus on work-life balance.

  • We’ll pay you fairly to match your experience and we’re establishing complete salary transparency across the company with clear progression paths.

  • Team drinks, events and trips.

  • Free access to the app and our network of workspaces.


Think you're the right person for the role? Send us your CV and a brief cover letter and tell us why.

items.content:
Product Designer, Talent at Stack Overflow

Remote | High-paying | International

at Stack Overflow
Anywhere (Remote or In Office, US & EU Time Zones)
$99-122k

Stack Overflow exists to serve developers. Whether we’re helping them get answers to their questions or find a new job, we build products that millions of developers use. As a designer at Stack Overflow, you’ll create and build products that directly impact the work and the lives of those developers.

In this particular role, you’ll be working alongside a small team dedicated to the Talent and Jobs product. We’re constantly exploring new directions for our products and working towards creating a more enjoyable experience for recruiters and developers alike. This is a great opportunity to work on a product with a wide variety of features and complex problems with a team that’s excited to solve them. And as a member of the product design team, you’ll also spend lots of time working with us, whether that’s contributing to our design system, participating in critique, or just hanging out with us in Slack. We’re a team that rejects competition between designers and instead embraces collaboration and is always looking for ways to teach and help each other.

We’re looking for a generalist – someone who has or wants the skills to do everything from research to early-stage design explorations to high-fidelity prototypes and mockups and front-end development. But most importantly, we’re looking for someone who’s excited to join our small team, to dig into big projects, and to learn and grow with us.

While we’re very open to hiring remote (almost everyone on the design team is remote!), we need your working hours to overlap with (at least) the hours of 10AM – 1PM US Eastern time.

Skills & Requirements
What you’ll do:

  • Follow our fast-moving product development process in close collaboration with your product team
  • Identify when user research and experience design methods are necessary, and conduct or help conduct that discovery work
  • Design high-quality visuals, interactions, workflows, and copy that are user-centered and consistent with our design language
  • Use your design work appropriately in context with the overall product and business goals to impact and drive product strategy
  • Write (or learn how to write) clean and maintainable front-end code
  • Contribute to a collaborative and inclusive team environment where design ideas and feedback are shared openly and with the best intentions

What we want to see:

  • Between 2-5 years of product design experience
  • Evidence of thoughtful, thorough experience design work
  • Evidence of internally consistent and high-quality visual designs
  • Experience with or interest in user research methods
  • Experience with or interest in learning basic front-end development (HTML, CSS, some JavaScript)
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Experience with (or the desire for) working in a distributed environment (where most team members are remote)
  • High levels of organization and ability to work independently
  • Bonus: experience with designing for developers or other technical audiences
  • Bonus: experience working on B2B products
  • Bonus: experience using (and/or contributing to) design systems

Also note:

  • If this job interests you but you aren’t certain if you meet all of the requirements, apply anyway!
  • We don’t consider applications without cover letters – please make sure to include yours and talk about why you want to work here!

What you’ll get in return:

  • Flexible hours
  • 20 days paid vacation + holidays
  • Completely free health insurance – no copay, no premiums (US residents)
  • Generous parental leave (10-16 weeks at 100% pay), family care leave, and unlimited sick days
  • Employees will never be poked with a sharp stick

If you want to work remotely…. We’ll help you set up a great home office, with an ergonomic chair, standing desk, and any other equipment you need to do your job.

If you want to work in our office… You’ll get your own private office in our headquarters in New York City, and enjoy additional benefits like free lunch every day prepared by our own in-house chefs, transportation reimbursement, and all the espresso you can drink.

About Stack Overflow
Stack Overflow is the largest, most trusted online community for developers to learn, share their knowledge, and build their careers. More than 50 million professional and aspiring programmers visit Stack Overflow each month to help solve coding problems, develop new skills, and find job opportunities.

We partner with businesses to help them understand, hire, engage, and enable the world’s developers. Our products and services are focused on developer marketing, technical recruiting, market research, and enterprise knowledge sharing.

We believe in hiring smart people and getting out of their way. We have an office in New York with some of the best amenities of any New York startup, and we have people who work remotely all over the world. We keep meetings and ceremony to an absolute minimum.

Employment is conditioned upon successful completion of a background check and upon having the appropriate legal right to work.

What we value:

  • Servant Leadership: We lead by empowering and inspiring people to do their best work, not by micromanaging. We hire smart people, set them up for success, then get out of their way.
  • Collaboration: The best products are created when people from different backgrounds and disciplines work closely together in an environment of respect and trust.
  • Transparency: Trust is built on openness and transparency. If there is not a good reason to keep it a secret, we share it. For example, we share our complete engineering salary formula.
  • Inclusion: We do our best work when we can be our whole selves at work. We’re committed to policies and benefits that support people, and leaders who foster an open and inclusive culture.

Diverse teams build better products.

Legally, we need you to know this:
Stack Exchange, Inc. does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. We support workplace diversity.

But we want to add this:
We strongly believe that diversity contributes to a broader collective perspective that will consistently lead to a better company and better products. We are working hard to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it.

Apply for job

items.content:
Product Manager, Advertising

Marketing
US or EU Time Zones
Company: Stack Overflow
Full Time

Overview

Salary: $110,000 – $160,000

At Stack Overflow, our mission is to serve developers. Whether we’re helping developers , , or , we build products that make millions of developers’ lives better every day. We’re looking for a Product Manager to join our team, working on our product suite.

get public answers to their questionswork more efficiently with their teamfind a new jobDeveloper Advertising 

StackOverflow.com today has over 17 million question and answer pairs, sees 50 million unique visitors a month, and has been visited over 12 billion times in the past decade.  You’ll be leading the Advertising product experience for businesses who want to reach developers on one of the largest, most engaging developer sites on the internet. The Advertising product team is responsible for managing the various digital ad types advertisers can buy on Stack Overflow. The ideal candidate has deep domain expertise and experience building products used by advertisers and is excited to grow and improve our existing product suite.

You’ll have the opportunity to do a lot. You can expect during your first year:

  • Get onboarded and brought up to speed on our current plans. You’ll spend a lot of time learning about our products, building rapport with the product, engineering, sales, marketing, and support teams, and contributing to small features.
    • First Month:
    • Acquire a deep understanding through past and new user research of the biggest opportunities to serve different segments of our users.  This will include improving the current product suite through extensive testing, iteration and working with our data science team and stakeholders to analyze and deliver new versions of the product to customers. You’ll design tests, build prototypes, talk with users, write specs and pitch projects to your team and the company.
      • Next 3 Months: 
      •  You can expect to start taking a leadership role developing the long term roadmap for the Advertising product team. You’ll be involved not just in product development, but in defining long term strategy, improving our processes, and advocating for targeted and relevant content for developers that use Stack Overflow.
        • Next 8 months:

        We like to work in public. Not only does that mean being open within the company about what the product team is building, we also try and bring the developer community in as soon as we’re able.  Here are some examples of how we have done this historically:

        • 2019 Developer Survey
        • All sites will be switching to Ad Servers
        • How We Make Money at Stack Overflow: 2016 Edition
        • Introducing Text Ads! AKA Sponsoring That Fine Manual!

          Most of the Ads team works out of New York, so being co-located is preferred. However, we’re looking to hire the best person wherever you are in the world.  so you can work from home and interact with the team over Google Hangouts and chat, usually during US or European working hours. We have offices in New York, London and Munich, so if you’re in (or want to relocate to) one of those cities you can, and .

          We work remotelyour offices are awesome

          Skills & Requirements:

          What you’ll do:
          • Help set the product strategy for Stack Overflow Ads, and lead the team that is executing on that strategy
          • Contribute to user research and customer segmentation to understand the needs of our customers and developers that consume ad content.
          • Propose new products and features and pitch them to the company and community
          • Start with high-level goals, turn them into detailed functional specs, and work with developers and designers to create rapid prototypes
          • Define and monitor metrics to determine the effectiveness of ad types, and administer split tests to learn whether a change is an improvement
          • Interact with our community of developers to gather ideas and feedback
          • Support go-to-market strategies with the marketing and customer success teams

            • What we want to see:
            • A track record of coming up with ideas for, building, and shipping digital and mobile advertising products.
            • Hands on experience with ad server and targeting technologies, specifically Double Click for Publishers and Google Ad Manager.
            • Minimum of 4 years as a product manager/product owner
            • A deep understanding of the digital Advertising industry, best practices, trends, and products
            • Excellent spec-writing and UX skills
            • An understanding of the technical implications of what you ask the team to do
            • Excellent telecommuting skills. Even if you work from one of our offices, many of our team members are remote
            • Experience with usability testing and A/B tests
            • Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly through written word (whether that’s meta or forum posts, specs, blogging, or anything else)

              • If this job interests you but you aren’t certain if you meet all of the requirements, !

              apply anyway

              About Stack Overflow

               is the largest, most trusted online community for developers to learn, share their knowledge, and build their careers. More than 50 million professional and aspiring programmers visit Stack Overflow each month to help solve coding problems, develop new skills, and find job opportunities.

              Stack Overflow

              We partner with businesses to help them understand, hire, engage, and enable the world’s developers. Our products and services are focused on developer marketing, technical recruiting, market research, and enterprise knowledge sharing.

              We believe in hiring smart people and getting out of their way. We have an office in New York with some of the best amenities of any New York startup, and we have people who work remotely all over the world.  We keep meetings and ceremony to an absolute minimum.

We support workplace diversity.
